loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 35 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 years and 6 months. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mwanaisha now hopes for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Flor Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Flor Violeta  A.  B. tiene veinticuatro años y vive en la Avenida Primavera sin número en el distrito de Mache , provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La libertad Perú.
Flor Violeta cursó hasta segundo año de secundaria, pero ya no siguió estudiando porque contrajo matrimonio.
Se casó a los dieciséis años con el señor William Rafael Vidal y tiene  una hija mujer y un hijo varón, todavía muy pequeños.
Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de tejas y a la compra venta de animales.
 Su primer préstamo a Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles, recuerda que compró con ello trigo, maíz y otras menestras, lo mismo que cuyes, los que volvió a vender a mayor precio. El préstamo lo devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, lo invertirá en  la compra de dos cerdos, dos ovejas y material para la elaboración de teja.  Este préstamo lo cancelará en 4 cuotas.
Flor Violeta sueña con seguir estudiando y llegar a ser una buena enfermera.
En su barrio se desempeña como una buena socia del comedor popular Corazón de María, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo y es una socia cumplida y responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Violeta A. B. is 24 years old and lives on Spring Avenue in the district of Mache, Otuzco Province, in La libertad, Perú. Flor Violeta studied through the second year of high school, but she did not continue studying after she got married. When she was 16 she married William Rafael Vidal and she has a daughter and son, both still very young. She is dedicated to making and selling tiles and to the purchase and sale of animals. Her first loan from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles (approximately $100 US), and she remembers that she purchased wheat, corn, and other basics, along with guinea pigs, which she resold for a higher price. She repaid the loan in 4 months. With her current loan request of 2000 soles ($700 US), she will invest in the purchase of pigs, two sheep, and material for making tiles. This loan will be repaid in four installments. Flor Violeta dreams of continuing her studies and becoming a good nurse. In her neighborhood she serves as a good member of the communal diner Corazón de María (Heart of María), and she also belongs to the Communal Bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Women of Work), where she is a responsible and reliable member.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals (pigs and sheep) and to purchase material for making tiles

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es: Celedonio tiene 29 años, es soltero, vive en casa de su familia. Es un joven emprendedor, trabaja en su mocarro para ganarse la vida, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana transita por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, velozmente llevando a los pasajeros que requieren de sus servicios hasta sus destinos. Al no tener esposa, ni hijos, se dedica íntegramente a su trabajo, distrayéndose con él, para espantar su soledad. Celedonio quiere tener una familia y necesita estabilidad económica para poder ofrecerles una buena calidad de vida, es por eso que trabaja arduamente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para su motocarro, y así mejorar el servicio que brinda.  Le gustaría  ampliar su negocio comprando muchos más motocarros, así obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Celedonio is 29 years old, single, and lives in his family’s home. He is a young entrepreneur, working with his motocar to earn a living. From very early in the morning, he travels the Juliaca city streets quickly taking passengers that require his services to their destinations. Having no wife or children, he dedicates himself entirely to his work keeping himself distracted by it to chase away his loneliness. Celedonio wants to have a family and needs a stable economic standing to be able to offer them a good quality of life. This is why he works arduously. With the money he is soliciting, he will buy replacement parts for his vehicle so that he can improve the service that he offers. He would like to broaden his business by buying more motocars so that he can obtain greater income.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for his motocar, which he uses for local transport of passengers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase goods such as tablecloths and bedspreads for resale

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
“Poverty is not a hindrance to success” is Nenita Y.'s philosophy of life.

Perlita is 48 years old and married to Nestor. Her husband drives their passenger tricycle from their village to the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. They are blessed with five children namely: Cherilyn – 27 years old, married, college graduate and presently working in Manila, Cleofe – 20 years old also works in Manila, Philip Mar – 18 years old still in college (3rd year), Cathel – 16 years old and senior high ,and Nestor Jr. – 8 years old and currently in grade two. They love living in the peaceful environment of Sisim Alto Tumauini, Isabela which is situated near the beautiful Abuan River.

Perlita is requesting a loan to repair their motorcycle which, along with farming, is the family's source of income.

The safety of the passenger (in the tricycle) is very important to the success of that business. “I dream to have another  passenger tricycle to be operated by my son,” said Perlita.  With another unit, they will be able to increase their daily income and sustain their basic needs and the education of their children.

loans.use: To repair transportation business equipment

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
HilA. is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. HilA. has been working as a taxi driver, and he has also owned a school bus for four years. 

HilA. requested a loan of $1200 US dollars from A. Majmoua to do some maintenance work on his school bus. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 

The loan helped him in a good way. HilA. was able to do some maintenance work on his taxi cab. HilA.'s work is speciA., because of his punctuality and his enjoyment of his work. His clients are students, friends, family members, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he lacked cash. He decided to do this work because he likes it and is especially grateful for its sustainability. In the future, he plans to purchase a bigger bus.

loans.use: Hilal needs the loan to do some maintenance work on his school bus.

loans.name: Malima

texts.en:
Malima S. is a 37-year-old trader, who is divorced and the mother of 5 children. Currently 4 of them attend school, and the oldest is learning a trade (seamstress). She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the Abofour community.

She trades in foodstuffs like bags of onions and bags of maize in the village market center. She also sells gallons of red oil to the food sellers in the surrounding towns. She treks to Kintampo to buy her stock of goods in bulk and sells them in the surrounding towns during their market days. She says through this business, she has endeavored to support 2 of her kids to finish junior high school. She requests the loan to enable her to buy increased stock of onions and maize to grow her business to boost profits. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education to give them a future and hope.

Malima is convinced that with her 4 years trade experience, when the loan is given to her she will be more resourceful to expand her business growth. She belongs to a village bank called Agnes. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: Malima wants the loan to buy cereals in bulk, such as maize.

loans.name: Nge

texts.en: S., 34, sells Khmer cakes out of her home. She is married to Rith, 33, who earns a living by making charcoal for sale. They are currently responsible for their one child who is still young and attends school. The family's living conditions are not too good because their house is small for them. They have been building a new house for one month, but right now they are lacking the money to pay for the house building, so that is why they have decided to request a loan. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To pay for house building

loans.name: Gbenade

texts.fr: Monsieur A. réside dans le quartier de bè ahligo qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, il est marié et a un enfant, sa femme est une revendeuse. Il est un frigoriste, il a associé à son activité le commerce de réfrigérateurs et de bouteilles de gaz. A. a commencé son activité seulement en 2007, son stock de marchandises a un peu diminué, il demande à wages un prêt pour acheter 10 bouteilles de gaz PM et 20 tuyaux flexibles.
texts.en:
Mr. A. resides in Bè Ahligo, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. He is married and has a child. His wife is a retailer, and he is a refrigerator specialist. To this work of his, he has added commerce in refrigerators and bottles of gas. He began in this business only in 2007. His stock of merchandise has shrunk a bit. He’s asking WAGES for a loan to buy 10 bottles of PM gas and 10 flexible tubes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bottles of gas and flex tubing

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Lucía se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad de Capiatá desde hace cerca de dos años; se conocen bastante bien y han aprendido a trabajar de manera organizada. Sus actividades económicas la realizan en sus casas y en la venta casa por casa, recorriendo tanto por el barrio como en zonas aledañas.

1	Mirian F.	Venta de ropas
2	Estela P.	Venta de ropas
3	Liz J.	Técnica radióloga
4	Mabel E.	Despensa
5	Juliana C.	Venta de joyas
6	Maria R.	Venta de Asadito
7	Clara R.	Venta de comidas
8	Laura Resquín	Venta de cosméticos
9	Nancy Resquín	Venta de cosméticos
10	Agustina López	Despensa
11	Elva González	Peluquera
12	Virginia Fernández	Venta de frutas y verduras
13	Ramona E.	Venta de ropas
14	Perla González	Venta de ropas
15	Gladys C. 	Costurera
16	Antonia J. 	Venta de ropas
texts.en:
The Santa Lucía loan group began their work in the city of Capiatá about two years ago. They have gotten to know one another quite well and have learned to work in an organized way. They are carrying out their business activities in their homes and in door-to-door sales covering not just their neighborhood but also the surrounding areas. 1 Mirian F. . . . Clothing sales. 2 Estela P. . . . Clothing sales. 3 Liz J. . . . Xray technician. 4 Mabel E. Grocery store. 5 Juliana C. Jewelry sales. 6 Maria R. Sale of grilled food. 7 Clara R. Grocery sales. 8 Laura Resquín Cosmetic sales. 9 Nancy Resquín Cosmetic sales. 10 Agustina López Grocery store. 11 Elva González Hairdresser. 12 Virginia Fernández Sale of fruits & vegetables. 13 Ramona E. Clothing sales. 14 Perla González Clothing sales. 15 Gladys C. Seamstress. 16 Antonia J. Clothing sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for their sales, and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Сарвархон

texts.ru: Сарвархон сотрудничает с Микроинвест уже 1,5 года. За этот период она заметно увеличила свой оборотный капитал и улучшила свои жизненные условия. Ее бизнес – это купля продажа сухофруктов. 5 дней в неделю она выезжает на местные рынки и торгует там. И хотя ей уже 62 года она продолжает заниматься этим. Сарвархон замужем. Воспитала 3 детей. Она подала заявку на КИВА и собирается поехать на соседние рынки для закупа товара.
texts.en:
Sarvarhon has been working with MicroInvest for 1.5 years. During this period she has noticeably increased her working capital and improved her quality of life. Her business is the purchase and sale of dried fruits. 5 days per week she travels to local markets and sells there. And even though she is 62 years old she continues to do this. Sarvarhon is married. She raised 3 children. She has put her application on KIVA and plans to travel to neighboring markets to purchase products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wenen

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Wenen (DNR.M-0664) is 63 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu in Melaya. She is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, she raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 250,000 - 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Wayan Wenen joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her fourth from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Wayan Wenen - (DNR.M-0664) merupakan 63 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Wenen memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Wayan Wenen sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Wenen menghasilkan sekitar 250,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Wayan Wenen bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Wayan Wenen meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Wenen berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es: El joven Norlan L.,  tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa se desempeña como operadora en unas de la empresa de la zona franca, tiene un hijo de tres meses. Tiene como planes comprar su propia casa. Don Norlan tiene su venta de lácteos desde hace un año, iniciando con fondos propios, comercializando su mercadería entre sus compañero de trabajo, Su visión es ofrecerle mejor calidad y servicio a sus clientes colocando su puesto de venta en puntos específicos. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara productos como: queso, crema, quesillo y cubriendo mayores demandas de productos.
texts.en:
The young Norlan L. is 22 years old, and lives the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Norlan is married and his wife works as an operator in one of the factories in the Franca Zone; he has son who is 3 months old. He has plans of someday buying his own house. Norlan has sold dairy products for the past year; he began his business with his own funds, selling his merchandise to his work friends. His vision is to offer better quality and service to his clients, and to put his sales stand at key places. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he will purchase products such as: cheese, cream, and quesillo, in that way covering his most demanded products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, such as: cheese, cream, and quesillo.

loans.name: Mrs. Liv Sum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank is located in Krapeu Troum Village in Kandal Province, and its 24 members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Liv Summ, the village bank president selected by the members, is a hard-working farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Because her field is currently infertile, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Mrs. Liv S. is a 63-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Twenty members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en: Belarmina M. is from the village of Barangay Kabcsanan, Iligan City. She is 47 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Belarmina owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale in their garden. She is just starting this business. In June 2009, Belarmina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use to expand her business

location.town: Kabcsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ipogolo E Group

texts.en:
Lustika is a member of the Ipogolo borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is 48 years old  and married.  She has two children, ages 28 and 30 years. 

Lustica has had a shop business for 5 years. She works 15 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 190,000 Tanzania Shillings (TZS).

This is Lustika’s  first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 TZS to buy products for her shop. With the additional profit she expects from the use of this loan, Lustika hopes to expand her business, to do repairs, to get more food for her family and to save money. 

Magdalena, another member of the  Ipogolo E borrower group, is also requesting 200,000 TZS in order to support her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Maria es  casada tiene cinco hijos de, el menor tiene cinco años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Maria  puso una bodega en su casa, la tuvo que Serra por que sus hijas no quisieron ayudarle a tender y ella se puso a estudiar cosmetología  cuando termino puso su peluquería, pero al tiempo le robaron todas las cosas de su peluquería  que quedaba en su casa, pero ella no se dio por vencida en un mercado abrió un apequeña peluquería pero nuevamente la tuvo que serrar por que su empleada se fue de vacaciones, ella se puso a  trabajar  en la tienda de su  hermana en la venta de bisutería. 
Desde que Maria esta en Finca  esta aprendiendo a invertir y tiene  muchas ideas de negocio.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de bisutería de plata  cadenas, pulseras, anillos.
El sueño de Maria es abrir su peluquería nuevamente.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Community Bank. Maria is married and has five children. They youngest is five, and he attends the state school. Maria set up a grocery store in her house. She had to close it because her daughters did not want to help her with it. She started to study cosmetology. When she finished she set up a hair salon. All of her beauty salon things that were in her house were stolen. But, she did not give up. She opened a small hair salon in a market. Once again, she had to close it because her employee went on vacation. She went to work in her sister’s jewelry store. Since Maria has been with Finca she has been learning to invest, and she has lots of business ideas. Maria needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy silver jewelry like chains, bracelets and rings. Maria’s dream is to once again open her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy silver jewelry like chains, bracelets and rings

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky T. lives in the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky raises livestock, primarily pigs. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Vicky joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buty livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Amelia Isabel

texts.es: Amelia Isabel P. M. reside  en Ciudad Arce, municipio en el departamento de La Libertad. Amelia tiene 50 años de edad y vive junto a su madre y su hija Amelia quien aun  se encuentra estudiando. Ser la única trabajadora del hogar y la única fuente de ingresos no es nada fácil, pero Amelia nunca ha perdido la fe ni la inspiración por el trabajo, y administra una venta de frutas y verduras en su casa, para la cual solicita un préstamo, pues le es necesario ampliar su mercadería y productos.
texts.en:
Amelia Isabel P. M. lives in Ciudad Arce, a town in the district of La Libertad. She is 50 years old and lives with her mother and daughter, who is currently a student. Being the only worker in her household and the only source of income is not easy, but Amelia has never lost faith or inspiration for her work. She manages a vending stall selling fruits and vegetables from home.

She is requesting a loan because it is necessary for her to increase her merchandise and the types of products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is 39 years old and married with four children aged between 11 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with four people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall in Ndeeba Market where she works seven days a week selling bananas. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to all categories of people.

Hadjah has been in this business for twenty years and with MCDT for four years. She is servicing her 16th loan and she wants to use this loan to buy more bananas to sell. She buys her bananas from suppliers who get them from local villages. She aspires to buy directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia A. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo surtir su negocio.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más mercancía ya que la que tenía se le fue terminando, y ahora quiere compara ropa de invierno. 
Planea pagar le crédito con los ingresos del negocio, ya que sus gastos familiares los cubre del sueldo que percibe de su empleo de limpieza de una casa particular.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía para el negocio

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: E. Yolande est née le 03/08/1964 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Yolande est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Yolande qui assure les charges de la famille. Ainsi, Yolande utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Yolande vend des tissus, des chaussures et des bols en série. Yolande vend ses produits dans ses boutiques à son domicile et à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Yolande achète ses produits. Yolande est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yolande a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Pendant cette période de fêtes de fin d'année, Yolande veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Yolande sollicite ce quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
E. Yolande est née le 03/08/1964 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Yolande est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Sègbèya à Cotonou. C'est le mari de Yolande qui assure les charges de la famille. Ainsi, Yolande utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Yolande vend des tissus, des chaussures et des bols en série. Yolande vend ses produits dans ses boutiques à son domicile et à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Yolande achète ses produits. Yolande est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Yolande a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Pendant cette période de fêtes de fin d'année, Yolande veut renforcer son fonds de roulement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Yolande sollicite ce quatrième prêt de ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de tissus, de chaussures et de bols en série.

loans.name: Santos Luis

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Luis O. tiene 49 años de edad y es padre de 5 hijos, todos ellos adultos, se dedica a la comercializacion de adobes, ladrillos y tejas, tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad.
su negocio le a ayudado a salir adelante y a mantener su familia.
ahora necesita capital para comprar mas ladrillos y tejas ya esta vendiendo su producto en diferentes lugares y lo que compra no le ajusta ya que la demanda es buena, por tal razon necesita el credito.
el carro en que transporta el material de construccion es de el.
nos comento que se siente mu feliz ya que sus ganancias han aumentado y le esta dando una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Santos Luis O., 49, has five children. They are all adults. He sells adobe bricks, bricks, and tiles. He has been doing this for ten years. His business has helped him get ahead and support his family. He now needs capital to buy more bricks and tiles. He is selling his products in different places. What he buys is not enough because the demand is good. That is the reason he needs the loan. The car that he uses to transport the construction materials is his. He tells us that he feels very happy that his earnings have increased. It is giving his wife a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy adobe bricks, bricks, and tiles

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
Noemy M. B., tiene la edad de 34 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos.Ella quiere el préstamo para invertir en la tienda de costura y el bazar que tiene, sobre todo para comprar material (telas) para sus trabajos de costura, esto le ayudaría a percibir ingresos no solo por las costuras que realiza sino también podría obtener ingresos vendiendo a sus clientes las telas.Ella se dedica  a la costura desde hace más de 15 años, pero el negocio propiamente lo formó hace aproximadamente 3 años,las costuras las realiza por encargo y se siente muy feliz por su proyecto.
Es la primera vez que doña Noemy realiza un préstamo con FUDECOSUR, y manifiesta estar muy contenta pues las condiciones del préstamos son muy buenas y accesibles para ella.
Las metas y aspiraciones  que ella tiene para el futuro es el de progresar para poder ayudar con el estudio de sus hijos y el tener una mayor estbilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Noemy M. B., 34, is married and the mother of 2 children. She wants financing to invest, mostly in fabrics for her creations, in a dressmaking supplies store and bazar she has. This will help her earn income not only by the sales of her creations but also by selling fabric directly to her customers. She has been a seamstress for the last 15 years but has only had the business itself for the last 3 years. She sews items based on prior orders and is happy with her project. This is the first time that Noemy negotiates a loan with FUDECOSUR and she states that she is very happy because the loan terms are very good and accessible to her. Her goals and hopes for the future is to pogress so that she can help with the schooling of her children and have better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in dressmaking supplies and a bazaar.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1-5 Group

texts.en:
Despite any difficulties she may face, Xiomara, 48, is excited to be taking out this loan – her very first with Esperanza International. She proudly displays her colmado, or small general store, in which she will invest this loan. She plans to buy more merchandise, including foods, snacks, drinks, gasoline, charcoal, and clothing. Xiomara has never had access to a loan before, and her hopes for both her business and her family now don’t seem so far away. She hopes that with her profits, she and her husband will be able to afford their own home, and maybe even buy a small tract of land to work on someday. Xiomara also hopes to send all of her children to university – an opportunity she never had.

Xiomara is a borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Con Dios Adelante (Onward with God), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. They live in Batey San German, a small community north of La Romana. Bateyes are small rural communities built by sugar companies to house their field workers. Like San German, bateyes are usually remote, lack good sanitation and medical services, and have little to no access to potable water and electricity. Xiomara lives in this community with her husband and three children, ages 16, 12, and a 10-year-old named Melvin. Their house has a cement foundation with wooden walls and a tin roof, and it is lent to them by the sugar company.

Thank you for your loan to Xiomara and the Con Dios Adelante group!

loans.use: To buy food, clothing, gasoline, and charcoal

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz, the leader of this group, is thirty-one years old. She has a husband and a seven-year-old daughter. To provide for the family, her husband works as a security guard. Her husband’s intention has always been to let Jyldyz stay at home and be a housewife, so that she could give best possible upbringing for their daughter, who has already started to go to school. When their daughter was little, Jyldyz obediently sat at home and looked after the child. After their daughter grew a little older, Jyldyz started to grow and sell strawberries. She thriftily saved her earnings and bought a cow for three hundred and ninety five dollars. Due to these contributions of hers, they have been able to build a home. Now, Jyldyz is still a housewife, but she manages to make money selling milk as well. Her monthly income from selling milk only constitutes seventy dollars. She sees great opportunities in animal husbandry and is resolute about continuing to breed and increase her total population of livestock. Therefore, Jyldyz has applied for this loan to buy a calf to raise and coal for the winter season. She is planning to build temporary buildings and sheds for her cattle behind the house. Jyldyz’s partners are: Joldoshbek, 56, is a stock breeder. He is the father of five children: four sons and one daughter. All his sons work and live separately. His wife works in a hospital as a medical assistant. Joldoshbek hopes to obtain a loan to purchase several sheep to raise. Elmira, 40, is the mother of seven children. Her eldest daughter is twenty four and her little daughter is three. Her husband has a tractor and provides ploughing services for villagers. Elmira needs a loan to buy a calf. Saule, 40, has three children and her eldest daughter goes to college. Her husband trades in meat at a local market. Saule is a housewife and also looks after cattle and sells milk. Selling milk brings her $24 a month. Saule needs a loan to purchase sheep to raise. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf to raise and coal for the winter season

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia C. C., tiene la edad de 45 años, está  casada, y tiene seis hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 27,25,23,19,9 y 6 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia  a una plantación de 1.5 hectareas de café que posee. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Cecilia trabaja  desde hace muchos años a la agricultura sobre todo a la siembra de granos básico, al café y un poco a la ganadería. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.


About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Cecilia C. C., is 45 years old, married, and has six children. Her children are her first priority and are ages 27, 25, 23, 19, 9 and 6. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for her 1.5 hectare coffee plantation. She wants to be able to provide for the adequate maintenance of her crops, which will result in better production and therefore more income. This is not her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy with the opportunities they have provided. Cecilia has worked in agriculture for many years. She has primarily grown staple grains and coffee, and has done some cattle raising. In the future, she hopes to provide her family a better quality of life with more financial stability. She also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a businesswoman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for coffee crops

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene G. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old and the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.
Irene is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en:
Isoken is a widow with six children and she is 57 years old. She is a friendly woman. She sells kerosene to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. She uses her many years of experience in the kerosene business to attract and retain her customers. She also loves this business because it is highly profitable. 

Isoken hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more kerosene to sell. She hopes to be a major distributor of kerosene in her city. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Mrs. Pablita T. is a PDP-LP member. She is 45 years old, and married with four children.  She is from Upper Tiparak,Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, which supports their daily basic needs. She has owned a sari-sari store (neighborhood convenience store) for almost three years, earning approximately 4000 PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support, and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to extend her sari-sari store so that she can accommodate more customers. Mrs. T. now has a new loan of 6000 PHP from PMPC, which will be used to fund additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Henry Noel

texts.es:
El señor Henry S. tiene la edad de 52 años, casado y con un hijo mayor de edad, su esposa es Maestra de educación Primaria y su Hijo es Ing. Industrial trabajador de la Empresa Holcin. Don Henry es Contador y trabaja para una Empresa que distribuye desinfectantes y se desempeña como contador.
ÉL trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha recibido 3 créditos, los dos primeros créditos fueron para mejoramiento de vivienda y este ultimo que es para comprar artículos del hogar.
texts.en:
Henry S. is 52 years old, is married, and has one adult son. His wife is an elementary school teacher and his son is an industrial engineer at the Holcin company. Henry is an accountant for a company that distributes disinfectants. He has worked with Ceprodel for two years, during which he has received three loans. The first two were for home improvement and this last one is to purchase household items.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of household items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Vut's Group
loans.use: To buy new fishing tools and to repair some broken pieces.

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey A. is young energetic man with a passion for business. At the age of 20 years, Humphrey is in the cereal business, which he started in 2008 after finishing his secondary education. He wants to take this loan so that he can be able to raise enough money to see him continue with his education.

He would like to expand his business by increasing his stock and wishes for a loan worth KES 5000 to help him do this. Being single with no children to take care of, Humphrey wants to see his living standard improve before he goes into marriage.

loans.use: To increase stock to boost his business.

loans.name: Yorling Del Rosario

texts.es: Yorling del Rosario A. se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace diez años, negocio que inicio con unos ahorros. Ella con el préstamo invertirá en mercadería con el deseo de salir adelante y de sacar adelantes a sus tres hijos los cuales en sus vacaciones le ayudan especialmente las gemelas.
texts.en:
Yorling del Rosario A. has been selling clothing for ten years. She started the business with savings. She will use the loan to buy merchandise, with the hope of getting ahead in life and helping her three children also get ahead. Her children help her during their vacations, especially her twin daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Sény

texts.fr: Sény S. est née le 04 aout 1990, elle est âgée de 20 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 06 autres enfants confiés par des proches et amis de son mari. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 21 juillet 2005 et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, une activité qu'elle mène depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Sény S. was born on August 4, 1990 ; she is 20 years old, married and the mother of two children. She also has six other children in her care entrusted to her by relatives and her husband’s friends. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Diaobe Manding since July 21, 2005 and obtained loans five times in the past, without ever having any issues with repayment. She prepares and sells peanut sauce, an activity she has been engaged in since joining Banc Villageois. Her goal is to help improve the life conditions of her family and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 39 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 17 years.

Emma joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Emma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Izolde

texts.en:
Izolde D. is from the town of Trento. She is 42 and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Izolde has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

Izolde joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and for land preparation and transplanting. This will be the third loan taken out by Izolde from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and for land preparation and transplanting

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa D. is a widow  who lives in Prk 2, Brgy Carabalan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a sugarcane  business. 

Felisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 24 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 25th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for the future use of her business. Felisa D. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Maria Apolinia

texts.es: La señora María Apolonia tiene su negocio que consiste en la venta de productos lácteos, además de esto también está vendiendo topa usada. La señora, aduce que su negocio ha crecido bastante, que le ha ido bien ya que ha aumentado su inventario de mercadería y ahora puede ofrecer más variedad de productos. Pues él trabaja que realiza cada día le ha dejado esta recompensa. En la actualidad solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como leche, queso, crema, cuajada y leche agria.  Ella tiene el reto de seguir luchando para siempre seguir hacia delante y poder dejarle algo bueno de lo cual sus hijos puedan mantenerse.
texts.en:
Sra. María Apolonia has a business selling dairy products, but she also sells used clothing on the side. María says her business has grown considerably and her success is attributed to increasing her inventory of merchandise. Now she is able to offer a wider variety of products. She is rewarded for the work she performs each day.

At the moment she is requesting a loan to buy products such as milk, cheese, cream, curds, and buttermilk. She is determined to continue moving forward so that she can leave something good for her children so that they can support themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, cheese, cream, curds, and buttermilk

loans.name: Kahr Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KAHR YALLA est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame Aïcha S., debout à droite sur la photo, avec une écharpe jaune sur les épaules, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge d’une nièce de 14 ans et d’une petite fille qui est à l’université. 

Elle fait du commerce, elle travaille en collaboration avec son fils. Ce dernier s'approvisionne en Mauritanie. Elle vend des tissus et des parfums. Elle vend aussi de l'huile de palme. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1974
Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter en quantité importante la marchandise ci-dessus afin de dégager une marge bénéficiaire consistante. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Kahr Yalla was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 9 women who are all from the same neighborhood. The women know each other based on friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Aïcha S., standing on the right side of the photo, with a yellow scarf around her shoulders, is the group's leader. She is 66 years old. She is married and mother of 5 children. She is also in charge of a 14-year-old niece and a granddaughter who is in college. She sells goods and she works in partnership with her son. Her son buys the stock in Mauritania. She sells fabrics and perfumes. She also sells palm oil. She has been doing this since 1974. Her new loan will allow her to purchase even more of the items listed above so she can have consistent profit margins. Her goal is to increase her savings and to take care of her and her family's needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, perfumes, and palm oil

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson Y. is from the village of San Isidro. He is 51 years old. Wilson is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Wilson raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilson has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2010, Wilson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilson is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Wilson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita A. is a 33-year-old married woman living in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has 4 children and 3 of them go to school. Perlita earns through farming and retailing. She tills a rice farm near their house. She also sells various kinds of products at her sari-sari store. Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She says she does everything to keep her family healthy, especially her children.

Perlita needs additional merchandise to sell and farm inputs for her rice field. She applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 that she will use to sustain her business.

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: Serapio G. se dedica al polarizado de vidrios de automóviles desde hace 12 años, estos trabajos los realiza  a las fueras de un centro comercial muy conocido en la ciudad allí es donde el polariza carros, camionetas, camiones aun bajo precio, comenta Serapio que en la temporada de Diciembre es mas requerido este trabajo, es por ello que requiere de un préstamo para comprar el materia y asi seguir trabajando y dar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en: Serapio G. has made  a living tinting car windows for the past 12 years. He does low cost work on cars, vans and trucks outside a well known shopping center. Serapio says that December is the busiest time and so he needs a loan to buy materials to keep working and feeding his family.

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
As everyone knows, fish is the main vital fresh food for everybody. In particular, there are families who depend on fishing from Tunle Sap River, which is the best place for fish sheltering. Moun K. is one of those people – she currently depends on selling fish at the busy local market. She sells fish that she either gets from her son or buys from a wholesale supplier. 

Moun K. is married to Mr. Kai, age 52, who works as a soldier at the border of Siem Reap province. Moun K. is a humble mother who has been blessed with six school-aged children. She has requested a loan to purchase more equipment to supply her son's fish-catching business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment to supply her son's fishing business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa S. B. esta separa de su ex marido desde hace cuatro años y tiene a su cargo dos pequeños uno es un  niño y otra niña que están en edad escolar a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor patrimonio. María adquirió su casa por medio de interés social a la que en este momento quiere poner piso firme enfrente por que en épocas de mucho aire el polvo se pasa hasta adentro de su casa, para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Mrs Maria Teresa S. B. has been separated from her husband for four years and has two small children in her care; a boy and a girl.  The children are school age and she wants to be able to offer them a better estate to inherit.  María acquired her house through a government-subsidized, low income housing program.  She would like to install a solid surface outside the front of her house because whenever they have windy periods the dust blows inside.  In order to carry out her project she needs to buy building materials and pay workmen.

loans.use: To build a solid surface outside the front of her house

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Erlinda V. G. tiene 47 años de edad,  esta casada con el señor Jose Francisco Sierra quien se dedica a la venta de sal. la señora Rosa Erlinda se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, vende pollo, carnes, arroz, huevos, maiz, cloro y mucho mas. sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas que trabajan con el esposo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia ya que desea tener bien surtido para esta navidad.
 
sus ventas son todos los dias de lunes a domindo ademas se dedica  a la venta de leche y cuajada, es otro ingreso que le ayuda a la economia de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Erlinda V. G. is 47 years old and married to Sr. Jose Francisco Sierra, who works as a salt distributor.

Sra. Rosa Erlinda has a store in her home where she sells chicken, meat, rice, eggs, corn, bleach, and many other items. Her customers are neighbors and co-workers of her husband. This loan will be used to buy merchandise because she wants to be well-stocked for the Christmas holiday.

Her sales are conducted every day, Monday through Sunday. In addition, she sells milk and curds as an additional source of income that helps support her family.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rebecca Awino

texts.en: For the last year Rebecca has been a fishmonger in Naivasha town. She is 35 years old married to Christopher Ondiko. They have three children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan with which she plans to buy  a refrigerator for storing fish. In the future, Rebecca  hopes to be able to supply fish in large quantity to various markets and hotels  beyond Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy  a refrigerator for storing fish.

loans.name: Timothy Mbithi

texts.en:
Timothy N. is 34 years old.  He has been operating a retail shop for a period of five  years. He is married to Mary, who is a  business lady.  They have no children. He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Timothy earns a monthly profit of Kshs 15,000 from his retail shop business. This loan of Kshs 50,000 is his fourth loan with KADET.  He intends to use it to increase stocks of sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and flour. If the loan boosts the business, he will save and expand his business further.   He dreams of growing it into a wholesale business. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soft drinks, cooking fat and flour to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam C., age 23, is married to Meang Ly, age 20. She has one child who is still not enrolled in school. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. On average, Sam C.’s husband could earn a profit from this business of around $2 each day. Currently, some materials which he uses for climbing palm trees have broken down from extensive use. To help her husband’s business, Sam C. will use her loan to buy ladders for her husband, some containers for storing palm juice, and other required equipment.

loans.use: Purchase ladders, juice containers, and other required equipment

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin S., 38, lives with his wife in the Kampong Cham province. Since 1993, they have been working in construction and are able to make about $5 each per day. 

Sin S. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will allow the family to reduce their transportation expense and save much more than before. 

Sin S. is pictured with his wife at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba. Actualmente, Carmen vive en la ciudad del Cusco, provincia de Cusco. Perú.  Ella vende peluches los días sábados en la feria sabatina de “El Baratillo”. Carmen nos cuenta que viaja a su ciudad natal a cosechar café para luego venderlos. Carmen requiere el préstamo para comprar más peluches. 

Carmen se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen, 29, has two children.  She was born in the city of Quillabamba but currently resides in the city of Cusco, Cusco province, Perú.  
She sells stuffed toys every Saturday at the Saturday “El Baratillo” market.  Carmen tells us that she travels to the city of her birth to harvest coffee to sell later.

Carmen needs the loan to buy more stuffed toys.

Carmen is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and at the same time commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more stuffed toys.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old. Evelyn is married and has 8 children. Six of her children still go to school. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evelyn approximately earns 4000 PHP a month from farming. 

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu S. is a palm oil seller at the Jukwa Market, which is a major market near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been making her living through palm oil for the past three years. She has completed her junior high school education. Her husband is a driver and they have two children. Sherifatu’s earnings help pay for school fees and utility bills. To expand her business, she plans to use the loan to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit to extract more oil to sell. She plans to save the additional profits from the extra sales for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit to extract more oil to sell.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
Maria Aurora M. P. tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno.

Le gusta salir pasear, tejer, y festejar las fiestas en la Comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Aurora M. P. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Guraranda Canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has five children. 

The V.R.C. GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN women's group is from the Guanto Cruz community in Guanujo parish which belongs to the Guaranda Canton. The group has 22 members who are all active in agricultural work, such as growing mulberries, corn, livestock and dairy cattle for cheese production.

Maria grows mulberries and corn and raises livestock. She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them at the Guaranda fair.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment, livestock and feed. This support will help her economically to meet her needs. She is up against challenges such as plagues, illness and weather change. Her dream is to buy land.

She enjoys walking, knitting and participating in the community festivities.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment, livestock and feed

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene  62 años, vive  con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 30 años ha practicado la agricultura, actividad que le ha dado ingresos económicos, asimismo se dedica en la venta D. queso, carne y miel D. abeja que compra al por mayor D. los mismo productores que se encuentran en su zona Es así que en cada viaje que realiza, reparte a  sus clientes fijos, asícomo los ofrece D. manera ambulante a las ciudades a donD. va. Para ella es importante este negocio ya que es una entrada más hasta que le toque el momento D. cosechar papa y maíz, y lograr vender todo lo producido. Su tiempo D. trabajo lo distribuye entre el comercio y agrícola para garantizarse los ingresos que necesita su familia, sin embargo debe afrontar los problemas del clima que azotan sus plantaciones y perjudican su producción. Actualmente su objetivo es abastecerse D. mercadería para vender. Es su crédito número 11 con MFP y durante este tiempo D. pertenecer a su banco comunal  considera que fueron  muy gratificantes sobre todo en su aprendizaje sobre asuntos financieros y la importancia en su economía, uno D. los hábitos que mas aprendió fue la del ahorro D. la cual esta agradecida además  D. que se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería y D. sacos D. abono para su próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Paulina, 62, lives with her husband in her own house.  For over 30 years she’s been a farmer, an activity that has produced income for her.  She also sells cheese, meat and honey that she buys wholesale from producers in her area.  On every trip she makes, then, she sells to her regular customers as well as selling in an itinerant manner in the cities she visits. This business is important to her because it’s an additional source of income while she’s waiting to harvest potatoes and corn and to sell her entire crop yield.  She divides her time between the commercial work and the agricultural work to insure income her family needs.  Nevertheless, she still has to withstand problems caused by the weather that batter her plants and affect production.  Her current goal is to stock up on merchandise to sell.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She considers that the time she’s spent as a member of a communal bank has been very gratifying, above all with respect to her learning about financial affairs and the importance they have in her economy.  One of the habits she learned best was savings for which she is most grateful.  She commits to continue being punctual with her payments.

She plans to use the requested loan to buy merchandise and sacks of manure for her next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy products like cheese, honey and meat and to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Allabeko Group

texts.fr:
Mme Compaoré est la présidente du groupe allabeko.Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans.4 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 5 personnes a sa charge.

Mme Compaoré vend des gâteaux, des fruits et légumes et du sésame. Elle pratique l’activité depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de sanba.ses clients sont les gens du quartier (voisins).

Elle veut utiliser son argent pour acheter de la farine de blé en vu d’augmenter sa vente de gâteaux.

Mme Compaoré veut utiliser les bénéfices de son activité pour nourrir ses enfants et participer aux frais  scolaire de ses enfants qui vont a l’école. Elle a comme ambition de vendre ses gâteaux plus loin que le quartier dans les autres zones de son pays. Elle veut mettre l’eau et le courant dans sa famille
texts.en:
Madame Compaoré is the president of the Allabeko group. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Her oldest child is 16 and her youngest is 3. 4 of her children go to school She is responsible for caring for 5 people.

Madame Compaoré sells cakes, fruits and vegetables, and sesame. She has had this business for the past 12 years. She buys her supplies at the Semba Grand Market. Her clients are her neighbors.

She wants to use her loan to buy wheat flour in order to produce more cakes.

Madame Compaoré wants to use the profits from her business to feed her family and contribute to the school fees for her children who go to school. Her ambition is to sell cakes further from her neighborhood and in other parts of the country. She would like to install running water for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of wheat flour to make her cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fodder for his dairy cattle

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena de 51 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposo en la actualidad es discapacitado. Tiene tres hijos mayores de edad y están casados. Su actividad comercial es la venta de comidas.

Empezó hace 6 años a raíz que su esposo quedo discapacitado, empezó por los vecinos ahora entrega almuerzos a trabajadores en otro sector. Una de su hija le ayuda de 7H00 am a 13H00 pm que es la hora que se desocupa del negocio. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea implementar en su negocio nuevas comidas y abrir un mini papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. En un futuro desea abrir una papelería y adecuar la loza de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Elena is 51 years old and lives in an urban area of El Guasmo, Guayaquil.  El Guasmo is a popular, low-income neighborhood which used to be a large estate.  It is named after a species of tree: 'Guazuma ulmifolia'.  María's husband is disabled.  She has three grown-up children who are married.  Her business is selling meals.

María started working six years ago when her husband became disabled.  She started out selling to her neighbors and now she delivers lunches to workers in another area.  One of her daughters helps her from 7.00am to 1.00pm which is when she finishes work.  With the help of this loan, María would like to start serving new meals in her business and open a mini stationery store in the front part of her home.  In the future, she would like to open a stationery store and do some work on the concrete floor at home.

loans.use: to buy stationery products and cooking supplies

loans.name: Kodzovi

texts.fr: Mr Kodzovi est marié à une couturière et ils ont 02 enfants en charge. Il était menuisier de profession vu que son activité ne prospère pas comme il le souhaite, il a démarré en 2008 par diffuser des films et matchs dans un claie aménagé pour la circonstance à toutes personnes qui n’ont pas la possibilité d’avoir un abonnement à la maison.
texts.en: Mr Kodzovi is married to a seamstress and they have two children. He was a carpenter but as his commerce was not prospering as well as he wished, in 2008 he started a business showing films and sports in a shelter fitted out for the occasion for people who are not able to have a subscription at home.

loans.use: Purchase televisions and tables for fitting out the hall of the mini cinema.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells children's wear, omo (detergent) and soaps in Abura, which she has done for 10 years. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She has received a junior high education. Ama uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills and other household expenses. 

Ama will use the loan to buy more soap for resale. Her future plan is to plow her profit back into the business for further increase.

loans.use: to buy more soap for resale.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
Jose Adrian tiene su negocio que es una pulpería y venta de mariscos. Tiene más de 17 años, en este negocio a sus clientes les gusta hablar con Jose Adrian ya que es una persona que brinda muy buenos consejos y esto atrae a la mayoría de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos, entre otros. El tiene el sueño de invertir cada día más en su negocio ya que así podrá tener más clientes.

Efectivamente la foto esta con lentes porque el tiene un problema en su ojo y permanentemente anda con lentes y el dijo al momento que se le tomo la foto que si se aceptaba asi con mucho gusto pero que sin lentes el no se la tomaba.
texts.en:
Jose Adrian has a grocery store and sells seafood.  He has been in business for over 17 years and his customers enjoy talking to Jose because he gives very good advice and attracts many customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy sweets, softdrinks, bread, detergents, basic grains, and other items.  His dream is to invest more and more in his business so he can reach more customers.

loans.use: To buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergents, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 44 years old and married, with 4 children aged 12 to 24 years old. She also looks after her grandmother. Hadijah lives in a permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children up to university.

For four years, Hadijah has been dealing in the textile business. She started out with 200,000 UGX but has so far accumulated stock of 200,0000 UGX. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs and sometimes the vehicle breaks down. Her dream is to set up a boutique instead of being a market vendor. Hadijah needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor José Alejandro y su esposa la señora Maria De Lourdes tienen tres hijos que actualmente están estudiando. 
Están solicitando un  préstamo ya que tiene que pagar la inscripción de la escuela para que sus hijo puedan estudios este siclo escolar, también necesitan comprar los cuadernos, lápices, libros y uniformes, no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir estas necesidades escolares. 
Don José Alejandro se encargara de pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe como trabajador de una iglesia. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan el estudio necesario para un buen futuro.
texts.en: José Alejandro and his wife Maria De Lourdes have three children who are currently in school. They are requesting a loan because they have to pay registration fees for their children for this school year, and they also need to buy notebooks, pencils, books and uniforms. They don't have the money to cover all these necessary educational expenses. José Alejandro is responsible for paying the loan with a part of the salary he receives for working at a church. He and his wife want their children to have the necessary education for a good future.

loans.use: to pay for registration fees and school supplies.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel tiene 47 años de edad, es casado vive con la esposa e hijos, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra en el sector La capilla, comunidad cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 25 minutos, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, comercio, construcción y ganadería.
