Segundo Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, comercio de productos de naranja y queso además se dedica a ganadería. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda, Guanujo y Echeandia.

Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos, semillas, alimento para los animales y dinero para pagar el transporte para movilizar los productos. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos la competencia, los precios y daños en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo para trasladar los productos que vende. 

Le gusta salir de paseo, festejar las fiestas de carnaval y finados.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 47 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in the Guaranda Canton in Bolivar Province.

The members of the communal bank "NUEVA ESPERANZA" ("NEW HOPE") meet in the La Capilla area.  It is a community that draws from the four corners of the Guaranda Canton, and is 25 minutes away. The members of this bank work in agriculture, business, construction and livestock management.

Segundo Manuel works in agriculture, in the business of oranges and cheese; he also has livestock.  He buys and sells products in the cities of Guaranda, Guanujo and Echeandia.

He is applying for this loan for the purchase of manure, seeds, animal feed and to provide money to pay for transportation to move his goods.  The loan will support him in meeting his financial needs and improving his agricultural activities. The challenges he faces are the competition, prices and damage to his crops.  His dream is to buy a vehicle to transport the products that he sells.

He likes to go for walks, and to celebrate at the Carnival and Day of the Dead festivals.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, animal feed, and provide money to pay for transport to move his goods.

loans.name: Tiwa

texts.en:
Tiwa has been a goat trader for the past ten years. He is married and supports five people in his family. He was introduced to KADET by a KADET registered client. He has applied for his first loan  of KES 50,000 which he plans to use to purchase more goats for sale.

He hopes to make to make a profit and reinvest in the business. He is an industrious person who will strive to achieve more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She is 48 years old, married to Gachomo, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay her workers.

In the future, Margaret hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Eva Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Eva tiene 58 años D. edad, está casada, vive con sus hijos menores en la ciudad D. Paraguarí. Eva cuenta con un salón D. belleza, es uno D. lo más antiguos D. la ciudad D. Paraguarí, cuenta con clientela formada, justamente por el tiempo que lleva en esto. Tiene 4 hijos, los cuales trabajan y estudian por cuenta propia, es una señora muy sacrificada que gracias a sus esfuerzos y sacrificios pudo salir adelante en su negocios.
Comenta que su negocio es el sustento D. la familia y que este le es D. mucha ayuda. Ella se considera una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Le gustaría poder seguir con su peluquería y D. esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. accesorios para su salón D. belleza, como ser juegos tijeras, sprays, gel y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da.
texts.en:
Eva is 58 years old, married, and lives with her 2 younger sons in the city of Paraguarí. Eva has a beauty salon and it is one of the oldest in Paraguarí, with an established clientele, clearly because of the time she has spent on it. She has 4 children who work and study on their own.

She is a self-sacrificing woman and thanks to her effort and sacrifices she could get ahead in her business. She says that her business provides the family income and is very helpful.

She is considered to be a hard working person and a fighter. She wants to continue with her beauty salon business and thus be able to support her family.
 
She is asking for this loan to buy accessories for her salon such as shears, sprays, and gels, among other items. She is grateful for the opportunity the Foundation has given her.

loans.use: to buy shears, sprays, and gels, among other items.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 37 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Sofia owns and operates an eatery where she offers various recipes everyone would love to eat. The family is depending on much of the earnings generated from the eatery for day to day consumptions. Sofia is so glad to be in the business for 10 years already. This has allowed her to receive a total of 10,000 PHP a month. She has borrowed 25,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase food supplies for the business so as to continue her operations.

In the future, Sofia would like to expand and improve the business, particularly the eating area to provide a comfortable place for customers.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for the business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a 34-year-old married woman with six school-going children. Her husband Nguvu is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Zawadi has operated a fried fish selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of fresh fish and cooking oil, and also to buy building materials to build a place for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it offers financial help to small-scale business operators.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of fresh fish and cooking oil, and to buy materials to build a place for her business.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is 56 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. The elder two kids are employed and live separately. The younger one is a college student. She started her dairy retail business in 2000 by renting a counter in a local market. She has gained many guaranteed suppliers over the years and she has many regular customers as well. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "My youngest daughter is the only one in a family who gets to go to college therefore, I will do everything i can to support her". She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy more dairy products.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en: Sajida stayed in school as far as the fifth grade, but had to leave at that point to go to work because her family was so poor. She is now married and has six children. Her husband earns a living by providing transportation services on a rickshaw. Her oldest son works in a factory and two of her children are still in school. She is applying for this loan from Kiva partner Asasah to repair her husband's rickshaw so that he can provide improved transportation services. He has been in this line of work for 10 years and is very experienced. Sajida is confident that this loan will allow him to increase his profits.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank was formed two years ago in the small village of San Francisco Chuatuj, which is located in the western highlands of Guatemala. The Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank has 13 hard-working women members and is in its third loan cycle as a group. The Trust Bank repaid its two previous loans with Friendship Bridge in full and on time.  

Mary Leocadia, named after her grandmother, is the president of the Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank. For the past three years, she has raised livestock, whiC. she then sells in the market that is located 3km away from her town. A single mother of three boys (ages 8, 6 and 1), Mary plans to use her current loan to buy additional livestock so that she can increase her sales and continue to grow her business. She uses her income to support her family and pay for her two oldest boys' education.  Her dream is to continue to build her livestock business. She also hopes to go back to school since she only has an eighth-grade education. Mary, like the other 12 women in the Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank, is thankful to have access to capital through Friendship Bridge and Kiva. In her words, she "hopes that each Kiva lender receives all of the blessings you deserve."

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and is a married woman with 2 children aged 19 and 16. Her husband works as a bus aide.

Gemma earns a living by providing manicure and pedicure services to her community. Each month, Gemma earns 3000 PHP. Gemma works hard to help provide for her family. She requested a loan to buy more nail polish, cuticle remover, a nipper and other materials. Gemma hopes to sustain her children's education and help improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more nail polish, cuticle remover, a nipper and other materials.

loans.name: Tashingata Group

texts.en:
Washington is 42 years old. He is married and has 4 children aged 19, 18 and 12 years old, while the last born is 8 months old. 3 of the children go to school and his wife operates her own hair salon.

He operates two flea market stands in town in separate locations. He sells matemba (small dried fish). He buys his products from Harare. He has been in the business for 5 years and has 2 employees. He faces the challenges of high competition in the market and inadequate packaging materials to put his products in.

In the next five years, he would like to own his own factory where he can package his products for resale. With the profits from the business, he would be able to improve his home by extending his house.

loans.use: to buy matemba (small dried fish) and sugar beans in bulk

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora  María de Lourdes es madre soltera con un hijo  a su responsabilidad y vive con sus padres.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la copra de  ropas, para damas, caballero, niñas y niños, en donde  lleva trabajando cuatro meses  y comenta que le está dando un buen resultado en sus ingresos y ganancias.

    Para dedicarse a esta actividad lo niño su familia ya que su esposo la abandono con sus bebe y decidió trabajar con algo para sostenerse y a su hijo no le haga falta lo más necesario y logre salir adelante.

    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella vaya incrementando día con día sus ingresos  y con el tiempo su negocio  a aumente mas.
texts.en:
María de Lourdes is a single mother, and she is responsible for one child.  She lives with her parents.

She requested the loan to buy clothing for women, men, and children.  She has been working this way for four months.  She says that it is giving her good results in her income and profits.

In order to do this work her family helps with her son because her husband abandoned her and her baby.  She decided to work in order to support her son so that he would have the basic necessities and so that she would get ahead.

She wishes that her small business activity and her income will grow day to day.  In time, she wishes that her business will grow even more.

loans.use: to pay for buying and selling clothes.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo), age 38, is a vegetable seller. Her husband, Sambo, age 39, is a security guard. They have been married since 1993 and have four children-three sons and one daughter. One child has full-time employment and other three attend school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Srey is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the walls of her house because they are old and break.

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 76 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos.

Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, fueron sus padres y otros familiares que le enseñaron este trabajo. Su especialidad es sembrar maíz y maicillo, todos los días se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. a darle de comer a sus vacas y ha ordeñarlas, luego se va al campo a trabajar, ya sea a tapiscar o a limpiar su milpa durante ocho horas.

El señor José solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una yunta de bueyes (2 bueyes), para trasportar su cosecha desde el lugar donde la tiene sembrada hasta su casa que son aproximadamente cuatro kilómetros, ya que le cobran mucho dinero por este servicio, de esta manera él se ahorrara ese pago y al mismo tiempo prestara sus servios a otras personas que lo soliciten. De esta manera don José desea brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 76, is married and has 2 children.

He has been a farmer since he was very young; his parents and other relatives taught him how to do this type of work.  He specializes in growing corn and sorghum.  He gets up every day at 3:30am to feed his cows and milk them.  Later on he goes to the countryside to work for 8 hours, either to harvest or to clear his cornfields.

Jose is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a pair of oxen to transport his harvest from the place where he grows the crops to his house, which is a distance of about 4 kilometers, since they charge a lot of money for this service.  Thus, he will be able to save money, and he can also lend out his oxen to other people who need them.  In this way, Jose hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Chaban

texts.en: Chaban is a father of 10 children; nine of them are enrolled in school. He is 37 years old. His wife is an art craft maker. He has spent 15 years selling pots for decorations. With the loan he will buy more pots for sale. These pots are used to decorate gardens. He says that the profits will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more decorative pots for sale.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reymundo con 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro de 7 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Reymundo es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa.Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Reymundo is 40 years old and lives in a rustic style house together with his wife and two young children, in the Cajamarca region of Peru. He has great references, both of a personal and professional nature, from other residents who live in the area. Most of the locals from this region make a living from agricultural work, running a shop, or from the cattle industry.

Reymundo makes a living from agricultural work, in particular coffee cultivation, and has around 7 years experience in the field. The loan that he will be given will be used for agricultural tasks, the application and incorporation of plant sanitation products, fertilisers, and also labour during the harvest season. In this way, the loan will help him to improve physiological, morphological and productive aspects of his cultivation, as well as having a well timed harvest and therefore have a better output. This will also help ensure a better quality product so that he will not have any problems in selling his product.

Reymundo is a revived member of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign with his wife.

loans.use: to be used for agricultural tasks, application and incorporation of plant sanitation products, fertilisers, and labor during the harvest season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy dairy feed and other supplements for her cows

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak B. sells motor oil and owns a small shop that fixes motorbikes and automobiles.  She is 50 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 5 children.  Her husband is a policeman and earns $5/day, and 3 of her children work and earn $300/month total.  B. will use this loan to buy oil and tools for her shop.  In the future, she would like to make the repair component of her business bigger so that she can earn enough to send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy motor oil for her shop

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: "LAPO has showered good things on me," says Mrs. Eunice Umeoberiri. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. Eunice hopes to expand her business with a loan of US$ 750.

loans.use: To buy more electrical equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fruit selling business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana and Javier started their family with many dreams and yearnings in life to offer the best to their children that they could desire to have. At the present time, this young couple work in the manufacture of coats - work that they learned in the workshop of Javier's mother. Thanks to the effort and dedication that they put forth, they have now mastered their work and have decided to work every day of the week beginning very early in the morning. Their dream is to have their own workshop for coats, in which they hope to process a great quantity of items for export. For this Roxana is asking for a loan of $275 dollars, money which she will invest in the purchase of raw materials for a better completed product. She is promising to reimburse the loan in a period of 6 months. "This young couple needs you, in your hands is the power to help them."

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana y Javier, formaron una familia con muchas ilusiones y anhelos de prosperar en la vida y ofrecerles lo mejor a los hijos que desean tener.Esta joven pareja actualmente se dedica a la confección de buzos, labor que aprendieron en el taller de la madre de Javier, gracias al empeño y dedicación que pusieron actualmente ya perfeccionaron su trabajo y han decidido laborar todos los días de la semana desde muy temprano.El sueño es tener su propio taller de confección de buzos, en donde desean elaborar gran cantidad de prendas para lograr su exportación al exterior, para esto Roxana solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la un mejor acabado y confección de las mismas, comprometiéndose a reembolsar el préstamo en un período de 6 meses.“Esta joven pareja te necesita, en tus manos está poder ayudarlos”

loans.use: Purchase of material manufacturing coats

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna has always demonstrated to be a hard working woman. She was born and raised in a farming family. Her upbringings helped her in always looking forward. Since childhood her parents taught her the ways to cultivate and grow the land. She offers her communication services to her community through a radio transmitter that helps the community know what is happening in the municipality. Giovanna is very satisfied with the work she’s doing and she really enjoys working for the community, she does it really happily and she also contributes economically to the house expenditures. She helps support her two and five year old children. She needs a loan so she can invest in the radio transmitter and also to buy some seeds to plant and fertilizer. Let’s help Giovanna provide well being to her loving family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Giovanna, siempre demostró ser una mujer de trabajo, ella nació y creció en una familia netamente agricultora. Ésta formación la ha ayudado a salir adelante, debido a que desde su niñez sus padres le han enseñado la forma de cultivar y hacer producir la tierra. También brinda servicios de comunicación a la población de su comunidad, a través de un trasmisor de radio que sirve a la comunidad para los avisos que emite la municipalidad.Giovanna se siente muy satisfecha del trabajo que realiza, a ella le agrada mucho colaborar con los miembros de su comunidad y lo hace muy gustosa y aprovecha estas oportunidades también para contribuir económicamente con sus amados hijos de dos y cinco años.Para seguir adelante solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en el mantenimiento de su radio transmisor de noticias y buenas nuevas y también para comprar mejores semillas y abonos para sus cultivos.Unámonos con Giovanna para que continúe generando bienestar a su querida familia.

loans.use: Mantenimiento del radio transmisor y compra de semillas y abonos para continuar y mejorar su producción.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene always feels an immense satisfaction when seeing her delicious orange and citrus crops, products she adequately tends to being that she places an enormous amount of effort on each one of them. In the company of her children, who are the reason for all her work, she does her job with the purpose of always seeing them happy. Additionally, she has been planning on opening a small store at home hoping that it can provide for a part of her family’s daily expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a noble contribution from each one of us, since with this loan she will be able to obtain a greater amount of citrus products and thus increase their quality and quantity and in that way, open her much-desired store. Let’s support this noble mother’s wishes to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Marlene, siempre siente una inmensa satisfacción al ver sus cultivos de cítricos y deliciosas naranjas, productos que cuida adecuadamente ya que pone en cada uno de ellos un enorme esfuerzo.En compañía de sus hijos, los cuales son la razón de todo el trabajo que realiza, inicia sus labores con el propósito de verlos siempre felices. De manera adicional tiene pensado aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa a fin de que este negocio pueda suplir parte de los gastos diarios de su familia. Por esta razón solicita la noble contribución de cada uno de vosotros, ya que a través de un préstamo podrá obtener una mayor producción de cítricos e incrementará su calidad y cantidad para así poder tener la anhelada tiendita. Apoyemos el propósito de esta noble madre para progresar.

loans.use: Purchase capital to increase the quality and quantity of her citrus crops so that she may open a store in her home.

loans.name: Vladelina

texts.en:
Vladelina is a hard-working entrepreneur from Nicopol, Ukraine. She owns a clothing sales business where she sells quality clothing at the large Central Market in Nicopol. Vladelina started her business about four years ago and has developed a reputation for hard work, honesty and for being one who recognizes and acts on good opportunities. Her business has done well, providing a stable income for her family. She makes about $800 in a typical month.

Vladelina has requested a loan to add to her working business capital. Her goal is to invest in the further growth and development of her business so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta sells food in a food stand in the area of San Pedro in the City of La Paz. Her husband is a craftsman and makes shoes. That is how together they generate the necessary income to cover their family expenses, including the school expenses of their 2 children.

Antonieta and her family live in the area of Las Nieves in the City of La Paz.

Antonieta requests the loan to buy wholesale potatoes, rice and noodles. These are the main ingredients she uses to cook and their price has increased due to the “Niña phenomenon* that has affected Bolivia.

This is the 5th loan Antonieta has requested from Impro and her credit history allows her to get it. All her prior loans have been completely paid.

(*Note from the translator: La Niña phenomenon is blamed for fueling torrential rains and massive flooding across Bolivia's Amazon region during recent months)

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonieta es vivandera; tiene un puesto de venta de comida en la zona San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. El esposo es artesano y confecciona calzados y de esta manera logran sus ingresos con los que cubre los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Las Nieves de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito requerido será utilizado para capital de trabajo y comprar papa, arroz y fideo por cantidad para poder abastecerse porque estos productos son su materia prima y están subiendo de precio por el fenómeno de la niña que castigo a Bolivia.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle otro préstamo. Los cuatro créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: To buy wholesale potatoes, rice and noodles

loans.name: Luisa Guillermina

texts.es:
In the municipality of Villanueva of the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Luisa J. dedicates her time working as a housewife and her husband as a farmer in order to maintain their home and their three children.

Unfortunately, through time the condition of the house where Mrs. Luisa lives has been deteriorating and due to their low income they have not been able to make any improvements. This is the reason for her wise request for a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of construction materials to continue with the improvements of her home. This will enable her to provide better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Luisa J. se dedica a la labor de ama de casa y su esposo al negocio agropecuario para mantener el hogar y sus tres hijos a su cargo.

Lastimosamente a través de los años la casa de habitación de la señora Luisa ha venido deteriorándose grandemente y al poseer bajos ingresos económicos no han logrado mejorar esta situación por lo que muy sabiamente ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción con el propósito de continuar con el mejoramiento del hogar y así darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Sevlija

texts.en: Sevlija was born in 1976 and  she is married. She lives with her husband in a small village near the town of Gračanica.  Her husband works as a builder in a construction firm. His monthly salary is 700 KM (about US$ 575) and he has a full-time job. Sevlija has one cow and she sells milk and milk products. She wants to buy another cow to produce more milk in order to increase monthly income for her household.

loans.use: To buy a second cow

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en: Nasira Quasim is 42 years old, and her husband is 50 years old. She resides in a two room brick house in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Nasira make decorative embroidery and sells flour for a living. She has applied for a loan of $1,200 in order to expand her decorative embroidery business.  She has been joined by several other entrepreneurs to form a loan group: Violet wants a loan for her paint business; Hamidan wants a loan for her shuttering business; Naziran wants loan for her cycles business; and Shaheen wants a loan for her animal food business.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own businesses. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible and will make up the difference.

loans.use: To give expansion to their businesses

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Fatoumata Konaté, 41, lives with her husband and her 7 children in a traditional African family, together with her husband’s brothers, in the first neighborhood of Koutiala Prefecture, Sikasso Region.

For societal reasons, she was obliged to abandon her studies in favor of taking up a money-earning activity. She makes local soap (Gabacourini) based on residue from cotton processing. She learned this business from a women’s group in the town of Koutiala. She does her work at home.

As she has 8 years’ experience in the manufacture of local soap, her products are very much appreciated by consumers. She sells what she makes in the Koutiala market and at weekly fairs in nearby villages. With the present loan (her 5th loan through Soro Yiriwaso) she plans on buying 6 barrels of cotton residue, 1 barrel of potash, and firewood. She expects to earn an average profit of US$ 120 a month, which she hopes to use to make payments on the loan and help her husband to cover family expenses.

In future, she hopes to be an industrialist (open a soap-making factory).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Fatoumata Konaté a 41 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 7 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle africaine en compagnie des frères de son mari dans le premier quartier de la préfecture de Koutiala région de sikasso.

Pour des raisons sociales, elle était dans l’obligation d’abandonner les études pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus. Elle exerce l’activité de fabrication de savon locale (Gabacourini) sur base de résidus des unités de transformation de coton. Elle a appris cette activité auprès d’une association de femme de la ville de Koutiala. L’activité est exercée à domicile.

Avec 8 ans d’expérience dans la fabrication de savon local, sa production est très appréciée par les consommateurs. Elle vend sa production au marché de Koutiala et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants. Avec le prêt actuel (5e prêt auprès de Soro Yiriwaso), elle compte acheter six (6) barriques de résidus de coton, une (1) barrique de potasse et du bois de chauffe. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000 FCFA par mois, avec .lequel elle espère payer les intérêts du prêt et aider son époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.

Dans l’avenir elle envisage être une industrielle (mettre en place une usine de fabrication de savon.)

loans.use:
Purchase of raw material for making soap

Achat de matière première pour le savon

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery is 31 years old and completed her education through the third year of secondary school. She is married and the mother of three children who still rely on her support. She belongs to the communal bank “Lupakas” of the Huariquisana community, located in the Piculyo district of the Puno region. With her first loan of 300 soles, she invested in the purchase of materials for making rope. She has done this activity for ten years, with the help of her husband and son. With the loan of 2,000 soles, to be repaid over four months, she will purchase 3 packages of hemp material, 2 packages of raffia, and other items. This business is generating more income, but she still needs additional capital to meet the demand in the markets of Ilave and Juliaca both wholesale and retail. Mery is very content because over the past few years she has grown her business as well as her income. Her biggest dreams include the purchase of a means of transportation to move from market to market, and to have children who become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mery tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, es casada, madre de tres hijos que aún depende de ella. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Lupakas de la comunidad Huariquisana, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de EL Collao Ilave y Región Puno. Con su préstamo inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió en la compra de material para la elaboración de sogas. Esta actividad ha emprendido hace 10 años con el apoyo de su esposo e hijo. Con el préstamo de S/.2,000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 4 meses, comprará 3 paquetes de material tipo cáñamo, 2 paquetes de material tipo rafia entre otros. Este negocio esta generando más ganancia, pero ella aún necesita más capital para cubrir la demanda en los mercados de Ilave y Juliaca por mayor y menor. Mery esta contenta, por que en los últimos años esta creciendo su negocio e ingresos económicos y su mayor sueño es adquirir una movilidad para traslado de mercadería y tener hijos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies/raw materials.

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 44 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 26 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and coconut seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Mtumwa is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon D. is 40 years old and widowed with two children. She makes and sells rattan baskets, earning around US$5.00 per day. Her children are young and need much care, which is why she works so hard every day. In order to grow her business and increase sales, Mon needs a loan to purchase more raw materials with which to make additional baskets to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rattan to make additional baskets to sell.

loans.name: Shamim Badar Din's Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is the wife of B. D. and lives in an area named Riwind, Paksitan. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son sells clothes. The middle sone drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her youngest son and her daughter work in a cotton factory. Shamim baji herself has a thread-making business. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her son’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shamim baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy more mobile phones for her mobile phone shop. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy carpets and rugs to resell at a market. Azra baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehcile).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Ul N., 53, is married and lives with three children and her husband in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers, growing rice. They also use their grinding mill to service the people in the area, to take off the rice husk. On average, they earn around US$15 combined in revenue per day. Ul N. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a tractor. This tractor will be hired to the local people to transport rice crops and goods for profit.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Angelica Y. E. is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. She is a 28-year-old single mother with one child. Angelica sells “emoliente,” a hot drink with curative properties. She works every morning and every night selling her emoliente on the street outside of a local inter-provincial transport company. She also has a small stand at the Alipio Ponce Academy, where she sells sweets.  Angelica needs a loan of $275 to buy sweets and to fix her cart.  Angelica dreams of owning her own home, of expanding her business, and of providing her son with a good education.   Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: To buy sweets for sale and to fix vending cart

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Mme A. Mawussé est une femme mariée a à sa charge six (O6) personnes. Avec son commerce de paniers, et de pôts  et quelques condiments de cuisine, elle n’arrive pas à subvenir aux charges du ménage par manque de moyens financier suffisants. Pour agrandir son étalage et avoir plus de clientèles, elle sollicite un financement. Elle pourra mieux se prendre en charge et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mawussé A., age 48, has six people in her care. Doing commerce in baskets, containers, and a few culinary condiments, she has not been able to support her household due to a lack of sufficient financial means. To expand her display of goods and to have more customers, she is requesting financing. She will then be able to support herself and provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell household goods

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
CONSUELO S. DÍAZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes”, ubicada en el Jr. Atenas del Ucayali N° 349, Distrito de Callería tiene 25 años de edad, 02 hijos menores, su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró implementos para vender comida en un puesto del mercado N° 03, adquirió muchos clientes por su sazón y atención, con la ayuda de su mamá.

El último préstamo que recibió fue de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró arroz 20 kg., azúcar 08 kh., aceite 12 litros, una docena de platos, vasos, una docena de cubiertos, ambientación de su local, ahora tiene personal que trabaja para ella.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, se siente contenta porque de tal manera también colabora en su hogar.
texts.en:
Consuelo S. D. belongs to the communal bank, "Mujeres Líderes" (Women Leaders). She is 25 and has 2 young children. Her husband is a logger. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles. With it, she purchased supplies to sell food in a market. She acquired many clients because of her good food and service and with the help of her mother. The last loan she received was for 2,000 nuevos soles. She purchased 20 kg of rice, 8 kg of sugar, 12 liters of oil, one dozen plates, glasses, and one dozen place settings. She also fixed up her location. Now she has employees who work for her. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her. She feels happy because in this way she can help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She purchased 20 kg of rice, 8 kg of sugar, 12 liters of oil, one dozen plates, glasses, one dozen place settings, and fixed up her location.  She now has employees that work for her.

loans.name: Sahriati

texts.id:
Warung makanan yang dikelola Sahriati setiap pagi mulai pukul 03.00 Sudah mulai ramai karena para nelayan yang sudah berlabuh mencari ikan sudah mulai datang untuk mulai makan dan minum.Walauun masih tergolong tergolong sederhana,namun itulah yang menjadi usaha yang menjadisumber penghasilan.Suaminya tidak mempunyai pekerjaan tetap sehingga dapat senantiasa membatu sahriati apabila diperlukan.

Pinjaman Modal usahayang diberiakan oleh Yayasan DINARI untuk yang kedua kalinya dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya yaitu untuk berbelanja segala keperluan usaha warung makannya.Untuk berbelaja kebutuhan masakanya dilakukan setiap hari dipasar,berbelanja makan ringan  biasanya dilakukan dalam satu minggu dua kali. Kentungan bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp.100.000  jika situasi sedang ramai terutama pada musim banyak ikan di dermaga.
texts.en:
Sahriati opens her food kiosk at 3 am in the morning. It is already busy at early hours in the morning, as sailors and fishermen comes back from night at sea to have breakfast. The kiosk is simple, but it is Sahriati's only income source. Her husband does not have steady job, so he can help Sahriati when needed. She is applying for second business loan from DINARI to increase her working capital to purchase more ingredients. She purchases ingredients from the market daily. She earns profit about $10 per day in peak fishing season.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Awori Patricia Group

texts.en:
Awori P. is 49 years old, and she is married with two children, ages 24 and 26 years. She and her family stay in a one-room house. She also looks after an additional family member in her house. She provides three meals a day for her family. Her greatest expense each month is rent for her shop. She has a retail shop in a market near her home. She also works 6 days a week and she has over 10 customers a day. She has had this business for 3 years.

She has been with MCDT for 6 years, and she has received 12 loans so far from MCDT. She has also worked with her group for 6 years. Awori P. plans to use this loan to increase her business and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Increase the stock of items to sell in retail shop

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 52 años, es madre de 8 hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro. A lado de su pareja, tratan de brindarles los mejores cuidados, pues hace 30 años compraron una casa donde vive toda la familia unida. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo, quien es carpintero, para ayudarlo en los trabajos que realiza tuvo que aprender algo de esta labor que en un inicio era complicada, pero con el paso de los años fue mejorando, pues su pareja la ayudó con las cosas fundamentales y así juntos estan dedicados a brindar su servicio de diseño en madera de  diversos objetos. El detalle es que  ambos no se dan abasto para el trabajo y requieren el apoyo de una tercera persona, pues la actividad de Dina está tornándose administrativa y requiere atender los pedidos de los clientes. Los 16 años de dedicarse a la carpintería la están agotando, y Dina espera que sus hijos sean el apoyo para su padre y ella poder instalar un negocio para vender dentro de su hogar. Ella viene trabajando con MFP hace 10 años, y ésta en su solicitud número 29, es una de las socias fundadoras de su banco comunal, y en transcurso de su permanencia vio pasar a muchas personas, pero siempre trató de mantener unido al grupo para lograr organización que no solo rinda crédito, sino que brinde oportunidades a las personas. Su préstamo de 1700 soles será invertido en la compra de materia prima necesaria para la producción de muebles que tienen que entregar con prontitud.
texts.en:
Dina is 52 years old and the mother of eight children who are her greatest treasure. Together with her husband, they try to provide the best care, so 30 years ago they bought a house where the entire family lives, united. She works together with her husband, who is a carpenter, to help him in his work. She realized she had to learn something about this work which at first was complicated, but improved with the passage of the years as her husband helped her with the fundamentals. Together they are dedicated to providing their service of designing diverse wood products.

The issue is that the two of them are not sufficient for the amount of work and they require the help of a third person so that Dina’s activities can become administrative and attending to customer requests. The 16 years that they have dedicated to carpentry is wearing them out, and Dina hopes that her children will become the support of her husband and that she can make a business in the home for selling their products.

Dina has been working with MFP for ten years, is making her 29th loan request, and is a founding member of the communal bank. In the course of her membership, she has seen the coming and going of many people, but she has always tried to keep the group united to achieve an organization that not only provides credit, but also provides opportunities to people. Her loan of 1700 PEN will be invested in the purchase of premium material necessary for the production of furniture that they have to deliver promptly.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Fa Bineta

texts.fr: Fa Bineta N. est une femme de 49 ans, mariée. Elle fait un petit commerce en détail d’encens, de parfum et souhaiterait renforcer cette activité. Elle envisage avec ses revenus, de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Fa Bineta N. is a 49-year-old married woman. She has a small retail business selling incense and perfume and would like to bolster her business. With her revenues, she envisions doing better in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell incense and perfume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase metal for making windows, doors and water tanks

loans.name: Minervas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Alto Lima a este pertenece la asociación “Minervas”, formado por quince mujeres, trabajan junto a la familia de Pro Mujer hace cinco años.
Este grupo tiene diferentes negocios, se dedican al tejido de chompas,confecion de cortinas,elaboracion de comida, servicio de te, venta de maletas, venta de dulces en kioscos y de forma ambulante. Ahora Afirman que necesitan de créditos para comprar  materia prima y/o productos en mayor cantidad, para ampliar sus ventas, tienen la seguridad que generaran mejores ganancias
texts.en:
The communal association “Minervas” finds its focal center in Alto Lima, in the city El Alto in La Paz, Bolivia. Minervas is comprised of 15 women who have worked alongside the Kiva field partner Pro-Mujer (For Women) for the past five years. This group has different businesses. They are dedicated to making sweaters, creating curtains, cooking meals, serving tea, selling luggage, and selling sweets via ambulatory kiosks. Now they state that they need credit in order to purchase raw materials and / or products in bulk in order to increase their sales. This will ensure that they can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and/or products

loans.name: Rehana Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics, dryer machines, and brushes for her beauty salon. Rukhsana kosar baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making and selling business.

Rehana baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. She is a very active lady and performs her duties very efficiently. Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a Punjabi food selling business. He sells samosas and pakodas to the community. Rehana baji also helps him by making the food. She is applying for a loan to buy cooking oil, spices, potatoes, and flour for her husband’s Punjabi food selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Khalida baji is shown her parlor in this picture.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband's food business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita manages a hog-raising business in their village of Barangay Linao Norte of Tuguegarao City. Now 49 years old, she has three children: Avelyn, 25 years old and working in Manila; Arthur, a soldier in Abra, and Vernon, 21 years old and a fourth year college student. Teresita’s husband Francisco works as a policeman in Tuguegarao City.

While grateful for her happy and blessed family, Teresita needs to help her husband in order to sustain their daily living and the education of her youngest child. This hardworking mother and generous neighbor is therefore requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of her hog-raising business.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Солибою 60 лет. У него есть жена и 4-ро детей. Три сына и одна дочь. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Единственная дочь Солибоя помогает по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Солибой пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Солибой очень надеется, что кредитование поможет ему в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Soliboy is 60 years old. He has a wife and four children. Three sons and one daughter. His oldest sons went to Russia for work. They send money which they earn there. The parents are saving this money so they can later spend it on their sons' weddings. Soliboy's only daughter is helping with the housework. His wife spins yarn. She goes to the market herself to sell it. Soliboy shepherds cattle in the mountains and comes back home very late. Soliboy is very hopeful that this loan will help to grow his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socio del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Delfina es casada tiene 54 años, tiene  cinco hijos todos son mayores.
Desfina trabajo en un puesto de periódico como ayudante por un tiempo de dos años, y se independizó cuando tenia  17 años desde entonces ella solo se dedica a la venta de periódico, empezó en la victoria, pero se mudo a San Juan de Miraflores donde se compro un terrenito y hizo su casa, y  en una esquina se ha puesto a vender periódico con  la ayuda de su hija menor. 
Desde que Delfina esta en Finca   aprendió mas de cómo administrar  su negocio
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de periódicos, revistas, álbumes, figuritas. 
El sueño de delfina es llenar su puesto con variedad de revista y periódicos.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd) Community Bank. She is married, 54 years old, and has five adult children. Delfina worked as an assistant in a newspaper kiosk for two years, and then at the age of 17 she started her own business selling newspapers. She began in La Victoria neighbourhood, and then moved to San Juan de Miraflores where she bought a piece of land and built a house. On one corner she has started to sell newspapers with the help of her youngest daughter. Since Delfina has been with Kiva partner Finca she has learned more about running her business. She needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy newspapers, magazines, albums, and figurines. Her dream is stock her kiosk with a wide range of magazines and newspapers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy newspapers, magazines, albums, and figurines

loans.name: Cathy

texts.fr: Cathy N. est une femme de 44 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits et légumes sur étal. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin d’augmenter son capital pour ainsi mieux venir à bout des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Cathy N. is a 44-year-old woman and the mother of six children. She sells fruits and vegetables in a stall. She is requesting this loan to increase her capital, so as to cover family expenses more easily.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Try And See Group

texts.en:
"Try and see" is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Jerry S., living in Rock Town, Water Street, a populated market area in Monrovia, Liberia. Jerry is not married and doesn’t have any children. He is an 11th grade drop-out due to poverty.

Jerry’s business is clothing, buying clothes wholesale and selling them retail to his customers in Waterside. He has been running his business for 3 years. His dream is to grow his business until he can build a larger permanent shop. He is taking the loan to buy additional clothing wholesale to serve his customers. With the profits from his business, Jerry dreams of sending his children to school and building a house of his own.

loans.use: To buy more clothing wholesale to expand his business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina M. is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Lina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fist loan taken out by Lina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Dede G.

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert l’année dernière dans le quartier de Forever à Lomé une boutique d’alimentation générale, très visitée de beaucoup de personnes. C’est une boutique dans la quelle les produits en vente sont bien ordonnés et arrangés. Elle accueille toujours bien sa clientèle et compte de nombreux clients fidèles dans le quartier. Elle-même habite le quartier d’Agbalépédogan à Lomé, pourtant situé à quelques kilomètres de Forever où se trouve sa boutique. Elle a fait ce choix à cause du bon emplacement de cette boutique, où elle réalise à cet effet de bonnes affaires. Elle dispose un rayon spécial pour les boissons alcoolisées de bonne qualité. Elle sollicite urgemment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter différents cartons de boissons alcoolisées mais aussi des cartons de savons de toilettes, des papiers hygiéniques et bien d’autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Lydia Murangi

texts.en:
Lydia is 40 years old, married and has two children. Five years ago, Mary decided to start a business to put her children through school. She started by purchasing a kerosene pump. She grew her business and until she had three kerosene pumps. Lydia decided to sell that business and took out a loan to purchase a building. Lydia's building has 35 rooms which she rents out to families in a very low income area. 

This is Lydia's third loan with KADET. She used her previous loan to paint the building and install running water. With this loan, Lydia will purchase electricity meters for her tenants so that they can regulate their own electric consumption. 

In the future, Lydia hopes to expand her business and enter into the business of renting higher value rental homes.


”About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase electricity meters for her tenants so they can regulate their own electric consumption

loans.name: Leonila

texts.es: La señora Leonila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun están bajo su poder.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Leonila, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Leonila, 40, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank located in the Sacanche district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are still dependent on her. Her character and desire to see her dreams realized motivated her to start her own grocery sales business, the profits therefrom would be used to help defray household expenses. From the beginning until the present day, she has been gaining customers. Today, she can count on her regular customers who daily come by her store to buy because they find with her all the products that a housewife could want and they are waited on by herself personally with the charisma that is so characteristic of her. With this 1,000 sol loan she will by sacks of rice and sugar, crackers, pastas and packages of salt, boxes of milk and fish preserves of various brands, flats of eggs and personal hygiene articles to continue to provide her customers with better service. Leonila feels good to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like herself to have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase inventory.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama MANE est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis 3 ans, elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama Mané, aged 42, is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the village bank Sinthiang Coundara for three years. She produces and sells peanut butter. She participates in the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 29 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife. Since 1999, Saeed has been working as a furniture upholsterer. Saeed is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase a sewing machine for his work. This is the first time that Saeed has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Saeed is known for his good work. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Saeed decided on his business because he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
Con mucha dedicación, el señor José Ramón T.  se dedica a trabajar como conductor en una empresa del municipio de Somotillo donde él vive y tiene a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en edades escolares.
Como todo padre responsable, ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque esto ha sido muy necesario por la razón que su vivienda ha tenido dificultades por lo que es de necesidad la reconstrucción. 
Con esta finalidad es que solicitó el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la reconstrucción y que su cónyuge e hijos se sientan satisfechos de tener un padre que se preocupa por ellos y que les brinda un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
. José Ramón T. is a driver for one of Somotillo's municipal departments. He lives in Somotillo with his wife and two school-age children. Like any responsible father, he has begun to improve his home because his house has needed repairs for some time. With this end in mind, he has requested funding to buy building materials so that his wife and children will feel happy to have a father who worries about them and provides a worthy home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes L. C. de 51 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en Prolongación Graú – Parcona – Ica vive con su esposo el sr. Juan Medrano Cabezas ellos tienen 3 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y aportan en casa solo uno tiene 15 años y estudia en el colegio San Luis Gonzaga de Ica.
La sra se dedica a la venta de verduras picadas embolsadas empezó vendiendo tubérculos ya tiene en este negocio 14 años trabaja desde las 5.00 am hasta las 12.00 pm en el mercado Toledo y en las tardes se dedica a picar la verdura para el día siguiente su esposo es maestro de construcción y ambos con su trabajo han logrado construir su vivienda y ahora cuentan con una ahorro y desean invertir en la compra de una mototaxi que le permita darle una mejor estabilidad a sus hijos quienes trabajan eventualmente en construcción y en alquiler de mototaxi por eso ellos están haciendo un esfuerzo ya que desean que sus hijos sigan adelante y su mayor sueño es que su hijo menor logre estudiar una carrera que le permita defenderse mejor en la vida.
La sra es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora al igual que su esposo ellos gozan de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes dicen que son bien trabajadores y de esa manera han sacado adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes L. C. is 51 years old; her house is located in Prolongación Graú – Parcona – Ica and she lives with her husband, Juan Medrano Cabezas. They have 3 children, 2 of whom are of-age and help support the family, and one son who is 15 years old and studies in the high school, San Luis Gonzaga of Ica. Mercedes sells chopped bagged vegetables. She started selling tubers 14 years ago; she works from 5:00am until 12 pm in the Toledo market and in the afternoons she chops vegetables to sell the following day. Her husband is a master of construction and together with his job they have constructed their house and now have some savings they would like to invest in the purchase of a mototaxi, which would allow them to provide more stability to their children who will eventually work in construction and mototaxi hire. For this they are trying very hard; they want their children to progress forward and their greatest dream is for their youngest son to study a career that will allow him to have a better life. Mercedes is a very enterprising woman and a fighter like her husband. They enjoy good references from their neighbors who say they are good workers and in this manner have achieved progress for this children.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a 30-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Basem has been working as a curtain sewer and installer for two years now. He sells his own curtain fabric, but his clients are also free to come with their own. His clients are people from his region. Basem is known for his good and talented work. 

He decided on opening his curtain sewing factory after he gained experience. When he first started, he had some financial issues because of the cost of his sewing machines and fabrics, and the rent of the place was high, but as soon as he started working and making himself known, he increased his number of clients. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase curtain fabrics and to repair one of his sewing machines. This is the first time that Basem has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase curtain fabric and to repair one of his sewing machines.

loans.name: Candido

texts.es:
El Sr. Cándido es casado con la Sra. Maria tienen 2 hijas menores que aún son pequeñas están en la escuela primaria.
El se dedica a la venta de cubiertas y en el mismo lugar tienen  una despensa en donde venden mercaderías el por mayor.
El se dedica a esta actividad hace aproximadamente 10 años, El se inicio en esta actividad en forma ambulante hasta que consiguió un local para abrir su negocio.
Además de su actividad la Sra. Maria tiene un puesto de venta de ropas en el micro centro para que con sus ingresos le ayude a Cándido con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijas.
El ha demostrado ser  una persona muy responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Cándido is married to Maria; they have two daughters, who are still little and go to elementary school. He sells retread tires but also has a wholesale products market. He has been in this line of work for about 10 years; at the beginning he did not have a fixed location from which to sell. Maria has a small clothing sales stand so that earnings from her sales can help Cándido meet household expenses and their daughters' educational expenses. He has shown himself to be a very responsible person with respect to his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, a 37-year-old married woman, raises hogs for a living. She has three children and her oldest child is now 18 years of age. One of the challenges she currently faces is her children’s education. School fees are increasing but she is determined to have them finish college. Her hog raising business is what her family depends on to provide their needs. She wants this business to prosper so she does her best to make it so. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI that she will use to buy additional piglets and feed for her hogs.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim T. is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to grow rice and vegetables to support her family. Her husband is a fisherman. Mrs. Yim T. and Mr. Sung Ouch are a couple who live with two children and two grandchildren: their children are laborers and their grandchildren are enrolled in the local public school. This family of six members lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. 

Although this family works hard, they do not earn enough income. Thus, Mrs. Yim T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cups for her business

loans.name: Dominic Kitipa

texts.en:
Dominic Kitipa N. is 26 years old. He is married to Nongishu N., and he is a father of one child, who is in school. 

Dominic is a farmer, and he has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.
  
He learned about KADET from a friend who is already KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant 20 acres of wheat, which has proved to do very well in this area, and keep some sheep for fattening to sell later. With the profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production. The area has a favorable climate for wheat farming, making him consider wheat farming only.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land for planting more wheat for commercial purpose and be the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To prepare land for wheat farming

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 43 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She is a happy and hard working woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business since 6 years and she hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Katty

texts.en:
Katty H. P. is a 40-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband and sons in Batón, Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. Katty owns a pizzeria where she prepares and sells pizza as well as other fast food items. Katty´s pizzeria is located in a busy location, in the same building where she lives. Her family helps her to carry out the daily responsibilities of running the pizzeria. The majority of her regular clients work in the surrounding area. These include banana field labourers and telecommunications sector employees. Katty plans to open a second pizzeria in Jimenez; for this reason she needs to buy another oven. This loan will be used to finance the purchase of equipment necessary for the production of pizza and for general investment in her food sales business. 

Katty says she wakes up every day aspiring to provide better services to her clients. She strives to always be improving her business processes. She says her main obstacle is access to working capital. This loan will help to solve that problem. The loan consultant that has been working with Katty describes her as a hardworking woman with an entrepreneurial spirit. In the past, Katty has been a responsible client with a history of punctual repayments. This will be her seventh loan with Fundación Mujer. Katty says her business is going well and she is having success in finding new clients.

loans.use: For the purchase of an oven and general business investment

loans.name: Sunrise Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Cynthia is currently the group leader of Sunrise Trust bank group made up of 4 members. Cynthia is clearly a hard worker. She is 30 years old and sells cosmetics to customers in her community market. She also engages in farming to supplement her income. Cynthia has been operating her business for four years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to invest the loan to purchase assorted cosmetics like make-up, bracelets, etc. to meet her customers’ demand. It is one of her dreams that one day she will be able to rent a shop to ease her stress of trekking. 

Cynthia is married and she is the mother of seven children from age 1-12 years. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits that she will be able to provide tertiary education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun S., 49 years old, is a villager who lives in Trapeang Kralanh village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ok Horm, own a plot of land where they cultivate rice and earn a small income to support their family.

Mrs. Hun S. is asking for a loan to buy an ox to add with her older ox to support her farming chores.

The couple has five children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other three study in the local school and also help their parents with farming. Mrs. Hun S.'s husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an ox.

loans.name: Ana Theresa

texts.en:
Ana Theresa B. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Ana Theresa is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Ana Theresa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Ana Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ana Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana Theresa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ana Theresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia G. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   general store, rental, and farming businesses.  She lives in Prk. Serena, Brgy Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, rental, and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. 

Amalia is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her businesses.  This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Amalia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  'Dungganon' way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pigs, corn, and condiments

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a hard-working father of three sons and one daughter. His children are all under 18 years old. Mahmoud is a Palestinian National Authority employee; he works to ensure a good living and education to his children. For the last couple of years Mahmoud started working with his wife who opened a small tailoring workshop to help her husband. He is working harder as the conditions in Palestine are becoming harder. 

Mahmoud took a loan from FATEN to purchase cloth needed to answer the increasing demand for his wife's good work. The workshop produces clothes for woman and men in the city of Jenin. 

Mahmoud appears in the picture here at FATEN's office while receiving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila A. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Cirila is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cirila owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Cirila has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cirila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cirila is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional firewood to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cirila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
