Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James K. is 35 years old. He is married and has two children, aged 4 and 7 years. They hope to give them a good education to the university level.

His business is located at a busy area in Kakamega. He sells an assortment of goods, including mobile-phone accessories like chargers and batteries. He also sells such items as watches, radios, extension cables, etc., to the local people. He has been doing this business for four years and has two employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

He is using his loan of 48,000 Keyan shillings to buy more mobile-phone accessories to grow his business and meet the demand from his customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as very hardworking, determined and focused.

loans.use: Mobile accessories

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children. It is a stable home of hardworking parents. They live in the Valle de los Incas in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura, which is a rural zone on the costal plain in the northern part of Peru.

Celia operates a small restaurant and bar, called a picanteria, which is located in the front of her home. It is open Thursday – Monday. Celia sells various local dishes, primarily fish dishes, along with the necessary beverages. The combination of ceviche (fresh fish with red onion and lime juice) and one of the local beers is a very popular dish in the region, and one that earns her many loyal customers.

Celia’s husband is a farm worker who manages a small plot of land on which the family grows lemons and mangos.

This is Celia’s first loan with our institution. She plans to use the proceeds to expand her offerings of beverages and food. She hopes this will allow her to increase her profits and expand her market share.

loans.use: Expand her offerings of beverages and food within her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 08 hijos (06 dependientes), tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años, su  préstamo inicial  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de golosinas y helados.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar mercaderías para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un negocio de salchimote. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la organización y capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Dorotea is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, in the department of Puno.  She is 44 years old, married and has 8 children (6 of whom are dependent on her).  She completed her primary education.

Dorotea has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling candies and ice cream.

She is requesting a new loan for 800 nuevos soles which will be invested in buying merchandise for her business.

Her dream is to have a business selling 'salchimote' (a fast food made of fried corn, chicken and sausage).  What she most likes about her community bank is the organization and the training sessions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es: Maritza Elena tiene 55 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de comida.  Esta no es la primera que realiza financiamientos, por lo que siempre ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Todos los días elabora y vende comida de día y por las noches ella busca la forma de sacar adelante a su familia. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida.
texts.en: Maritza Elena is 55 years old. She works as a food vendor. This is not the first time she has taken out a loan, and has always demonstrated her ability to pay her installments on time. Every day Maritza Elena makes and sells food during the day and at night she looks for other ways for her family to get ahead. She has been dedicated to this business for over 21 years. She is a very hardworking person and enjoys this doing this for a living.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian de 47 años, nunca se caso pero si tuvo un hijo que en la actualidad es mayor de edad y desde hace muchos años se fue a vivir a España para conseguir una estabilidad económica y poderle ayudar a su madre. Para tener una actividad económica y no quedarse sola ella acepto la propuesta que le hizo una amiga en donde ella seria vendedora de productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). 

En la actualidad realiza su trabajo sola. Trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un valor muy económico. Ella tiene pensado seguir trabajando para asegurar su vejez. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere una actividad económica que no tenga que caminar mucho, por eso quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Lilian is 47 years old.  She never married, but she did have a child.  Her child is grown, and he went to live in Spain many years ago.  He went to get financial security and to be able to help his mother.

In order to have a financial activity and to not be alone, she accepted the proposal that a friend made.  She would sell Yanbal (business that offers enterprising women a start with independent sales) products.  She currently works alone.  She starts work very early by offering her products to her friends and neighbors.  She sells perfume, creams, and deodorants at a very economical price.  She is planning to continue working in order to secure her old age.

She wants to use the loan to buy Yanbal products like perfumes, creams, and deodorants.  In the future she would like to have a business activity where she does not have to walk a lot.  That is why she wants to have a stationery store.

loans.use: Creams and perfumes

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea Mourn, 62, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Mourn is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. The family has to spend USD 37 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Mourn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Mourn appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials necessary things for her business

loans.name: Charles Wambua

texts.en:
Charles Wambua N. is 33 years old, married to Margaret Nyambura, and they have one child. He has been selling timber in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last two years.

Charles was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his fourth loan; he has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use his loan to add to his stock of timber for sale in his lumber yard.

In the future, Charles hopes to grow his business and become a leading supplier of timber in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: La Proyección De San José Group

texts.es:
Mily, tiene 24 años D. edad, desD. muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres ya que no contaban con los recursos necesarios para solventar sus gastos, tiene 2 hijos menores. Integra el grupo “L. Proyección D. San José”, como Presidenta
Actualmente su pareja trabaja como taxista, pero el dinero que gana es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades básicas es por ello que Mily  toma L. decisión D. colaborar con los gastos, recordó que su mamá tenía un carrito sanguchero y decidió utilizarlo para vender salchipapas en L. puerta D. su casa. Gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo por las ventas  y el esfuerzo D. ambos pueden cubrir L. pensión escolar D. sus hijos y movilidad. Uno D. los sueños D. Mily es poder tener su propio restaurante para que haya más ingresos y tengan una mejor calidad D. vida. Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en L. compra D. un estándar y mercaderías para L. venta D. útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Mily is 24 years old and since she was very young, she has had to work to support her parents because they didn't have the resources to meet all of their expenses.  She currently lives in the A.H. San José Mz. H Lt. 01 neighborhood in the district of Carabayllo.  She is married and has two young children.  She is a member of the group "L. Proyección D. San José”.  

Her husband works as a taxi driver, but he doesn't earn enough money to meet all of their basic needs, so Mily decided to contribute to their income.  She remembered that her mother had a food cart and she decided to use it to sell sausage and french fries from the door of her house.  Thanks to the income she earned from her sales and both of their effort, they were able to pay the school fees for their children.  

One of Mily's dreams is to have her own restaurant so she will earn more income and have a better quality of life.  With this loan, she wants to buy a standard and merchandise to sell school supplies.

loans.use: Purchase a standard to sell school supplies

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel D. is from the village of Namnama, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Rodel is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Rodel owns & operates a motorcycle transport in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rodel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to invest in expanding his business.  

Rodel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to repair the vehicle he uses to operate his business. This loan will be his 4th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repaid vehicle used for transport business

loans.name: Martha Gricely

texts.es:
Martha Gricely tiene 53 años, es soltera vive con el hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir en el negocio y aumentar la producción.

Le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Martha Gricely, 53, is single and living with her son.

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Martha farms corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for her crops.   Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather.  

Her dream is to stay in business and increase production.  She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
Maria Ana A. M. tiene 27 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria Ana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar más terrenos para aumentar la producción y comprar mas animales.

Le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Ana A. M. is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda canton of Bolivar province. She has 2 children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Grupo de Mujeres Muschuc Nan" meet in the community of Guanto Cruz in the Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This communal bank has 22 members who farm raspberries and corn and raise poultry and dairy cows in order to make cheese.

Maria cultivates raspberries and corn and raises poultry. She buys her products in Guaranda, and she sells her products in the Guaranda market.

She requests a loan to purchase supplies and animals to raise, and also to buy feed for the animals. The support of this loan will help her financially to obtain the supplies she needs. In her work she must deal with challenges such as pests, changing weather conditions and diseases that affect her crops. 

She dreams of purchasing more land so that she could increase her production and buy more animals.

She enjoys spending time with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animals to raise, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Nonoy

texts.es:
La señora Nonoy, es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
La socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo (Natura), ya tiene varios años trabajando con estos productos, Manuela Ramos ha estado contribuyendo con su negocio al brindarle los préstamos para  tener un capital que le permita comprar productos y mantener su stock.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,700.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 5 perfumes para mujer, 3 talcos para bebe, 5 cremas para manos, 3 paquetes de jaboncillos, 3 champú, 2 jabones liquido, 3 perfumes para hombres.
Tiene un buen stock de mercadería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes cuando se lo soliciten, todo lo que tiene le ha costado mucho trabajo, su esposo  es ejecutivo de una empresa y la suma de ambos ingresos le alcanza para poder mantener a su familia sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Sra. Nonoy is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” (United Hands) which is in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, married, and has five children.

Nonoy has been selling Natura beauty products from a catalog for several years. Manuela Ramos has contributed to her business by providing loans to use as capital, which has helped her buy products and maintain her inventory. With this new loan of 1700 PEN, she will buy five perfumes for women, three talcum powders for babies, five hand creams, three packets of miniature soaps, three shampoos, two liquid soaps, and three colognes for men.

Having a good stock of merchandise will allow her to provide these products to her customers whenever they ask for them. Everything she has requires a great deal of work. Her husband is a business executive and both of their incomes enable them to maintain their family without any problems.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, talcum powders, hand creams, soaps, shampoos, and colognes.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
In 2007, Caleb was working as a subcontractor in charge of 8 to 12-man construction crews working on a wide range of residential projects. When the real estate bubble burst, he like many in the construction industry went from having more work than he could handle to no work at all and his license as a contractor went inactive. 
 
Now, Caleb is ready to start working on big projects again, but this time as his own boss. “When I was working for general contractors, they weren’t even around most of the time. They’d leave me in charge of the crew and occasionally check in on the progress, but I was doing the work.” 
 
Caleb has never taken on debt, which, until recently, seemed like a good thing. However, because he avoided things like credit cards in the past, Caleb hasn’t built up a credit history. Not only does this make it difficult to secure a bank loan, but also a contractor’s license. 
 
“Before the recession, [to secure a license] they’d look at your performance and if there were any negative marks on your record. Now they look at your credit score, and if you don’t have a credit history that license gets a lot more expensive,” explained Caleb. 
 
When Caleb asked his bank for a small business loan to help him cover the costs of the license and insurance, which would allow him to take on a crew and larger jobs, they weren’t interested in providing the small amount he needed. Instead, the bank referred him to his local microlender, Opportunity Fund, where he was approved for a $3,500 microloan. 
 
With the loan, Caleb successfully secured his license, bond, and liability insurance. These three key elements will now help him grow his business. When asked if he had any favorite project to work on, he listed everything from elaborate door systems in Maui to decks in Marin County to old Victorian-style homes in San Francisco. “I love being able to see the improvement; to look at what I’ve done compared to what was there before. I like all the jobs I do, now that I think about it.”

loans.use: to renew his contractor license, purchase insurance, & establish credit

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio es productor lechero. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, para aumentar su producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Pucarani del departamento de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo.
texts.en: Gregorio is a dairy farmer. His loan will be used to buy a milking cow of medium quality so that he can increase milk production and hence, his income. He lives in his own home in the town of Pucarani in the La Paz region. He is married and has one son.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en: Khetam is a young woman from Tulkarem who is married. She has two daughters and three sons. Khetam is one of FATEN's committed borrowers. She received two loans and repaid them completely on time. Khetam took out a loan from FATEN as she could and her husband save and build their own house, Khetam needs $2,500 to install house accessories such as windows, doors and painting. Khetam's husband appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to finish her house that was built recently

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase yoga mats & accessories, furniture for her studio, and for the creation & design of her business website.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive junto a su pequeña hija Yadira de 11 años, juntas habitan en una casa alquilada ubicada en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de prendas de vestir, negocio que lo emprendió desde muy joven y conjuntamente con las ganas de salir adelante motivaron a que sea comerciantes, con el fin de cubrir las necesidades de su hija. Ella no cuenta con ningún apoyo  ya que el esposo que tuvo la abandono y desde entonces sola aprendió a sobresalir y adquirir todo lo que hasta el momento posee, que es su negocio y su capital. En un futuro muy próximo desea abrir un salón de belleza, pues para esto ella necesita un capital, por tal motivo es que desea recurrir a MFP para solicitar un crédito. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la cooperación de cada uno de ustedes para establecer su negocio.  Con los 1.000 nuevos soles comprará algunas maquinarias y equipos para emprender y abrir su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Lidia is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her daughter Yadira who is 11.  They live together in a rental house which is located in the village of Natividad, in Pichari district.

Lidia's business is selling clothes.  She started this business when she was very young.  Her desire to get ahead in life motivated her to become a saleswoman, with the goal of providing for her daughter's needs.  Lidia does not have any support because her husband left her.  Since that time, she has learned to do well and acquired everything that she now owns: her business and her capital.  In the very near future, she would like to open a beauty salon but she needs capital to do this.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from MFP.

This will be Lidia's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the cooperation of each and every one of you in helping her establish her business.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy some tools and equipment to set up and open her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment to set up her beauty salon business

loans.name: Kusi Cuna Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Kusi Cuna esta compuesto por la siguiente mesa directiva: el  presidente del grupo  es el señor Grover, se dedica a la repostería en su propio domicilio se dedica a la elaboración de pan, galletas pero mas empanadas,  su especialidad son las empanadas de queso se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 13 años, su familia esta compuesta de su madre el es soltero, el mantiene a su familia una gran responsabilidad para el, el monto que solicito es para comprar  harina y manteca por mayor  principalmente para la elaboración de sus empanadas, es un joven muy trabajador, con ganas de superación su deseo es el de poder tener su propia pasteleria y realizar variedad de galletas y tortas, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que es un aoportunidad para salir adelante.
texts.en: The 'Kusi Cuna' community bank has a board of directors.  The group president, Grover, makes and sells confectionery from his own home.  He makes bread, cookies and empanadas.  His speciality is cheese empanadas.  He has been in this business for 13 years.  His family consists of his mother and himself.  He is single.  He supports his family which is a great responsibility for him.  He is requesting this loan to buy flour and butter wholesale, mainly for making empanadas.  Grover is a very hard-working young man who has a desire to improve himself.  He would like to own his own cake shop and make a variety of cookies and cakes.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided which has provided him with an opportunity to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter for making empanadas

loans.name: Kereb

texts.en:
Kereb is a 36-year-old married man with two children. He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Kereb's dream is to educate his children and to buy land for farming.

Kereb has been selling agro veterinary products for 10 years. His major challenge is lack of enough capital to meet the demands of his customers. Kereb needs this loan to buy agro veterinary supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy agro veterinary supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 32 años vive en el caserío de Patay, ahí formó su familia junto a Teófilo, su esposo desde hace 13 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Hace algunos años junto a su esposo cuidaban de sus sembríos de arveja y flor de gladiolo. La agricultura, su principal actividad económica, le brindó el dinero necesario para poder sobrevivir. Pero hace poco se presentó la oportunidad de trabajar en la construcción de una hidroeléctrica, en donde su esposo Teófilo no desaprovecho la oportunidad y ahora se encuentra laborando, obteniendo así un dinero extra para el hogar. Mientras que Nancy toma la riendas del hogar, en el cuidado de sus cultivos, donde siembra en sociedad ya que no tiene el apoyo de su esposo y comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Además de incursionar hace poco en la apertura de una tienda de dulces donde obtiene un dinero extra, que le ayuda en los gastos de educación de sus hijos que estudian lejos, ya que desea brindarles una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Nancy de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Nancy, 32, lives in the village of Patay. There she started her family together with Teófilo, her husband of 13 years. They have 3 children who they care for in their own home. For some years they have cared for crops of peas and gladiolus flowers. Farming, their principal economic activity, has given them they money they needed to survive. But some time ago the opportunity arose to work on the construction of a hydroelectric dam. Her husband didn't want to miss this opportunity and now he is working, making extra money for their home. Meanwhile, Nancy took the reins of the home and caring for their crops. She plants them with a collective now that she doesn't have her husband's help, and she sells them in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Recently she also opened a candy store where she gets a little extra money which helps with school costs for her kids who study away from home because she wants to give them a good education. 

She belongs to the village bank "Picaflores de Patay" and this her 6th loan with MFP, where she hopes that the collaboration with all of you will allow her to continue working towards her goals. She promises to be punctual in her payments. Nancy will invest the requested money in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds and some sacks of natural fertilizer for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds and some sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lilia Erminia

texts.es:
Lilia tuvo fuerzas para seguir luchando luego de quedarse viuda, y a sus 54 años tuvo que pensar en subsistir, por lo cual hizo lo posible para poner su Depósito de Bebidas. Tuvo mucha suerte ya que en el sector no tuvo competencia. El trabajo lo realiza sola desde muy temprano, y como está ubicado en su propia casa se le facilita todo. 

Dentro de sus actividades ella realiza la venta de líquidos como colas, jugos helados que es lo mismo que desea comprar para incrementar su negocio, para ello aplicará para un préstamo. Sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad se sienten orgullosos y siempre la apoyan en todo cuanto pueden.

Para mejorar sus ingresos ella sueña comprarse un taxi y alquilarlo en una cooperativa dentro del sector de Duran que es donde ha vivido muchos años.
texts.en:
Lilia had the strength to keep fighting after she was widowed.  At 54 years of age she had to think about surviving.  She did what she could to establish her business of warehousing drinks.  She was very lucky because she had no competition in her sector.  She works alone starting very early in the morning.  As the business is located in her own house, it makes everything easier.

Among her business activities is selling liquids like colas and juices and ice cream.  These are the same things she wishes to buy in order to increase her business.  That is why she is requesting a loan.

Her children are adults, and she is proud of them.  They always help her as much as they can.

In order to improve her income she dreams of buying a taxi.  She would rent it to a cooperative in the Duran sector, which is where she has lived for a long time.

loans.use: to buy colas, juices, and ice cream.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Luz De Campo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Luz De Campo es conformado por Mayra  Del Rosario, Érica Del Carmen, Luz Mila, Nicolasa Danelia, Leyla Victoria, Nubia, Antonio, Anastacia Basilia, Julia Yamileth, Tomasa Del Socorro y Érica Del Carmen. Todas ellas son mujeres emprendedoras. Actualmente cuenta con 11 mujeres, con el programa y que les gustaría poder seguir con este gran proyecto. Mayra se dedica a la venta y elaboración de artesanía, desde hace más de 25 años,  Ella tiene el sueño de algún día poder construir su vivienda y así ofrecerle a sus hijos algo para el futuro. Los demás integrantes tienen diferentes actividades económicas y juntos se han asociado para obtener financiamiento en sus negocios.  Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas, pinceles jarrones entre otros.
texts.en:
The communal bank Luz de Campo is made up of Mayra  Del Rosario, Érica Del Carmen, Luz Mila, Nicolasa Danelia, Leyla Victoria, Nubia, Antonio, Anastacia Basilia, Julia Yamileth, Tomasa Del Socorro y Érica Del Carmen. They are all enterprising women. Currently there are 11 women with the program and they would like to be able to continue working with this great project. 

Mayra devotes herself to making and selling handicraft which she has done for over 25 years. She has the dream of some day being able to build her own home and thus offer her children something for the future. The other members have various businesses and have joined together to obtain financing in their ventures. She is requesting the loan to purchase paints, brushes, and vases among other items.

loans.use: to purchase paint, brushes, and vases among other items.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura, ganadería y turismo. 

Virginia desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado vacuno para comercializarlo, con la finalidad de obtener más clientes e ingresos y así mejoraría  la calidad de vida de su familia.  Virginia es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que desea es que su familia se supere brindándole otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has water and electricity.  Their home is located in the rural area of Lambayeque, where people earn their living through farming, raising livestock, and tourism.  
For the past several years, Virginia has been raising and selling cattle (cows).  Her corral is located outside her house.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses.  Once her animals reach optimum growth, she sells them to various markets in the area, which enables her to earn very good profits and pay for her family’s expenses.  
She has requested this loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more cattle to sell. Her goal is to obtain more customers, earn more income, and improve her family’s quality of life.  Virginia is hard-working and very responsible.  The only thing she wants is to provide other opportunities for her family to succeed.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Yovany

texts.es:
El señor Nelson Yovany se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domestico, sus ventas las realiza ambulantemente en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, tambienn viaja a la frontera con El Salvador para vender sus productos, Nelson vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, los cuales estan estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi tener mas variedad de productos, sus clientes son las personas que viajan.

el sueño de Nelson es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señor Nelson Yovany sells household products. He is a street vendor in the town of San Lorenzo. He also travels to the border with El Salvador to sell his products. Nelson lives with his wife and 2 children, who are both studying at the local school. He will use the loan to buy merchandise and thus have a bigger variety of products. His customers are people who travel.

Nelson's dream is to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy tooth brushes, toothpaste, nail clippers, flashlights, batteries, razors, locks, mirrors, scissors, electric extensions.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom (pictured here) and her husband, Sokry, have been married since 1979 and have two sons. One is a garment factory worker and the other one has full-time employment. The family is living in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Sarom and her husband are rice farmers. Her husband is also a construction worker. She is asking for her second loan of $300 in order to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 28 years old, single, and supports his parents. For the past three years, he has been in business running a quarry, selling waste stones in Narok.  

He was introduced to KADET by an already registered client. He is a good client and this is his first loan. He plans to use the loan to expand his business by employing manpower to aid in its operation.  Thus, he will be able to fast-track the production.

His dream is to be self-sustainable and, in the future, see his children live a better life.

loans.use: to expand his quarry business.

loans.name: Maguy

texts.en:
Maguy, a 48-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children, both of whom attend school, has been running a tailoring shop since 2005. Having worked for 21 years in tailoring, she is well-known in her town and surrounding areas.

Maguy, who produces clothes which she sells to multiple customers and clothing stores, is now requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional textiles. In the future, she hopes to expand her business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase additional textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase household appliances, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, a 52-year-old married mother of four, is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City, where she has been operating a specialized retail store selling a variety of food products for the past 15 years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dolores joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her second loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase more products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mawa B Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Mawa B group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

John takes care of 15 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, John had a good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  John was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, John will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mawa B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Munaa

texts.en:
Munaa 30, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past two years, she has been operating a cosmetic shop, selling to her local area residents. She faces a major challenge with fluctuation in prices of her products. Munaa dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her shop.

loans.name: Magda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Magda del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio ropa usada, cosméticos y productos químicos. Ella inicio en Adim en crédito solidario actualmente se graduó a crédito individual el cual piensa invertir en productos especialmente ropa.
texts.en: Sra. Magda del Socorro is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur who sells used clothing, cosmetics, and chemical products.  She started with ADIM by participating in a solidarity loan, but now she has graduated to an individual loan.  Magda plans to invest in products, especially clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and married. She has two children. 

To earn a living, she does tailoring. She has been in the business for one year. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her money and improve her business. She hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future.

Susan has requested 40,000 KES to buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: María Celia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive en una comunidad en Cuenca, este  lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Doña María tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 5 de sus hijos viven independientes ya que son casados, sus cuatro hijos solteros se encuentran de 16, 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, uno de sus hijos estudia en el colegio y trabaja, sus tres últimos hijos se encuentran estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción ya que es albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora María se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y verduras, las cuales son para la venta y es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría y vende gallinas, cuyes y cerdos, esta actividad le permite pasar en casa y cuidar de su familia.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y en alimento para animales.

 Su meta es seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada cooperative bank.  She lives in a community in Cuenca, an area with a cold climate.  Her people dedicate themselves to raising animals and farming, and many work in the city doing various activities.  Her people maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

María is 51 years old, married, and, in this union, bore 9 children.  Five of her children live independently, since they are now married.  Her four single children are ages 16, 13, 11 and 8.  One of her children is in school and works, and her three youngest children are students in the city’s little school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  The house in which they live is their own property.

María dedicates herself to the farming of vegetables, which she both sells and uses for her own family’s consumption.  She also raises and sells chickens, guinea pigs and hogs.  This activity allows her to stay at home and tend to her family.

She finds herself in her third loan with the cooperative bank, and plans to invest it in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, hogs, and feed for the animals.

Her goal is to continue growing her business of raising animals.

loans.use: buy chickens, guinea pigs, hogs, and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Александр имеет 2 торговые точки, которые расположены одна на рынке, а вторая – в магазине «Лавинс». Александр торгует одеждой и аксессуарами. Дополнительные средства понадобились для закупки зимних шапок, шарфов, а так же ремней.
texts.en: Alexander operates 2 retail spots, one of which is located at a market and the other within the Lovins store. Alexander sells clothing and accessories. He presently needs additional funds to stock up on winter hats and scarves, as well as belts.

loans.use: to buy belts and winter hats and scarves

loans.name: Elisa Del Carmen

texts.en:
Five years ago, Elisa started her gifts and stationery business in her house. She is a single woman and is very enthusiastic and dynamic. She wanted to be self sufficient when she set up her business with her mother’s support. She is in charge of her business and she always supplies her business with merchandise that her clients need and prefer.

On this occasion, Elisa is requesting a loan of $925 USD to buy merchandise and prepare for the upcoming Christmas season (because this is one of the best seasons of the year for her sales). The term to pay back is 6-12 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Hace cinco años que Elisa inició su negocio de regalos y papelería en su casa, ella es una mujer soltera muy dinámica y entusiasta que pensó en ser autosuficiente al establecer su negocio con la ayuda de su madre. Ella es la que se encarga del negocio y esta al pendiente de surtir la mercancía que demandan sus clientes para poder contar con su preferencia.

En esta ocasión, Elisa esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de $ 925 USD para comprar mercancías y estar preparada para la próxima temporada navideña, ya que es una de las mejores épocas del año en que se ven incrementadas sus ventas. El plazo solicitado para pagar el crédito es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Khidir

texts.en: Khidir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli. Khidir, with his family, re-settled in Sumgayit city. He is 47 years old and is married with two children. Khidir started his business of selling men's clothing four years ago. He is applying for a loan to expand his business and increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila was born in Russia and later moved with her family to Ukraine. She entered college in Berdyansk and obtained a degree in elementary education. She also gained a good understanding of people’s psychology which has helped her launch her own business and attract many customers. Currently, Ludmila is a successful entrepreneur selling clothing items in one of the local markets in Berdyansk. She usually purchases inventory in bulk from Russia to resell in Ukraine. She gives preference to Russian wholesalers because their purchasing prices are relatively low, and their inventory is characterized by exceptional quality.

Ludmila learned about “Nadiya Ukraine” from her friends who have been working with our organization for many years. Her business has benefited considerably from micro-lending services since 2003 when she received her first loan.

Ludmila is married with a 20-year-old daughter and a grown son. She has invested her life in her family. Her personal example is the best proof that hard-work and integrity can enable one to be successful in business. Presently, Ludmila has over $4,000 in inventory. She re-stocks her clothing twice a month. Her monthly gross income amounts to $6,000, and her net profit is about $1,200. She has requested a loan of $1,200 to re-supply her inventory and increase her working capital. Ludmila believes that offering a variety of clothing items will help her retain existing customers and find new ones while providing superior service in a competitive marketplace.

Людмила народилася в Росії, пізніше переїхала до України разом з батьками. Потім вступила до коледжу в м. Бердянськ, закінчила навчання, працювала вчителькою молодших класів. Завдяки отриманому досвіду Людмила навчилася чудово розбиратися в психології людей, що також допомогло їй, коли вона починала власну справу, працювала з першими покупцями. Зараз Людмила – успішний підприємець, вона торгує одягом на одному з місцевих ринків м. Бердянськ. Зазвичай вона робить закупки товару в Росії, потім розпродає одяг в Україні. Перевагу надає російським оптовикам, тому що їхні ціни помірно низькі, а товар – відмінної якості. Людмила дізналася про „Надію України” в 2003 році від друзів, які співпрацюють з нашою організацією на протязі певного часу. Завдяки кредитним послугам її бізнес розвивався та досяг успіху. Людмила одружена, в неї є 20-річна дочка та дорослий син. Вона усе своє життя присвятила рідним. Особистий приклад Людмили є найкращим доказом того, що завдяки наполегливій праці та порядності можна досягти успіху в роботі. Зараз в Людмили в товар вкладено трохи більше 4000 доларів. Вона робить закупки двічі в місяць. Щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 6000 доларів, чистий прибуток - приблизно 1200 доларів. Людмила просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент товарів та збільшити власний робочий капітал. Вона вважає, що широкий вибір одягу допоможе їй зберегти існуючих клієнтів та привабити нових, забезпечивши чудове обслуговування в середовищі з високою конкуренцією.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: A businesswoman of distinguished character, Edith speaks highly of Lift Above Poverty Organization. She says she was rescued by LAPO when there was no way forward for her and her family.  Edith sells provisions and drinks to her community. She hopes to receive a loan of $400 that will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Aged 47, Mrs Akou A. is married and the mother of eight children. In addition to her own children, she is responsible for four others. Her husband, who has no steady employment, has five wives and about 20 children. He is totally irresponsible and shows almost no concern for the welfare of his children. As a consequence, Mrs. A. lives in extreme poverty and many of her children do not attend school. In order to survive, she generates income from growing cassava. The tuberous roots of cassava are turned into tapioca that she sells at the market. The quality of her product has given her today a large clientele, but she can no longer meet their demand because she does not have enough cassava. To address this situation, she would like to buy some cassava fields to use in her production. She is therefore requesting a business loan of $700 to buy cassava and produce and sell tapioca. This will bring change to her day-to-day life.

Agée de 47 ans, Madame A. Akou est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a à sa charge quatre (4) autres. Son mari qui n’a aucun emploi fixe a cinq femmes avec une vingtaine d’enfants. Il est totalement irresponsable et ne se soucie guère du bien-être des enfants. La conséquence est que Madame A. Akou vit dans une extrême pauvreté et nombre de ses enfants ne vont pas à l’école. Pour survivre, elle a comme activité génératrice de revenu la culture du champ de manioc. Les tubercules de manioc sont transformés en faine (gari) qu’elle vend sur le marché. La qualité de son produit fait qu’elle a à ce jour une clientèle abondante qu’elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire car elle n’a pas suffisamment de manioc. Pour améliorer cette situation, elle désire désormais acheter des champs de manioc pour sa production. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat de manioc, la fabrication et la vente du gari. Cela apportera un changement dans sa vie de tous les jours.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a cassava field for the production of tapioca

loans.name: Lilia Rubila

texts.es:
Ms. Lilia is a woman with a great drive to better herself, and this positive outlook on life has led her to make progress little by little. For the past year she has been continuously devoted to agricultural activities. In spite of having suffered a total loss when the crude winter hit her sown fields and ruined all her crops, she still maintains her hopes and efforts on sowing, in order to assure the well-being of her three children, the reason of her constant efforts.

In these times of sowing, part of her agricultural activities are concentrated on animal farming; with time, this activity has become an increasing financial support vis-a-vis the crises she has gone through.

She exerts herself daily so that all of her children have access to an adequate education and grow up to become good men; and, above all, to ensure a good health coverage for them; two of her children underwent surgery recently, and she was forced to part with some of her belongings in order to cover treatment costs.

She wishes to restore the well-being of her family, investing in animal farming, for which she is requesting a $200 loan. She kindly thanks your solidary attitude.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Lilia es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y esta actitud favorable en su vida la ha conducido a seguir adelante y a progresar poco a poco. Es así que desde hace un año su dedicación es continua en las actividades agrícolas; a pesar de haber sufrido un fracaso total cuando el crudo invierno azotó sus campos de cultivo y malogró toda su cosecha, aún sigue con la esperanza y empeño de seguir sembrando para procurarles bienestar a sus tres hijos, que son la razón de sus esfuerzos constantes.

Está en época de siembra, parte de sus actividades agrícolas están dirigidas a la crianza de animales; este trabajo se ha acentuado con el correr de los años, como soporte económico ante las crisis que ha sufrido.

La importante razón por las que se esfuerza diariamente es para que cada uno de sus hijos pueda acceder a una adecuada educación y en el futuro convertirse en hombres de bien, y sobre todo para que gocen de buena salud ya que hace poco dos de sus hijos fueron operados, razón por la que tuvo que despojarse de algunos bienes a fin de solventar los gastos de sus respectivos tratamientos.

Ahora quiere recuperar el bienestar de su familia, invirtiendo en la crianza de animales, para lo cual solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares y agradece muy gentilmente su actitud solidaria.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals to breed and sell.

loans.name: Eva Anita

texts.es:
The jungle's tradition and art that Eva inherited from her parents is currently her main economic activity. She always showed great skills for the design and confection of flashy and delicate objects. Each one of the objects she makes is impregnated with the traditional charachter of the Peruvian jungle. However, above all, they are branded by Eva's effort to have a better future. This activity has allowed her to integrally contribute to the satisfaction of her homes' needs.

However, her ever restless entrepreneur's heart has motivated her to acquire a kiosk where she can sell candies and beverages for tourists in order to start building her little home where she can comfortably live next to her family. In order to make these dreams come true she needs this sum of money. She requests your help to make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La tradición y arte D. la selva que heredó Eva D. sus padres, son ahora su principal actividad económica, y es que ella siempre mostró gran habilidad para la elaboración y confección D. vistosos y delicados objetos, cada uno D. los objetos que elabora llevan impregnados por sí mismos el carácter tradicional D. la selva peruana y sobretodo llevan marcados el esfuerzo D. Eva por un futuro mejor. Esta actividad le ha permitido contribuir íntegramente, en la satisfacción plena D. las necesidades D. su hogar, pero su espíritu emprendedor que no descansa jamás, la ha motivado a adquirir un kiosco en donD. pueda vender dulces y bebidas para los turistas que llegan a su localidad y esto para empezar la construcción D. su casita en la cual morar cómodamente junto a su familia. Para concretar sus sueños requiere D. una suma D. dinero y solicita D. vuestra ayuda para concretar sus sueños.

loans.use: Rent a kiosk to offer candies and beverages for tourists

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona became a widow 5 years ago, being in charge of her four daughters who are between 8 and 23 years of age. Back then, the eldest was 18 and was in high school, so the expenses for her daughters were high. For that reason, Ramona started selling second-hand clothes in her neighborhood, because there wasn't any such business in her area. She started selling her daughters' clothes, and then she bought clothes from other places to offer more variety. Little by little, and through lots of dedication, Ramona acquired a clientele and started overcoming her financial problems.

However, right now Ramona does not have enough merchandise for the winter season, and so she is requesting a loan for US$ 925, which she is determined to pay back in 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy large lots of clothing to have more variety for her customers. With your help, Ramona will be able to move her business forward and offer her daughters a better future based on education.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ramona enviudó hace 5 años, quedándose a cargo de sus cuatro hijas que van desde los 8 hasta los 23 años. En ese entonces la mayor tenía 18 y estaba estudiando la preparatoria y los gastos de sus hijas eran muchos. Por lo tanto decidió comenzar a vender ropa de3 segunda en su colonia puesto que en ella no hay un local semejante. Comenzó por vender ropa de sus hijas, y después compró ropa de otros lados para ofrecerles más variedad. Poco a poco y con mucha dedicación Ramona comenzó a adquirir clientes y así salir de los problemas económicos.

Sin embargo actualmente Ramona no tiene suficiente mercancía para invierno, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar pacas de ropa para poder tener más variedad para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ramona podrá sacar adelante su negocio además de poder brindarles a sus hijas un mejor futuro a base de estudios.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich S., age 48, is a widow and lives with her grandmother and three nephews in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. Her son is pictured as she was not available at the time. She works selling gasoline, rice, and fertilizer, making on average around $10 each day of income. She has one son. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fertilizer and gasoline to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer and gasoline to expand her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Being a young member of the 15th branch, Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 33 years old, is very good at doing business. Realizing that TYM Fund policy was very suitable for her family conditions, from the beginning, she borrowed 60 USD to breed pigs. By using husks wasted from the husking machine as pig mash, her breeding plan became more effective and expanded. Currently, she has 18 pigs (about 1000 kg) ready to be released with an intended profit of 2000 USD. Besides, she is investing in making ice-cream machines, and general store, etc. Therefore, her family income is very stable. Her wish is to borrow more money to expand her breeding plan and other businesses, increasing family income. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy pig mash and unhusked rice. Mrs T. is living with her husband and 2 children in Yen Lac, Vinh Phuc.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là một trong những thành viên trẻ của chi nhánh 15 nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị T., 33 tuổi, là người làm kinh tế giỏi. Nhận thức được lợi ích của Quỹ Tình thương là rất phù hợp với điều kiện gia đình nên ngay từ những ngày đầu chị T. đã vay 60USD đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Tận dụng cám bã từ việc làm máy xay xát, nấu rượu làm thức ăn chăn nuôi nên dự án chăn nuôi lợn ngày càng mang lại hiệu quả và được đầu tư lớn hơn. Hiện tại chị có 18 con lợn thịt (khoảng hơn 1 tấn) sắp cho xuất chuồng dự tính thu khoảng 2000USD. Ngoài ra chị còn đầu tư vào mở cửa hàng làm máy kem, bán hàng ... nên thu nhập của gia đình rất tốt và ổn định. Mong muốn của chị T. là được vay những mức vốn lớn hơn để mở rộng dự án chăn nuôi - kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua thức ăn gia súc vào gạo về xay xát. Chị T. hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Yên Lạc, Vĩnh Phúc.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs and unhusked rice

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is 26 years old and has a business selling Chinese medicines. She and her husband sell their natural medicines in the streets of the city. Thanks to her consistency and the increasing demand, her business has been growing. However, she needs more money to invest so that she can offer her clients a greater variety, otherwise she can't increase her income.

Jessica de 26 años de edad se dedica a la comercialización de medicinas chinas por las calles de su ciudad, en compañía de su querido esposo. Gracias a su constancia y a la necesidad que ha surgido en su sociedad están obteniendo muy buenos resultados; sin embargo muchas veces la falta de inversión de capital para ofertar mayor variedad de medicinas naturales chinas disminuye sus ganancias, precisamente a esta necesidad atiende el día de hoy la solicitud de un préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS SELLING NATURAL CHINESE MEDICINES, INCREASING THE VARIETY FOR HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Señorita Elizabeth C. Rojas is a member of the communal bank called 'Ayaymaman'. She lives in San Martin in the district of Moyabamba. She sells groceries such as bread, snacks, refreshments, etc. Her store is located in her house where the neighbors go to buy their groceries on a daily basis.

She studied accounting and with her mother's guidance she decided to get involved in the business world so that she can make her own money.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase basic food supply such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, bread, canned food, detergent, toilet paper among other things so that she can fulfill her clients' orders.

She's 24 years old and single. This business is to help her mom with the bills. She would eventually like to open up a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elizabeth C. Rojas,es una socia del Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, en su bodega ubicada en su propia casa A.v. Graú Nº 535 , donde acuden diariamente a comprar los vecinos del barrio. Estudió contabilidad y con la orientación de su mamá decide ingresar al mundo del negocio que es otra fuente para su ingreso económico. Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 que pagará en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, panes , detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros, para así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Tiene 24 años es soltera pero su decisión hacia el negocio fue para ayudar a su mamá en lo económico, su meta en el futuro es tener un restaurante

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Dativa G.. She is married, and has six children between the ages of 3 and 13. In 1999, Dativa opened her liquor store. Dativa has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and has applied for this loan in order to purchase additional stocks of beer and soda in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

This client is a perfect example of why microfinance works and why a large majority of clients repay their loans. A lot of people who hear about microfinance (or kiva.org) for the first time ask anxiously, “but how do you make sure people pay the loan back? Won’t they just take the money?” The implication is that the clientele who access microfinance (usually the ‘poor’) are less trustworthy, efficient or educated than ‘ordinary’ people. Whether or not this is true is irrelevant for a number of reasons. Firstly, most microfinance lenders have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk. More important than any of these deterrents, however, is an incentive: the incentive clients have to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another…The primary incentive is to have on-going access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Jardin Atiteca Group

texts.en:
The Jardin Atiteca community from Cerro de Oro is a very small community next to the smallest hump of a volcano in Lake Atitlan. The people enjoy living in such a community where everyone knows everyone. The festive seasons of Christmas and the town fair bring everyone together and give a boost in sales.

Their microenterprise consists of weaving the traditional güipil, the top of the indigenous Mayan outfit, either as a family or with employees (up to 8). To do so, they use the telar de cintura, a weaving method by which one person can weave a güipil in about one day. They then sell this piece for about 150 quetzales (20 USD) to buyers, whether intermediaries, personal contacts or shoppers in the nearby villages of Santiago de Atitlan and San Lucas. Intermediaries take the clothing and sell it to women all around the lake, including women in Panajachel, Solola and Patzun.

There was consensus among the group that their businesses were doing well, since they sell a type of clothing that is not produced very much within Santiago and San Lucas. This low level of competition allows them to sell almost as fast as they produce. So the only thing keeping them from selling more is their limited capital to invest. This is why they are loyal as a group to microlenders and have rarely missed or paid late.

According to the women, the credit has helped their business grow. They can now buy wholesale thread, cloth and dyes. The credit not only helps them buy their materials at a cheaper price, but also helps them be able to produce more items at once. Then, with their savings, they can repay the loans bit by bit.

The clients emphasized that these extra sales allow their business to grow, but most importantly, allow for an increase in income which serves to pay for their children’s educational needs, medicine, and clothing. In addition, this extra money allows them to continue to expand their business, while living a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Purchase thread for weaving güipiles

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of N. A. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, where she has lived for the last 17 years. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. She is a housewife and enjoys taking care of her children. Her husband has a business making plastic bottles. Her eldest son helps her husband with the work. The other children are enrolled in a local school in a neighboring area. She is applying for a loan to buy more material (plastic) for her husband’s business.

Kosar baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Tasneem baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools (beams, hammer, etc) for her husband. Salamat baji wants a loan to buy more fruit for her fruit business. Amna baji wants a loan to buy more materials for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Laal

texts.en:
This is a married man, Laal A.; he is 24 and the father of two children, in the Shewa district. There are 6 members including his parents in his family. His father is about 60 and retired, and his older son is 6 years old and studying in his first year in a public school in his village.

When Laal A. got married he was about 14, and he was studying in the 8th grade. His father was working as a headmaster in a public school, but after two years his father has retired and became so weak. So Laal A. left his studying and started a business with 35,000 Afghanis of his own capital. 

First he made a small retail shop in his village. For a few months he encountered a lot of financial difficulties because he didn't have enough goods in his shop, so he couldn't find costumers. But after a short time he started farming beside his shop, and he was able to solve the problems little bit. 

Laal A. has kept this business for 6 years, but last month he changed his business and made a mobile phone shop instead of retail shop. Because he saved some money during the last 6 years of shopkeeping, he made some new shelves in his shop and has spent $240 in its decoration. Just $200 remained of the capital in his hands, so he purchased some mobile phones with that. But he wants to buy more mobiles and phone cards to increase his costumers, so he has requested a loan. 

Laal A. dreams someday that he'll stand on his own feet and restart his remaining education once again. Also, he shows his appreciation to the lenders in advance.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and cards for his shop

loans.name: Saltan Mohammad

texts.en:
Saltan Mohammad is 30 years old. He lives in a household of 13 members. He has a catering shop that he has been involved in for more than 11 years. He has 4 workers and one of his brothers is also involved with Mohammad in the business. During the war, he was out of the country for about 5 years but when he came back to Afghanistan he started his business again.

Now he needs to expand his business. He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 18 months to complete his stock and enlarge his shop. He has some good numbers of clients. They are very happy with him.

Saltan wants his business to become more popular. He wishes to have anther shop in the next few years and become very strong in his business. It is one of his best wishes and he hopes to do it. He would like to thank lenders that help people through this process.

loans.use: To complete his stock and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Andoung Samrith Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer, but she cannot cultivate the rice because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow the field. In order to cultivate rice, Mrs. Heng S. decided to ask for a loan, and she will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to support her crop.

Her husband, Mr. Ut Sochon, helps his wife on the plantation. Mrs. Heng S. has four children, one of whom is a car driver while the other two attend the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of four years. Her husband and daughter are shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the field, and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Eun

texts.en: Eun T., 50, is married and has a business selling groceries and some vegetables from her house to earn a living, and is able to make US$7 in revenue each day. Her husband is a fisherman and makes US$3 a day. This couple also gets support from two of their children who work at Phnom Penh as garment factory workers. She would like to take out a loan of US$500 to add to her grocery inventory to attract more customers.

loans.use: To add to her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Pek

texts.en:
Pek K., 31, is married and lives with two young children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband are vegetable vendors in the market, earning around $6 a day.

Pek K. would like to take out a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to transport their crops to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Асроилова Наталья проживает в районе Шахринау. Домохозяйка. Возраст 38 лет.Имеет пятерых детей. Имеет небольшое хозяйство . Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить комбикорм для своих животных. Кредит погашать планирует в течение12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Natalya A. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is a housewife, she is 38 years old and has five children. She has a small business and wants to get a loan to buy fodder for her cattle. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Luciola Doris

texts.es:
LUCIOLA DORIAS D. AGUILA D. Y., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras ubicado en la Av. 09 D. Octubre N° 228 – Asentamiento Humano, 09 D. octubre sector Jorge Chávez, D. Distrito D. Callería, tiene 50 años D. edad, 03 hijos, su esposo es chofer, socio D. Manuela Ramos, 08 años, que ella es costurera.

El primer préstamo que recibimos fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas D. algodón para confeccionar brasieres, ropas interiores, compró hilos, elásticos, blondas, adornos, cintas, pasacintas,, trabajaba muy duro ya que tenía problemas económicos, su esposo no trabajaba, poco a poco surgía la confección.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,700.00 comprara 35 mts D. tela, hilos 02 docenas, 20 docenas D. botón, ahora cose por contratos, a diferentes instituciones.

Está muy agradecida D. Manuela Ramos por comprenderla, brindarle el apoyo que más ha necesitado, en el momento preciso gracias, muchas gracias Manuela Ramos por entenderla y confiar en ella.
texts.en:
LUCIOLA DORIAS D. AGUILA D. Y. belongs to “Las Guerreras" Communal Bank located at 9 D. Octubre Avenue N° 228 – Humano Settlement, 9 D. Octubre Sector Jorge Chávez, of the Callería district. She is 50 years old, has three children, and her husband is a driver. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 8 years and she is a dressmaker. With the first loan that she received of S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought cotton fabric to make brassieres and underwear. She bought thread, elastic, lace, adornments and tape and she worked very hard because she already had economic problems as her husband did not work. Little by little her production grew. With this loan of S/.1,700.00 she will buy 35 meters of fabric, 2 dozen spools of thread, and 20 dozen buttons. She sews for different institutions by contract. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for understanding her and providing her with the support that she has needed at the precise moment. Many thanks to Manuela Ramos for understanding her and trusting in her.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies to make clothing that she sews on contract for different institutions.

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von T. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Talok Cheoung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sdeung Chorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. Mrs. Von T. has a child who makes doors, windows, beds and so on. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Von T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more lumber for her child's business. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more lumber for her child's business

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en: Hatem J. is 46 years old and married with three children. Hatem has been working as a contractor for ten years. His business is the only source of income for the family. Hatem works very hard in order to bring in enough income. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase more construction equipment. He says, "Thanks," to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: purchase more construction equipment

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe E. is fifty-five years old and the mother of two. She resides in a mountain part of their village, Calacja, Hamtic, Antique, on the island of Panay. Her husband is a laborer. She buys and resells vegetables to support the needs of the family. Two years ago, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to start a business. She applied for this loan to buy assorted foods in order to supply her variety store. Ma. Fe's income was used to finance the education of her child who is in elementary school. With her new venture, she has helped her neighbors.  She hopes that in the future, she can expand her business, build a better house and be able send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel D. is a fifty-eight-year-old married man and the father of seven children, four sons and three daughters. Some are in senior high while others are in junior high schools. His wife trades in smoked fish to make some income to support him financially. He lives with his wife and children in a family house in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming and trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Emmanuel deals in soap production. He manufactures locally and distributes to retailers. He produces the soap from raw materials such as soda ash, detol and palm oil. He also sells in a store at the local market. He procures the raw material from nearby wholesale dealers. Emmanuel has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure the chemicals in bulk. He is hoping to give his children the best possible education.

loans.use: Materials for soap production

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: "I was just a laborer before, and didn’t own the land that I tilled. God is really great because now, I already have my own farm which I use to feed and clothe my family," says Emelyn D., 43 years old and the mother of two children. “We get our daily budget from our harvest. We reserve rice for our consumption and the rest is sold to rice traders." Emelyn is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide and seed. The loan will really help her improve her yield and provide better the needs of her children. CEVI gives their clients not just credit assistance. It also give training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicide and seed

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen L. lives in the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 33 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store where she sells products people use every day, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Glen has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Glen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that could help her improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. Glen has successfully repaid previous loans, which she used to expand her product offering. She is requesting this new loan, her sixth, to buy additional items to sell. She plans to use the income made possible by this loan to pay her children's tuition. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gunjidmaa

texts.en:
Gunjidmaa J. is fifty-one years old and the mother of two. Her husband passed away a few years ago and she currently lives with her daughter in a "ger", which is a traditional tent, on land that her sibling owns. Her eldest son is married and lives with his wife next to her mother's home. Her daughter is a university student.

Gunjidmaa has a small retail business in women's and men's stockings. She rents a small stall at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells a variety of socks. She purchases most of the socks that she sells from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar.
