She says that her daughter will be starting at the university in the fall of 2009. She intends to increase her inventory and expand her business in order to earn her daughter's tuition (about $485) from this summer's profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more socks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more socks to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Saibou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Saibou Touré a 37 ans et vit avec son enfant et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire dans le quartier Niebala de la ville de la préfecture de  Bougouni (région de Sikasso).
N’ayant pas fait l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus, mais sans succès telles  l’achat et la vente des motos à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Quelques années après Monsieur Saibou Touré revient auprès de son oncle  qui est un commerçant chevronné à Bougouni pour apprendre l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, il maîtrise bien son activité et ouvre une boutique de pièces détachées, de lubrifiants etc qui est très fréquentée.
Afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle Saibou Touré décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir bien remboursé son premier prêt.
Il compte acheter des pièces détachées à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Il effectue sa vente à Bougouni dans sa boutique  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de propriétaires de véhicules, de réparateurs et de mécaniciens.
Monsieur Saibou Touré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 58 750 FCFA qu’il  envisage utiliser pour construire une maison, agrandir son entreprise et  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Saibou Touré, age 37, lives with his child and wife in a nuclear family in the Niebala district of the city in Bougouni prefecture (Sikasso region). Not having had modern schooling, he started earning an income when very young, although without success, such as in the sale of motorbikes in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). A few years later, he returned to learn from his uncle, who is a seasoned merchant in Bougouni, how to buy and sell spare parts. With five years of experience, Saibou has a good command of his business and opened a shop for spare parts, lubricants, etc. His shop is busy. To satisfy his customers better, Saibou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his second individual loan, after having repaid his first one. He intends to buy some spare parts in Bamako from wholesalers. He makes his sales in Bougouni in his shop, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of vehicle owners, repairmen, and mechanics. He plans to realize a monthly profit of 58,750 francs CFA that he envisions using to build a house, to expand his enterprise, and to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale is 31 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuff. Bolale is a LAPO client. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Fourteen years ago, Dora moved from Mexico to Queens to start a new life in the United States. Wanting to build her financial independence, she started a business selling perfume, jewelry and cosmetics. Now, she is able to put part of the income she earns towards her savings, therefore building her assets.

Dora heard about the availability of microloans from a friend who had borrowed from ACCION USA. Since then, she has taken out a few loans with ACCION USA. She says she feels more secure knowing that microloans are an option available to her – a much more affordable one than the credit cards she once used. She will use this loan to invest in new products for her beauty supply business, buying special brands requested by her customers. 

Since she has been able to get loans from ACCION USA, she’s sold more products, and she dreams of expanding her business to other states. She says that if she couldn’t get a loan, she would keep on struggling to maintain her business, but the extra capital gives her some ease and flexibility managing the business, and is helping her to expand.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Dora from  United States

loans.use: To invest in new products for her beauty supply business

loans.name: Fagui

texts.fr: fagui H. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1994.elle est vendeuse de poissons dans le quartier de camberene.elle capitalise dix ans d'expérience dans cette activité.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond et accroitre ses bénéfices car elle contribue beaucoup a l'amélioration du cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fagui H. has been a recipient parent since 1994. She is a fish seller in the Camberene district and capitalizes on ten years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her capital and to grow her profits because she contributes a lot to her family’s living standard.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Mpumude Cell Buwule Marjoria Group

texts.en:
Buwule M. is the chairperson of her loan group. She is a 45-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for two dependents who go to school. 

M. operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for over five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase beauty salon items, such as chemicals, hair weaving items, hair foods, hair treatments, etc. She wants to attract customers from different corners to come and support her business because she has good skills in the salon business. Her future hope is to educate her children and be able to care for her family well.

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon items such as chemicals, hair weaving, hair foods, hair treatments, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza R. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Esperanza is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Esperanza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Esperanza has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP.

In 2009, Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delia Dalila

texts.es:
La señora DELIA DALILA V. F., tiene 43 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS. La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3ero de Secundaria. Está casada  y tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran en el colegio.
DELIA se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos de plástico y vidrio que los lleva a vender a la sierra liberteña como: Otuzco, Huamachuco y pueblos aledaños a Trujillo como Viru, Chao, etc.
Vende vasos, jarras, tapers, tinas en compañía de su esposo quien la acompaña y ayuda a vender cuando viaja.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de tinas y tapers de plástico.
Este crédito de 2,200 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de más artículos de vidrio y plástico.
La empresaria sueña aumentar para así poder cubrir los gastos de su familia e hijas,
texts.en:
Mrs. Delia Dalila V. F. is 43-years-old and lives in the district of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the "Mujeres Valerosas" (Brave Women) Communal Bank. The entrepreneur completed her education through the 3rd year of secondary school. She is married and has three children whom are economically dependent on her because they are in school.

Delia buys and sells plastic and glass goods which she brings to sell at places in La Sierra Liberteña such as Otuzco, Huamachuco, and towns surrounding Trujillo like Viru, Chao, etc. She sells glasses, jars, tupperware, and tubs along with her husband who accompanies her and helps with sales when she travels.

Her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles was invested to buy plastic tubs and tupperware. She will use this new loan of 2,200 Peruvian soles to buy more glass and plastic goods. She dreams of growing her business so she she will be able to cover the expenses of her family and children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more glass and plastic goods

loans.name: Oyoniyi

texts.en: Oyoniyi is 35 years old and married, and he has 2 children. He produces and sells rice. He has been in this business for 6 years. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more supplies for his rice business. He hopes to increase his production in order to meet the demands of his customers. He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for the production of rice

loans.name: Sonia Elena

texts.es: La señora Sonia Elena es madre soltera y vive con su hijo Joel Alberto, el labora para un restaurante desde hace 2 años como mesero, la señora Sonia también labora en el mismo restaurante como ayudante de cocina desde hace 3 años. Ellos son una familia que se apoya mutuamente para salir adelante, por lo tanto establecieron un negocio propio desde hace 1 año, el cual es una tiendita de abarrotes. Están solicitando este crédito para realizar la construcción de un cuarto en la parte trasera de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sonia Elena is a single mother who lives with her son Joel Alberto. For the past two years he has worked as a waiter at the same restaurant where she has worked as a kitchen assistant for the past three years. They are a mutually supportive family who hope to get ahead and thus, established their own small grocery store one year ago. They are requesting a loan for the construction of a room at the rear of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a room

loans.name: Melvin Adonai

texts.es: Melvin Adonai C. G. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años respectivamente. Melvin posee  una tienda y un molino el cual es la única entrada económica que posee para solventar los gastos de su familia. Melvin solícita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar maíz, golosinas, jugos, pan y muchos otros productos más los cuales contribuirán a que las ventas de su tienda suban, lo cual es muy beneficioso para el y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Melvin Adonai C. G., 30, lives with his wife and two children, 7- and 4-years-old, respectively, in Ahuachapán department. He has a store and a mill which are the only sources of income for the family. Melvin requests financing to buy corn, sweets, juices, bread and many other products, which will contribute to his store's increased sales earnings and thus benefit himself and his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their child. Nisrine has been working in agriculture since 1998. She plants olives and pomegranates. Nisrine works hard to produce high-quality produce. Her clients are people from her region. Her production has steadily grown since she began her business. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to pay for help with harvesting her crops, which will enable her to market more of her produce in a shorter amount of time. This is the first time that Nisrine has requested a loan.

loans.use: To pay for help with harvesting crops

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, muy alegremente la señora Carla G. se dedica a elaborar alimentos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes siendo este el negocio que le genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Antes de trabajar en la elaboración de los alimentos, ella se dedicaba solamente como ama de casa pero ahora combina las dos actividades ya que su meta es beneficiar a su hijo en edad escolar y por ende debe trabajar para alcanzar esto.

El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de la materia prima como los plátanos, la carne, el arroz, los frijoles, el queso, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Carla G. happily prepares food for her clients in the department of Masaya. This food preparation business generates enough income for her to support her family.

Prior to working in the food preparation industry she was merely a housewife, but now she can combine both of those activities since her goal is to provide for her school-age child. Therefore, she is working towards this end.

She is requesting this loan to buy raw ingredients such as plantains, meat, rice, beans, cheese, among others. She hopes this loan will be approved for the benefit of her son and family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make prepared foods

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es:
Bolívar Hernández A., tiene la edad de 56 años, es casado, y tiene 6 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 36,34,26,20,17 y 10 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para Compra de inventario para el negocio de abarrotes.El desea darle el mantenimiento adecuado para que sus ventas aumenten y por ende aumentar sus ingresos económicos, su negocio es un minisuper que lo creó hace tres años. 
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Bolívar Hernández A. is 56 years old and married with 6 children, who are his greatest priority. His sons are 36, 34, 26, 20, 17, and 10 years old respectively. He wants this loan to buy inventory for his general store. He wants his business to be sufficiently stocked to allow his sales to increase and therefore increase his income. He started his mini-supermarket business three years ago. This is the first loan he will receive from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy to receive this opportunity from them. His wish for the future is to be able to offer his children and his wife a better quality of life and greater economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Comfort has received junior high education.

Comfort cooks banku and okro (okra) stew, and also sells fried eggs and bread at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Comfort will use the loan to buy more maize for the preparation of banku and also buy raw eggs to fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest in her business.

To prepare her banku, Comfort first makes sure she gets her corn dough. She uses maize that has been milled and left to prove (rise). Usually, after milling it, it is not used immediately but left until the following day before it can be used. She then makes  cassava dough.

Comfort then makes a mixture with the cassava and corn doughs in a porridge form and stirs it on a fairly high heat for some time to get a firm but fine texture, a texture firm enough to be eaten.

The dish accompanying her banku can either be any kind of soup or sauce to your taste, such as palm-nut soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, okra soup or hot pepper sauce, or fish of any kind.

Comfort wasn't cooking at the time the photo was taken. She was therefore asked to demonstrate how banku is prepared.

loans.use: To buy more maize for the preparation of banku and raw eggs to fry

loans.name: Fatai

texts.en: Fatai is 50 years old and married with six children. His children are excelling in their jobs and education.  His wife sells snacks to support their home. He makes a living selling electronics and CDs (compact discs). He hopes to own an electronics company in the future. He is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Nematkul

texts.ru: Одинаев Нематкул проживает а районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Он намерен купить дойную корову и обеспечить свою семью молоком и кисло- молочной продукцией.
texts.en:
Nematkul O. lives in the Yavan district. He is 53 years old, married and has 6 children. He is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry at the same time. Nematkul raises and sells livestock. His wife helps him with it. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. Nematkul intends to buy a dairy cow and provide his family with milk and dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg is a 35 years old and lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her son live together in a small house which they own. Presently, she operates a secondhand handbag trading business at Narantuul, the largest and most crowded market. She sells a range of Korean secondhand handbags at her counter. Erdenechimeg has been operating this business since 2002, and has steadily expanded her business. Over the years, she has worked very hard and has gained a great deal of business experience. Furthermore, Erdenechimeg has been planning to grow her business and to open her own store in the future and wants to increase her working capital. Erdenechimeg has many plans for the future and says, “ I would like to create my own store.”  She is requesting a 1,600,000 tugrug loan to expand her production line and purchase a variety of secondhand handbags for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of secondhand handbags.

loans.name: Gérarde

texts.fr: Z. Gérarde est née le 03 Octobre 1979 et est mariée à ADIDO Jean, un informaticien. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Gérarde vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Tchinvié, dans le deuxième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Gérarde habite avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Gérarde  n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire, mais a appris la couture. Il y a quatre ans que Gérarde exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits cosmétiques, de façon ambulante. Gérarde achète ses produits au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, mais également à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gérarde a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'accrître son chiffre d'affaire, Gérarde sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Gérarde Z. was born 3 October 1979 and is married to Jean ADIDO, a computer specialist. The couple has two children, both attending school. Gérarde has been living for the past ten years in the Tchinvié area of the 2nd borough of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She lives with her children and her husband, with whom she shares responsibility for family expenses. Gérarde has only attended school at the primary level, but has learned to be a seamstress. For the past four years she has sold various beauty products as an itinerant vendor. She sells her products at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, but also in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Gérarde has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. Wishing to strengthen her activity and increase her turnover, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata S. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée  mère de  4 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Matrone de profession, elle commença à faire le commerce quand elle servait dans une commune. Les femmes de cette commune voulant organiser une grande cérémonie festive, on sollicite son concours. Depuis lors elle est dans cette activité de commerce qu’elle mène il y’a maintenant 10 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses habits. 
Dans le dessein de  faire face une commande venant du Niger où ses habits sont beaucoup appréciés, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. 
Après 6 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts  individuels tous  bien remboursés,  elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter, 15 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 140 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de payer des moquettes et un congélateur pour sa fille qui va se marier. 
Son ambition est  de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata S. is 42 years old, married and mother to four children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Bagadadji district of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A matron by profession, she began trading when she was working in a municipality. When the women from this municipality wanted to organise a large festive ceremony, they sought her help. Since then and for the past ten years she has been carrying out her business and she now enjoys a large customer base and a good reputation. The strength of her sales is due to the quality of her clothes. With the aim of coping with an order from Niger, where her clothes are much appreciated, she has turned to Soro Yiriwaso. Having already had six group loans and two individual loans, all of which were repaid on time, she is now on her third individual loan. She is planning to use this to buy 15 pieces of "pagnes wax" (West African highly decorative and colourful fabric). She gets her supplies in Bamako and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base made up exclusively of women. She envisages making a monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA which will allow her to pay for carpets and a freezer for her daughter who is getting married. Her ambition is to buy a house to live in.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Llamocctachi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Llamocctachi  inicia su ciclo 23 con 21 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, abarrotes en general, animales menores, golosinas, agricultura D. verduras y crianza D. animales.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Violeta es la secretaria del Banco Comunal, Violeta es casada, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Violeta tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Violeta se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes, tiene galpones en su casa, y ella misma se encarga D. sembrar alfalfa para la alimentación D. los cuyes. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar. Los sueños D. Violeta son  salir adelante, mejorar su negocio, construir su casa y exportar los cuyes. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles haciendo un total D. 10,950 soles.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Llamocctachi" started its 23rd loan cycle with 21 members. The members have a variety of types of businesses such as: the sale of vegetables, groceries in general, young animals, and sweets, and also the cultivation of vegetables and the raising of livestock. Such is the case of Violeta, who is the secretary of the communal bank. Violeta is married, 26 years old, and has 2 children. Violeta has a store in her house where she sells groceries and general merchandise, which she does every day. In addition, Violeta raises guinea pigs in sheds that she has at her home. She herself is in charge of planting the alfalfa that she feeds to the guinea pigs. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Violeta dreams of getting ahead, improving her business, building her house and exporting her guinea pigs. The members need different amounts of loans, such as 300 Peruvian soles, 600 soles, or 900 soles, making a total of 10,950 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Los Amigos Responsables Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. CLAUDIA MIMI, TIENE 44 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS. LA SRA. CLAUDIA MIMI FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "LOS AMIGOS RESPONSABLES" INTEGRADO POR 9 PERSONAS QUE RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE LA LIBERTAD EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS. ELLOS LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DE SU GRUPO.
ELLA SE DEDICA A LA PREPARACIÓN DE BOUFFETS, QUE LE SOLICITAN SUS AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS PARA DIFERENTES EVENTOS, EN ÉSTE NEGOCIO YA TIENE TRES AÑOS, QUE EMPEZÓ A SOLICITUD DE UNA AMIGA PARA AYUDARLA EN UNA CEREMONIA, ELLA IDENTIFICÓ EL NEGOCIO Y SE ANIMÓ A OFRECER ÉSTE SERVICIO.
CON ÉSTE NEGOCIO ELLA CONSIDERA QUE LO MEJOR QUE HA CONSEGUIDO ES CONOCER GENTE Y TENER MAS AMIGOS, ADEMÁS DE AYUDAR EN LA ECO´NOMÍA DEL HOGAR Y LA EDUCACIÓN DE SUS HIJOS.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE UN BOUFFET POR ENTREGAR.
texts.en:
Claudia Mimi is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Claudia Mimi is part of the group "Los Amigos Responsables" (Responsible Friends) which is made up of 9 people that live in the neighborhood La Libertad in the Comas district. She was chosen as the president of the board of directors for this group. Claudia Mimi is a caterer and caters different events for her friends and acquaintances. She has had this business for three years and started when a friend asked for her help catering a ceremony. In addition to helping with the household income and the education of her children, Claudia Mimi considers the best things about this business is that she has met people and has more friends. She will invest this loan in purchasing catering supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing catering supplies.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid, de 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus 2 hermanos.Trabaja como cajera,  y lo que más desea es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, como es la hermana mayor considera que tiene  la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus padres, en los gastos del hogar. Tiene planeado comprar un motocarro, para dárselo  a su hermano para que trabaje. Durante  todos los meses, separa parte de su sueldo, y junta el dinero para hacer realidad su propósito. Se siente muy contenta  porque tiene la mitad del dinero ahorrado en poco tiempo. Su mayor anhelo, es apoyar a sus hermanos ya que  después quiere sacar su titulo como profesora.Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente.Además Ingrid tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en comprar un  motocarro, para  progresar con su familia.
texts.en:
Ingrid, who is 25 years old, is a very hardworking young woman. She lives at her parents' house with her two siblings. She works as a cashier and what she would like most is to improve her family's quality of life. Since she is the oldest child, she considers it her responsibility to help her parents out with the household expenses. She plans to buy a three-wheeler van to give to her brother so that he can work. Every month she puts aside part of her earnings and is saving up this money to make her dream a reality. She is very happy because she has saved up half of the money needed in a short time. Her biggest wish is to to support her siblings, because afterwards she would like to get her license to be a teacher. This is Ingrid's first loan with MFP and she knows that it will be very beneficial in raising her working capital. For this reason, she is committed to paying her installments in a timely manner. Ingrid plans to invest the requested funds on buying a three-wheeler van in order to help her family progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a three-wheeler van so that her brother can work

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children. Her first-born has completed schooling, while the others still attend school. Janet has been operating a welding shop for the last 21 years, and her husband helps run the business. Their family rents a house with electricity but no piped water. She says that food and electricity are her highest monthly expenses.

Janet is now seeking a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500) to purchase a metal brake, a metal bender, a magnetic clamp, and a metal file. She sells her work product out of her shop, to both neighbors and passersby.

She explains that her business is affected by the seasons, and that she is especially challenged during the months of January through March. She decided to work with Yehu because of its sustainable financial services offered to small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing certain tools (e.g., a metal brake)

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Elvira owns a business selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda  P. is a 64-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  fishing and farming businesses. She lives in Prk Angas, Brgy Casay, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing and farming businesses, Esmeralda  is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 6500.  She is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can  buy fishing gear and another fishing equipment.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Esmeralda  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  'Dungganon' way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear and other materials

loans.name: Mujeres Artesanas Group

texts.es:
Este comité de encuentra trabajando dentro  del tercer ciclo y todas están muy satisfechas con sus trabajos y agradecen por el apoyo  financiero que reciben de la Fundación Paraguaya.
La señora  Rumilda es una de las integrantes quien se dedica a la fabricación y venta de Flores.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora,  y como es de la zona de Caacupé un lugar visitado por muchos turistas por ser la capital espiritual del país. 
Ella aprovechando esa ventaja fabrica flores artesanales de buena  y los vende a la gente que recurre al lugar. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales que ella utiliza para fabricación de las flores artesanales.
texts.en:
This committee is in its third working cycle and they are all very satisfied with their jobs and are thankful for the financial support they receive from the Paraguaya Foundation. Rumilda is one of the committee members, she fabricates and sells flowers. She is a very hard-working woman and since she is from the Caacupé area, a place visited by many tourists for being the spiritual capital of the world, she takes advantage of it by fabricating artificial flowers and selling them to the people who frequent the area. The loan is for the purchase of materials she utilizes to fabricate the artificial flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make artificial flowers such as: plastic, special wires, paint, molds and other things

loans.name: Jaqueline Del Cisne

texts.es:
La Señora Jacqueline del Cisne C. es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive en por el sector de  Fátima en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan la ciudad,  su gastronomía y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

Doña Jacqueline tiene de 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 12 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija este año ingresa a la universidad, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo está en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora para llevar el sustento a su hogar en un taxi, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Jacqueline se dedica junto con su suegra a preparar y entregar comida, actividad que la realiza hace 10 años, los fines de semana son los días que hay más trabajo y el resto de su tiempo se dedica a su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito, fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Su crédito lo va a invertir en repuestos para el taxi.
 
Su meta es  sacar  adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline del Cisne C. is an associate of the Yanuncay communal bank. She lives in the Fátima sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic center, the four rivers that bathe the city, its food, and its friendly people. Jacqueline is 41 years old, is married and has three children, ages 18, 12, and 9. Her oldest daughter is in her first year of university. Her middle son is studying at the local city college. Her youngest son attends school. Her husband is a driver and supports the family by driving a taxi. By working together, they were able to build their house. Jaqueline and her mother in law prepare and deliver food and have been doing so for 10 years. They are busiest on the weekends. The rest of the time [Jaqueline] works in the home and cares for her children. This will be her second loan. Her mother in law had invited her to be a part of this great group so struggling women. She will use the money from this to invest in repairs for the taxi. Her goal is to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Parts and vehicle repair

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en:
Byambatsogt M. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Tosontsengel, a commune of Zavhan province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest three children, ages 12, 9 and 6, all attend a local school and his younger two children stay at home. His wife, Altantuya, operates a clothes-making business in her home where she sews traditional Mongolian-style clothing. 

Byambatsogt, himself, operates  two different kinds of business depending on the season. In the summer months, he operates a vegetable-growing business and in the winter months, he works as a fireman in the school. His wife has been sewing a variety of traditional clothes for three years. She has used her earnings to purchase more fabrics to sew more clothes. And also her earnings have enabled her to buy school supplies for her children. 

Byambatsogt and his wife both are very hardworking persons and they have used their earnings to buy a fenced-in plot of land. He says, "My wife and I both work very hard to order to provide a healthy and wealthy lifestyle for our children." He is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan both to purchase a wood timbers for his fence door and to buy some fabrics for his wife's sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase  wood timber and fabrics for his wife's business

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley O. K. is thirty seven years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have two children aged fourteen and seven who they hope can have good education to the university level. His business is located in a busy town centre called Kakamega. He sells new clothes which include shirts, blouses, trousers. He has had this business for ten years. He says that his business is profitable and his major challenge is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business so customers are spoilt for choice. The customers' purchasing power is also low compared to bigger towns within the country. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to meet his customers' demands and hopes to expand his business and buy land from the profits. He describes himself as very hard-working and visionary.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Elsa Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Elsa C. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive en la comunidad de la Floresta en la parroquia de Cumbe, En su entorno se encuentran, entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas. El centro parroquial de Cumbe está organizado en torno a la plaza central y se caracteriza por conservar parte de su arquitectura tradicional, la cual se ve reflejada en las casas de dos plantas, su gente se dedica agricultura y ganadería.

Doña Elsa tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijo de 8  y 5 años de edad que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción laborando como albañil. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.

La Señora. Elsa se dedica a trabajar en la costura, actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 6 años,  todo lo que sabe lo aprendió en el colegio, realiza todo tipo de arreglo a las prendas de vestir y también se dedica a la elaboración de pantalones.

Se encuentra en su quinto ciclo en la banca comunal, tiempo en el cual ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para la confección de los pantalones.
 
Su meta es llegar a tener un taller de confección de ropa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa C. is a member of the El Paraíso Communal Bank; she lives in the Floresta community in the Cumbe area. The place has great fields of cattle ranches, and romantic old haciendas. The central area of Cumbe is organized by the central place that is distinctive because it preserved its traditional architecture, reflected in the two story buildings. Most of the people in the area work in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Mrs. Elsa is 24 years old, is married and has 2 children who are 8 and 5 years old, they attend school. Her husband works in construction as a mason. They don’t own a home which is why they live with her mother and share in the household expenses.

Mrs. Elsa works as a seamstress, she has worked for 6 years in this field and all that she knows she learned in school. She makes all types of clothing and also makes pants.

This is Mrs. Elsa’s fifth loan with the communal bank, and during this time she has grown to have good friendships with all of the members. The new loan will be used to buy fabric to make pants.

Elsa’s dream is to have her own workshop to make her clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda V. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Florenda is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Florenda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase land to raise additional livestock. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Florenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda M. is from the town of Leon B. Postigo. She is 62 years old and married. To make a living, Esmeralda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Esmeralda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Esmeralda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Veronica Elvira

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de tipeos, impresiones y búsqueda de información en un local situado frente a una universidad que se encuentra en el lugar. Esta actividad es una de las más comunes en la zona debido a la gran cantidad de estudiantes que se encuentran en la ciudad. Su trabajo consiste en tipear sus trabajos, imprimirlos y muchas veces buscar información adicional. Esta actividad es muy rentable.

Verónica desea brindar mantenimiento a su computadora de modo que esta pueda operar de modo rápido, lo cual generará que la calidad de su atención mejore, adicionalmente desea adquirir material para realizar su labor, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una joven bastante emprendedora y que busca salir adelante, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien bastante amable y responsable.
texts.en:
Verónica is 28 years old.  She is single and lives together with her parents in Lambayeque district, an area with a lot of commercial activity which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Verónica provides typing, printing and information searching services in a premises located opposite a university.  This business activity is one of the most common in the area owing to the large number of students in the city.  She types up students' work, prints it out and often also searches for additional information.  This activity is very profitable.

Verónica would like to have her computer serviced so that it will work quickly which will improve the quality of her service.  She would also like to acquire materials to carry out her work.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 600 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

Verónica is quite an enterprising young woman who is looking for ways to get ahead in life.  People who know her consider her to be quite kind and responsible.

loans.use: To have her computer serviced

loans.name: Vilduvides Germania

texts.es:
Vilduvides de 47 años, siempre le gusto coser y confeccionar ropa pero como no tenía mucha experiencia decidió inscribirse en una institución que enseñan manualidades y diseño de ropa con confección. Viviendo en una zona urbana comenzó a promocionarse como costurera y confeccionista. 

Con la dedicación y esfuerzo que utilizo para que su negocio creciera le ayudo para que la gente del sector la conocieran y tenga una clientela fija. En la actualidad tiene 20 años trabajando  desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm en su casa donde ubico su taller de costura y confección debido a la falta de dinero. Entrega vestidos, blusas, camisetas a un bajo costo. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiración para su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos para hacer nueva ropa. En el futuro quiere incrementar el taller para poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Vilduvides is 47 years old.  She has always liked to sew and make clothes but as she didn't have much experience she decided to enrol at an institution where they teach handicrafts, clothes design and dressmaking.  Living in an urban area, Vilduvides started to promote herself as a seamstress and dressmaker.

Vilduvides put a lot of commitment and hard work into growing her business and this helped her to make herself known amongst the people in her area and to attract regular customers.  She has been working for 20 years, from 9.00am to 8.00pm, in her home which is where she set up her sewing and dressmaking workshop due to a lack of money.  She delivers dresses, blouses and t-shirts at low prices.

Vilduvides has a lot of plans for her business.  She would like to use her loan to buy fabric and thread to make new clothes.  In the future, she would like to expand her workshop so that she can provide other people with work.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Cleopatra R. is from the village of Tabon. She is 47 years old. Cleopatra is a group member of PMPC. Cleopatra is married and has three children. To make a living, Cleopatra operates a food vending business, selling a variety of different foods in the local community, most especially baked goods.

Cleopatra started her business only this year and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Cleopatra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleopatra is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Cleopatra from PMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to cook

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is 56 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Rebecca sells snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns a monthly net income of 1,600 PHP.

In 2004, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials needed to make her snacks. For her 14th loan, Rebecca is requesting 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for the business.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for snack vending business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. D. is 43 years old. She is married to a driver and has two children, aged 13 and 14 years old. Her business is located at Magongo estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

She owns a beauty salon and has been providing services to the local women. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is insufficient funds. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cosmetics and hair additions to sell to the customers to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as customer friendly.

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Marisela Jacqueline

texts.es: La Sra Marisela labora como cajero es casada  tiene dos hijo a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que le dan con  este  desembolso porque asi va a mejor su vivienda,para compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque ,hierro, cemento, arena, clavo, estribo para un cuarto en la vivienda y solventar deuda pendiente que tiene.
texts.en: Mariela works as a cashier.  She is married and has 2 dependent children.  This is her first loan with CEPRODEL, and she is grateful for being given this loan because with it she is going to make improvements to her house.  She will purchase construction materials such as cement blocks, steel, cement, sand, nails and braces to add a room to her home and to pay off some outstanding debt that she has.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie M. is from the village of Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Elsie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling toys and accessories in the local community. She also makes and sells homemade ice cream. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and increase working capital. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as headbands and accessories. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Guillermo Joel

texts.es:
Guillermo Joel  A. S. tiene 24 años, es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos, tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Guillermo Joel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Guillermo Joel A. S. is 24 years old, married, and living with his wife and two children in the Cantón Ventanas administrative division of Los Ríos, Ecuador.

The members of the 'San José de los Amarillos' community bank live in Amarillos community, in Ventanas canton. They work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Guillermo Joel is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his supplies in the Murillo commercial center and sells his products in the same location.  He is requesting this loan to be able to plant corn and rice and to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  This loan would provide him the financial support he needs to face challenges such as pests, diseases and changing weather.  

Guillermo Joel dreams of owning his own home.  He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers for growing crops

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a milk sales business, selling from door to door in her neighboring community. She faces a major challenge with storage facilities for her business. Joan dreams of purchasing two motorcycles to supply milk faster in the future. 

With the requested 30,000 KES loan, she wants to pay for electricity in her house so that she can store milk in the refrigerator. She decided to work with Kiva's partner, Yehu, because it has no legal requirements.

loans.use: To pay for electricity in her house to store milk in the refrigerator

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es una cliente de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicado en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Aurelia cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por un familiar. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta ambulante de helados en un carrito. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Aurelia ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a 55-year-old customer that lives with her family in the suburbs of the Santa Rosa District. This is a commercial zone that is located in Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Department. Aurelia has a small grocery store that is located in her home, which is staffed by a relative. They sell to their neighbors and customers. They sell products that provide for the basic daily needs of their customers such as groceries. The business does well. She also sells ice cream from a traveling ice cream cart. In this way she helps her husband with the economic support of their family.
With the growing demand of her customers, she would like to expand her business by buying more products. She is requesting a loan of 1500 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to meet her goal.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cuencanitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cuencanitas está formado por 8 mujeres muy carismáticas, alegres,  luchadoras y emprendedoras. Laboran en diferentes actividades sin descuidar a sus familias, sus trabajos les han permitido ayudar en la economía de sus hogares y se sientes muy orgullosas por ello. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad un clima frió y esta bañada por 4 ríos, tiene un hermoso centro histórico, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. 

La Señora. Mónica A. vive en por el sector de Chilcapamba en la ciudad de Cuenca. Tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 6 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Mónica ha iniciado su negocio hace 2 meses, ella vende ropa especialmente pantalones. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca de Yanbal, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad, a sus familiares y conocidos.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos.
 
Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Cuencanitas community bank is made up of eight very charismatic, cheerful, hard-working and enterprising women.  They each work in their respective businesses without neglecting their families.  Their jobs have enabled them to help their households financially and they feel very proud of this fact.  The women live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is a cold-climate city.  It is surrounded by four rivers and has a beautiful historic center.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Mónica A. lives in Chilcapamba sector, in the city of Cuenca.  She is 27 years old, married, and has three children aged 9, 6 and 2.  Her two eldest children attend a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  They don't own their own home but live in a rental house.

Mónica started her business two months ago.  She sells clothes, especially pants.  She also sells Yanbal-brand cosmetics.  She sells her products throughout the city, to her family members and acquaintances.

This is the first loan Mónica has accessed through her community bank.  She will invest it in buying clothes and cosmetics.

Mónica's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Muyurina Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Muyurina inicia su ciclo 21 con 15 socias las cuales se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores, venta D. comida, siembra D. verduras.
María, es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal Muyurina en este ciclo, es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hija D. tres años. Maria se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y los venD. en los mercados D. Ayacucho. Con éste es el tercer ciclo que está en FINCA Perú ingresó por la invitación D. una socia, le gusta por la facilidad que recibe los préstamos y las capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora. Está ahorrando para la construcción D. su casa.
texts.en:
The Muyurina communal bank is beginning its 21st term with 15 members who raise small animals, sell food and grow vegetables.

Maria is the president of the Muyurina communal bank during this term.  She is 28 years old, has a common-law partner and a three-year-old daughter.  Maria raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, which she sells in the markets in Ayacucho.  This is her third loan through FINCA Peru.  She was invited to join by another member and especially likes the easy loan payment terms and training she receives through her promoter.  

She is saving to build a house.

loans.use: To buy small animals

loans.name: Blanca Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, por sus tradiciones y por su cultura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas muy amables y calidas.
 
Doña Blanca tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 20, 19 y 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su tercera hija trabaja y se paga los estudios de la universidad, su cuarto hijo ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en su propia unidad de taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Blanca vende productos Avon hace 2 años, vende sus productos de domingo a domingo. También realiza manualidades como: aretes, binchas, manillas etc. esta labor la realiza hace 10 años, aprendió estas manualidades por habilidad propia y sus productos los realiza bajo pedido.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 4 años, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus manualidades.
 
Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank “Corazón de María” (Mary’s Heart) and lives in the Valle parish.  This parish is known for the beauty of its landscapes, for its traditions, and for its culture.  Its people work in business, raising animals, and agriculture.  They are very warm and friendly people.

Blanca is 42-years-old married, and has five children of 23, 22, 20, 19, and 16 years of age.  Her two oldest children work and help her economically, her third daughter works and pays for her studies in the university, her fourth son helps with household chores, and her youngest son studies in a school in the city.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and works in his own taxi.  They do not have their own house, they live as renters.

Blanca has sold Avon products for the last two years.  She sells her products every day.  She also makes crafts like: earrings, headbands, bracelets, etc.  She has done this work since she was 10-years-od.  She learned these crafts studying them herself and makes her crafts to fill orders.

She has been in the communal bank for four years.  The loan will be invested in materials to make her crafts.

Her goal is to buy herself a house.

loans.use: to buy materials for making crafts.

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Khatibu, in his early 30's, is a married father of two children, one of whom goes to school. The operator of a tailoring business for five years now, he works from 6.00 a.m. to 9.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Khatibu's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, his previous loans, all repaid, having been used to buy a sewing machine, renovate his shop and meet household expenses. He will use this loan to buy materials for the sewing business, and his dream is to one day expand his shop and employ people to sew.

Khatibu will share this loan with his loan group "Reli," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy materials for his sewing business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama smokes fish at Abura. She has received a junior high level of education. She is married and has four children.  Her husband is a mason. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children. She is standing close to the traditionally built oven she uses to smoke the fish.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Romain Preira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Il est  constitué de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de savon. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This community group was created on the 3rd of June, 2010 and is made up of eight women who live in the same quarter. They all run small businesses. Madame Awa, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group leader. She is 38 years old, and married with two children. She looks after another two children placed in her care by their parents. 
She has sold soap for a living for a number of years, and this loan will enable her to boost her working capital and develop the business. The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing etc) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a que la señora Mercedes,  de  Ciudad del Este, al  enterarse sobre el programa de la Fundación, contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. De esto surgió la formación del comité denominado San Antonio, el cual actualmente cuenta con 16 integrantes, las cuales se encuentran desarrollando en tercer ciclo.
Todas ellas se unieron con el propósito de generar mas ingresos para poder de esa manera llevar el pan a sus casas. Todo lo que hacen es con miras a un futuro mejor para sus familias.
La Sra. Lilian se dedica a la peluquería en el barrio donde vive, por medio de su esfuerzo a logrado salir adelante y poder tener un poco mas de ingresos, ya que la peluquería la ayuda mucho. Sueña con algún dia poder ampliar su negocio y asi tener mas capacidad para mas clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para utilizarlos dentro de la peluqueria, como ser gel, spray para pelo y demás.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the efforts of Sra. Mercedes, who is from Ciudad del Este. She learned about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya and contacted her neighbors and friends about forming a local committee. What resulted was the formation of the committee named “San Antonio”, which currently has 16 members. They are participating in their third loan cycle.

All of the members have joined together so that they can generate more income to support their households. They do everything they can to create a better future for their families.

Sra. Lilian operates a beauty salon in the neighborhood where she lives. Through her efforts, she has been able to move forward and earn a little more income. Her beauty parlor has been a great help. She dreams of someday expanding her business so that she can accommodate more customers. Lilian is requesting a loan to buy supplies that are used in her salon such as gel, hair spray, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her salon, such as gel and hair spray.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 52-year-old widowed woman. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines with her three grown children. Six years ago, she started vending snack items for a living. 

Lucy earns an approximate monthly income of PHP 7,000 doing this job. In 2010, Lucy joined GDMPC for easy access to financial services. She had previously taken a loan from the organization. Now, Lucy is applying  for a loan of PHP 8,000 once more to buy food containers and snack items like bread, banana cake and more to sell. Lucy plans to own a more spacious food stall and earn more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy food containers and snack items like bread, banana cake and more to sell.

loans.name: Liz Janeth

texts.es: Liz (26 años) convive desde hace 10 años con Michel, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Ángela y David a los que quiere mucho y cuida en casa de su madrina, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Como joven emprendedora con principios y objetivos. Ella comenzó a trabajar como regidora en el gobierno de su localidad, donde recibe una pequeña dieta de S/. 700 nuevo soles; ahí comenzó a laborar para el bienestar y la justicia de su pueblo. También sigue tejiendo manualmente, chompas y gorras que vende a los intermediarios que comercializan los tejidos a diferentes ciudades del país. Ella se siente muy feliz con lo obtenido hasta el momento; porque recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en un programa educativo del estado; que se trata de alfabetizar a personas de la tercera edad, donde recibe un dinero extra. Ahora para el futuro de su familia desea seguir progresando y ahorrar lo necesario para emprender un negocio propio que le permita brindar una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para conseguir sus objetivos. Además de prometer ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Liz de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 5 madejas de lana para realizar sus lindos tejidos.
texts.en:
Liz (26) has lived with her partner for 10 years and their 2 children, Ángela and David.  She loves them very much and takes care of them in her mother-in-law’s house in San Pedro de Cajas.  As a young entrepreneur with principles and goals she began to work as an alderwoman in the local government where she receives a small allowance of 700 new sols.  There she started to work for the welfare and justice of her town.

She also knits sweaters and hats by hand and sells them to wholesalers who in turn sell the knitwear in different cities in the country.  She feels very happy with where she has gotten up to now. Her husband supports her-he works in an educational program of the state where they teach literacy to the elderly, and he receives extra money.   Now for her family’s future she wants to continue progressing and saving what she needs to start her own business that will allow her to offer her family a higher standard of living.

She belongs to the communal bank “Corazón de San Pedro” and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is hoping for a small loan so that she can attain her objectives.  
She also promises to be punctual with the payments.   Liz will use the requested money to buy 5 skeins of wool so that she can make her beautiful knitwear.

loans.use: to buy 5 skeins of wool to make her beautiful knitwear.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with three children, two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has owned real estate houses. Her potential customers are tenants. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing more real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to renovate the houses and start a vegetable stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate the houses and start a vegetable stall business.

loans.name: Maria Balvina

texts.es:
María D. 59 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. la Arena que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

María se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. chicha D. jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base D. maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú) y harina D. maíz, esta actividad los realiza desD. hace 10 años aproximadamente, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado D. generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas D. la chicha D. jora en la zona donD. vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad D. crecer María a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1200 nuevos soles para comprar más harina D. maíz para la elaboración D. chicha D. jora y utensilios, con la finalidad D. obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco; en especial sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the district of La Arena, which is part of the Piura Department.  The people of this area work in agriculture and livestock.

María works preparing and selling "chicha D. jora" (this is a delicious drink maD. from a corn base, which is much consumed in the north of Peru) and cornflour.  She has been doing this for about the last 10 years, as it is a practice that has been passed down from generation to generation.

Recently she has increased her sales of the chicha D. jora in the area where she lives; this has been a good thing in terms of increasing her income and improving the quality of life for her family.

As she has the opportunity to grow, María has requested a loan of 1,200 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more cornflour for making chicha D. jora and to buy utensils.  He goal is to get more earnings and increase her number of customers so as to pay back the loan being offered and so her family can get ahead little by little, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy more cornflour to continue preparing "chicha de jora" (a drink made from a corn base).

loans.name: Nueva Amistad De Huascar Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal "NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR" vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por casi 8 años, este grupo está formado por 8 personas, quienes elegieron como presidenta a la señora Clemencia
