La Señora Clemencia es una persona muy trabajadora, con carisma y responsabilidad, que se dedica a la elaboracion de aretes, collares, pulseras de forma artesanal, tiene clientes fijos a los cuales vende al por mayor.
Clemencia ha sabido salir adelante pues es madre soltera de 4 hijos, a quienes ha tratado de dar las comodidades que se merecen, dos de sus hijos actualmente aun dependen de ella ya que son menores de edad, ella sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a a exportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Amistad de Huascar” (New Friendship of Huascar) Communal Bank has worked with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for almost 8 years.  The group is made up of 8 people who have elected Clemencia as their president.

Clemencia is a very hard-working person, with charisma and responsibility, who is dedicated to making artisan earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.  She has a set group of customers to whom she sells the majority of her work.

Clemencia has understood the necessity of getting ahead, since she is a single mother with 4 children for whom she has tried to provide the comforts they deserve. Two of her children are still minors and dependent on her.  Clemencia dreams of making her business grow and of reaching the point where she can export her products.

loans.use: to buy materials to make artisan products to sell.

loans.name: Govher

texts.ru: Говхер жительница города Чкаловск. Она замужем. Ей 35 лет. У нее четверо детей. Говхер занимается торговлей. У нее в городе имеется магазин бытовой техники.  В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой техники.
texts.en: Govher lives in the town of Chkalovsk. She is married. She is 35 years old. She has four children. Govher is a vendor. She keeps a store of home appliances. She has been in this business for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan to stock up on new appliances.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 47 years old, married, and they have five children. He has been a farmer for the last fifteen years. He learned about KADET through an advertisement done by KADET. He paid his previous loan well and this marks his second loan from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He is an honest man who will work hard to achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 35 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Olivia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Olivia has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from her Sari-Sari (variety) Store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 51 years old and married. He has 15 children between the ages of 24 and 13 living in his house in Hoima, Uganda. His family goal is to develop his home further. 

For seven years, John has been operating a spare-parts business. He started as a driver before moving into the spare-parts business. The main challenge he faces is customers who delay payments. His dream is a modern garage. John needs a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is from the village of Benito Soliven, in the province of Isabela. He is 33 years old. Marcelo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelo owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While it is not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Marcelo has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest season.

Marcelo is requesting a new loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Solinuu

texts.en:
Solinuu, age 48, owns and operates a business venture involving the planting and harvesting of a variety of vegetables and offering these for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Solinuu needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family. She and her husband have six children.

In 2010, Solinuu joined SPBD* to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Solinuu's second loan with SPBD. 
 
*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 69 year old businessman. He is married to Sarah, who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child, aged 25. 

Bernard has been running a retail shop for the past three years. He uses his monthly income of KES 15,000 to support his family. He is applying for his third loan term from  KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his shop. He will use the anticipated profits from the business to provide his child with a university education. He hopes one day to own a wholesale shop, which will help him to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his shop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca cuenta 58 años de edad, es madre soltera su hija se llama Sara esta estudiando la prepa 2° grado, ella se dedica al comercio abarrotes y verduras tiene 10 años con el negocio lo cual invertirá el préstamo en la compra de los productos verduras, frutas, etc. a doña francisca le gustaría que el negocio incrementara mas ya que lo ha sabido sacar adelante ya que ella es la que ayuda a su hija con la los gastos de la escuela ya que quiere darle una buena educación a sus hija para que se prepare profesionalmente ya que quiere ser doctora.
texts.en: Francisca, 58, is a single mother.  Her daughter’s name is Sara and she’s in 11th grade.  She is a grocery and vegetable merchant and has been in business ten years.  She will use the loan to buy vegetables, fruit, etc.  Francisca would like the business to grow more since she’s known how to move it forward because she is who helps her daughter with her school expenses and she wants to give her daughter a good education so that she can prepare herself professionally since she wants to become a doctor.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  is 49 years old and is married to Mary. They have six children.

He has been in the farming business for the last 10 years, from which he earns a monthly income of Kes  30,000. He is applying for his first loan of Kes 20,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He hopes to use the funds to buy seeds and pesticides for spraying in his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner of the family in a village in Moung Russey district, San is a 48-year-old widower with two dependent daughters who work in a garment factory in Phnom Pen, the capital city of Cambodia. To support his family, for fifteen years he has been farming his own rice farm as his main source of income and has been fishing for additional income. 

San is a third-cycle client with VisionFund. The previous loans have helped him have regular income. He currently earns less than five U.S. dollars per day but is able to save only US$1.5 daily. Now San and his group member are applying for another loan with VisionFund. He plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his rice paddy. He hopes to increase his crop yield and earn better income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his rice paddy

loans.name: Mariam.

texts.en: Mariam is 49 years old. She has 7 children. All of her children go to school. Mariam has been selling flowers and pots used as decorations for 9 years. She will add more flowers and pots for sale. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children. She would like to run a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more flowers and pots for sale

loans.name: Tadagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TADAGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ganiyatou, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Dègnon Manboudou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ganiyatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Ganiyatou et son mari. Ganiyatou n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour y arriver, Ganiyatou vend des pommades, des médicaments et divers produits à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis douze ans. Ganiyatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Ganiyatou ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TADAGBE, sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des pommades et des médicaments.

loans.name: Evelin Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Evelin Margarita. In my community, I’m known as Margarita the tortilla lady. That’s because I make and sell corn tortillas. I open my store at 6 a.m. and I close at 8 p.m. I make tortillas three times a day, around every meal during the day. I’ve had my business for five years, and it’s been going very well. I’ve been able to help my family with the profits.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, wood, and others.

Mi nombre es Evelin Margarita en mi comunidad me conocen como Margarita la tortillera, es porque me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz, abro mi negocio a las 6:00 am y lo cierro a las 8:00 pm, hago tortillas 3 veces al dia para cada tiempo de comida. Tengo 5 años de tenerlo y me ha ido muy bien, ya que de las ganancias he podido ayudar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, leña y otros.

loans.name: Manaa

texts.en: Manaa is a 45 year old woman with 6 children. She cracks stones for sale. She wants to expand her business but she cannot afford to buy the stones for cracking. She is seeking a loan of $1100 from Kiva to help her expand her operations.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Mrs. Augustine U. is a union leader who sells cooked food and groceries to her community. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 40 years of age, married with two children. Augustine hopes to receive a loan of $750 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Widowed three years ago, Mrs. Yawa A. is 39 and mother of six children. She has a great deal of difficulty providing the basic necessities for her children, especially their school fees, etc. The older ones have had to leave school due to lack of financial means. Yawa’s business activity is selling the lengths of cloth used as wraps or sarongs in Africa (pagnes) and cosmetics. Unfortunately, she has very little capital to expand her business. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to increase her profit and be able to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Devenue veuve depuis 3 ans, Madame A. Yawa est âgée de 39 ans et mère de six (6) enfants. Elle a toutes les difficultés pour assumer les besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et surtout leur scolarité. Les aînés ont dû abandonner l’école faute de moyen. L’activité qui lui procure un peu de revenu est la vente de tissus pagnes et des produits de beauté. Malheureusement elle a des moyens très limités pour pouvoir agrandir ce commerce. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $800 afin d’améliorer ses revenus et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: sale of cloth (African sarongs) and cosmetics

loans.name: Fai

texts.en:
Fai P. is proud to be one of the ladies who runs her own small business. She is well educated and got up to the Secondary Level. She said that running her own small business will be one good way of refreshing and keeping her mind active.

She is 31 years old, and she has four dependents. Her husband is a fisherman and he gets paid every week.

She is one of the new members of Vaimoso Uta, and she is young and strong. She joined the program recently, and she is waiting for this first loan to start up her dream. She will start with a BBQ business, and she will be selling it for only five tala a plate.

loans.use: To buy boxes of mutton flaps, turkey tails, sausages and supplies for her BBQ business

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura worked for many years in a “maquiladora” (factory/assembly plant) but, unfortunately, she lost her job during personnel layoffs at the business. Nevertheless, with the bonus/severance she received as a result, she was able to purchase a sewing machine and start building a customer base. At first, she focused solely on hemming or repairing clothes. She gained the confidence of her customers and today they ask her to make skirts and shorts for them, among other things. However, her sewing machine broke and now she cannot work the way she needs to.

She is asking for a loan of $475USD to be repaid over a five-month term. With this money she will be able to purchase materials such as thread, buttons, fabrics, remnants, and other items she needs to make clothes. With your support, Laura and her children will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura trabajó durante muchos años en una maquiladora desgraciadamente hubo un recorte de personal en su empresa y se quedó sin trabajo. Sin embargo con el dinero que le dieron de aguinaldo se compró una máquina de coser y ahí fue como comenzó a adquirir clientes, primero lo único que hacía eran dobleces a la ropa, o arreglarlos, sin embargo después fue adquiriendo la confianza de sus clientes y hoy ya le encargan hacer faldas, shorts entre otras cosas. Sin embargo tiene una máquina de coser que se descompuso y por lo tanto ahora no puede trabajar como necesita.

Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US 475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Laura podrá comprar materiales como, hilos, botones, telas, retazos, y otras cosas que necesita para poder elaborar las prendas. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies to make clothes.

loans.name: Ushindi A Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, age 24, is married with 2 children (ages 5 and 3). She also takes care of 2 dependents as well (ages 8 and 3). Mwanaisha owns a grocery shop where she sells different food items. She began this business in 2004 and it is now open from 5am to 10pm daily. Every month, she earns about $132 in profit from this business.

In the past, Mwanaisha was able to take out one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Having paid it back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will be sharing the new loan with her subgroup member Rukia O., who also has a business of selling food items.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
D. Orifjon is 40 years old. He is married with three children. His wife looks after the house and the kids.

Orifjon supports his family by breeding cattle which he sells for meat. He has been in this business for the past 2 years and currently has two cows. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income needed to allowing Orifjon to support his family and improve their living conditions. 

Now Orifjon is planning to buy one more cow. He also needs to purchase the fodder. Orifjon is requesting a loan of 1000.00 US Dollars over a term of 9 months.

loans.use: Increasing of stock purchasing of 1 сow and the fodder

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amalia A. sells hot dogs and soda pop in the Terminal market in León city. She began her business 8 years ago as a street vendor prior to establishing herself in her present locale.

She is a single mother, has one child, and is also responsible for supporting her aged mother. As her economic situation is in need, she approached Ceprodel to provide a loan that would enable her to purchase ingredients to prepare her delicious hot dogs. Today she needs to buy products such as bread, ketchup, onion, mustard, cream and sausage. So she has approached CEPRODEL again to ask for a loan and therefore improve her business and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El detalle de la actividad económica que se dedica la señora Amalia A. es a la venta de hot dogs y gaseosas en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León. Su negocio inicia desde hace 8 años ambulante en el mercado hasta establecerse en su localidad.

Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo y además con la responsabilidad de mantener a su mamá que es una humilde anciana. Debido a su situación económica que es muy baja, ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que le permiten la compra de los ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos hot dog. Hoy en día su necesidad es la compra de estos productos tales como pan, salsa de tomate, cebollas, mostaza, crema y chorizo. Para esto acude una vez mas a CEPRODEL para obtener los créditos y así mejorar la situación de su negocio y familia.

loans.use: Buy condiments for hot dog business

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Selling tortillas is the business that Mrs. Petrona M. dedicates herself to with great effort in the Villanueva area of Chinandega city. She is a married mother responsible for one son who she greatly worries about providing schooling that he needs in spite of the family’s economic situation.

Today Petrona urgently needs corn to make tortillas but does not have the economic resources because she has little savings. She has approached CEPRODEL to obtain a loan that will enable her to acquire corn and thereby make her tortillas that surely are delicious as she is one of the best tortilla makers in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de tortillas es el negocio al que con mucho esfuerzo se dedica la señora Petrona M. en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es madre casada y con un hijo a su responsabilidad que se preocupa grandemente por brindarle las posibilidades de estudio que este necesita a pesar de su situación económica.

La necesidad actual de la señora Petrona es la urgencia de adquirir el maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas pero al no contar con el recurso económico por ser de escasos ingresos ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir el maíz y así elaborar las tortillas que por cierto las prepara muy deliciosas siendo ella una de las mejores elaboradoras de tortilla en su localidad.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Señora Alicia belongs to the communal bank located in Calleria, Ucayali. She's 38 years old with 3 children. She's married and her husband is an accountant, but his salary doesn't cover the daily family expenses. With the first loan Alicia obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small convenience store.

She opens up her store about 8:00 in the morning while she also does house chores. Her store offers a lot of products to sell. Her children help her run the store. They are very happy and proud of their mother's accomplishments.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase more merchandise such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, detergent, body soap and shampoo, etc.

Alicia feels that she's very stable financially. She can now help with the expenses, fix her house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Roca Fuerte 238, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años es madre de 3 hijos, es casada, su esposo es contador pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Alicia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad atiende su bodega a partir de las 8 am, y la comparte con las tareas domesticas, su negocio esta mas surtido, vende diferentes productos, sus hijos la ayudan y están contentos con los logros de su madre. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará abarrotes como: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, panes, leche, detergente, jabón, champú, etc. Alicia se siente mas estable económicamente, ahora puede aportar a su hogar, arreglar su casa, y ampliar mas su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Afamie Group

texts.en: Alpha is the group leader of AFAMIE.  With a previous loan, twenty-five-year-old Alpha started his business.  A newly married man, he would like to build a poverty-free future for his family.  Mohamed and Bubakar are group members who are doing the same business and have come together as solidarity group members to guarantee each other's loans.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 1,500,000 to increase their stock and income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.en: J. Khusrav is 33 years old. He is married with three children. Her wife is a housekeeper and she takes care of their children. Khusrav has a minivan and provides transport of passengers within the city of Istaravshan. After 10 years he has gained extensive business experience. Initially he rented the car, but with time and savings, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates considerable income for Khusrav’s family, allowing them to improve living conditions. However, the business also needs some funding. Khusrav plans to fix his car to provide higher quality services in future. Khusrav needs to purchase spare parts and to pay for the repair of the minivan. With this purpose he requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Khusrav and he would like to thank all for their trust and promises not to let anyone down with the loan repayment. He is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start of a small business selling clothing in her neighborhood.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El CME La Esperanza se encuentra en el Barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15Km de la ciudad de Paraguarí. Actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo del programa con una calificación excelente, de las 15 mujeres quienes integran el grupo 12 de ellas están accediendo ya a un crédito de Gs. 1.000.000.

Estas señoras son amas de casa y llevan además adelante sus microempresas para poder generara mayores ingresos a sus familias. Bernardina es vendedora ambulante, ella vende distintos tipos de mercaderías especialmente ropas y cosas para el hogar; Zully vende frutas y verduras y Sandra O. y Eva S. son empleadas domésticas que tienen pensado dedicarse en paralelo a sus actividades a la venta.

Olga A. es costurera y realiza distintos tipos de vestidos y uniformes para oficinas; Rogelia vende queso, huevos y harina de maíz. Sixta vende deliciosas comidas rápidas que ella misma prepara mientras que Marcelina es una excelente peluquera.

Mirtha E. vende productos de limpieza que ella misma elabora, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos de barrio; Numidia R. posee una despensa que ella misma administra al igual que Gladys C. y Ángela E.. Por último tenemos a las señoras Ceferina que tiene un bello kiosco, Norma B. que tiene una panadería y Juana R. que se dedica a la venta de helados y comidas rápidas.

Todas estas mujeres agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que les da para aumentar su capital de trabajo, mejorando sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de sus respectivas familias.
texts.en:
The CME, La Esperanza, is located in the San Francisco neighborhood in the city of Yaguaron, 15km from the city of Paraguari. It is currently in the fifth cycle of the program and is highly qualified. Of the 15 women who make up the group, 12 are already receiving a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Gs.

These women are housewives but also run their microbusinesses in order to generate more income for their families. Bernardina is a traveling saleswoman, selling different types of merchandise, particularly clothes and household items. Zully sells fruits and vegetables, and Sandra O. and Eva S. are domestic employees who are planning to also become saleswomen.

Olga A. is a seamstress, making different kinds of dresses and office uniforms. Rogelia sells cheese, eggs and corn flour. Sixta sells delicious fast food that she makes herself, while Marcelina is an excellent hairdresser.

Mirtha E. sells cleaning products that she makes herself. Her main customers are neighbors from her neighborhood. Numidia R., Gladys Chavez and Angela E. all sell food. Finally, Ceferina has a lovely kiosk, Norma Benitez has a bakery, and Juana R. sells ice cream and fast food.

All of these women want to thank the Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunity it gives them to increase their capital, their income, and finally to improve the quality of life for their families.


Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat, drinks, baked goods, cooking oil, pasta, rice, flour, dairy products, fruits and vegetables in general, yeast, chemicals to make cleaning products, ingredients for making ice cream, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat has run this small store for eight years. She is 42 years old, single, and has settled in Khirdalan town. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Djabrayil region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy the goods for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Mwanamku

texts.en: Mwanamku is married and has four children, ages 7, 10, 12, and 14, and she has been selling charcoal in Zanzibar since 2002. Charcoal is the most common method of cooking food in Tanzania so there is a large market for this type of fuel. Everything from rice to cakes to fish is cooked over charcoal as stoves and ovens are uncommon. Mwanamku works from 7:00am to 9:00pm daily and earns a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is hoping that her first loan from BRAC Tanzania allows her to increase her inventory, expand her business, and earn her a greater profit.

loans.use: Mwanamku would like to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lafiz

texts.en:
G. Lafiz is 38 years old, married and has three children. He has a secondary education and operates an animal husbandry business. He has a small farm where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Lafiz buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them at a higher price. 

Lafiz is applying for a loan because he needs money to buy more cattle. He is requesting 2500 Somoni (750 USD) and plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Doeum

texts.en:
Doeum C. is married and lives with one child and her husband in the Battambang province, Cambodia. She sells groceries from her home to earn a living and is able to make $3 profit a day. Her husband is a translator in a private company. He makes $7 each day. 

Doeum C. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to diversify her stock and to make repairs on her house.

loans.use: To diversify her stock and repair her house

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Muraho, “greetings” from Nathan N. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province of Rwanda! Nathan is 45 years old, married with 4 children and also raising 2 orphans.

Nathan sells bicycle spare parts and he also repairs bicycles, so he is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to increase his stock of spare parts and also to buy a welding machine. This loan will be repaid over 12 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and spare parts for bike repair

loans.name: Ivette Milenia

texts.es:
La microempresaria Ivette Milenia Álvarez A. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. La señora Álvarez tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años con la que se apoya para los gastos del hogar ya que además es profesora en un instituto de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

En su pulpería vende granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz etc. Pero también vende productos carnicos como pollo y  res. En ocasiones contrata a una amiga para que le despache en el negocio y poder ir a impartir clases ya que el salario de profesor es uno de los más bajos en este país.

La señora Álvarez al igual que otras microempresarias requiere del financiamiento para comprar: 75 libras de pollo a US$ 1 dólar cada libra , 80 libras de carne de res a US$ 1.50 dólar cada libra, 1 quintal de harina a US$ 50 dólar cada quintal , 1 quintal de Frijoles a US$ 55 dólar cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 27 dólar cada bidon, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 58 dólar cada quintal y 2 quintales de maíz amarillo a US$ 15 dólar cada quintal.
texts.en:
Milenia Álvarez A., a small businessperson, is 44, a single parent with one son studying at the university. Señora Álvarez has had a small store for 10 years which covers the household expenses, and she is also a professor in an institute here in Bluefields. In her store she sells basic grains such as rice, beans, corn, etc. She also sells meat products such as chicken and beef. Sometimes she hires a friend to take care of the business so she can go teach classes, but a professor's salary is one of the lowest in the country. Señora Álvarez, like other small businesspersons, needs financing to buy 75 pounds of chicken at US$1 per pound, 80 pounds of beef at US$1.50 per pound, 100 Kg. of flour at US$50 per 100 Kg., 100 Kg. of beans at US$55 per 100 Kg., 2 cans of oil at US$27 per can, 200 Kg. of American rice at US$58 per 100 Kg., and 200 Kg. of yellow corn at US$15 per 100 Kg.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef, flour, beans, oil, rice and corn flour

loans.name: Jessica's Group

texts.en:
Jessica is a super entrepreneur. Her main business is a drugstore that she has operated for 15 years. In addition, she owns four other businesses including a hair salon, a motorcycle rental shop, a farm, and a rental business for commercial houses. Her extraordinary business ambition is matched only by her extraordinary responsibilities that include caring for her own 10 children and caring for another 30 orphans from her late sisters and brothers. Every month, she takes all her children to a farm where they assist in growing crops. The proceeds from selling these crops help pay fees for their school and medical care.

Jessica aspires to open an additional retail shop to be operated by her mother and to expand her recently opened motorcycle rental shop. She is asking for a loan to finish the construction of additional rental properties.

loans.use: Construction of rental properties

loans.name: Davlyatniso

texts.en:
Davlyatniso S. is a 47-year-old widowed mother of four children. She has been very supportive of her children since she became a single parent. Davlyatniso has sold clothes for kids at her local market for the past 15 years. Because of this, she will be able to pay for her children to finish school. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of clothes to sell. Davlyatniso would like to use the loan to buy more bales of clothes that come with variety to increase her stock. She hopes to raise enough income to help all of her children to finish school.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Increasing working capital for the purpose of business development

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana P. is 56 years old and has 4 children. Her husband, Melchor P., is a farmer. Victoriana owns a small sari-sari store (local convenience shop). She started her business using their small savings of PHP 5000. Aside from selling a variety of goods, they also grow vegetables in their backyard. Victoriana wants to send all her children to college so that when they are older they can support their families well. 

Victoriana wishes to grow her store and needs capital to buy additional merchandise. She is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000. She will use the loan to improve her store and also to get a start in other businesses. The loan will truly help her family grow their business.

Kiva partner CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, to start and grow their own businesses. They give not only credit, but training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel F., a 35-year-old trader, is married and the father of three children. Two of the children are in school and his last born is still breastfeeding. Samuel is a very resourceful and hardworking father whose hard efforts bring livelihood to the family.

Samuel supports his children through the sale of used belts and socks. The selling of used belts and socks has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new socks, belts and even clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore the selling of used products like socks and belts has created a business for many men. He has been in this business for the past ten years. Samuel travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase his stock of goods.

Samuel wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used socks and belts to increase his inventory. He believes this loan would help him to save for his children’s future and also enable him to rent a store to trade in. He mostly sells through hawking, that is: house-to-house selling.

Samuel belongs to a village bank called “1st Kings” and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used socks and belts

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Zainab has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Hakika group loan (Group code 2029). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business from 8:00am to 10:00pm daily.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Zainab is 32 years old, married, and has three children: aged 12, 10 and 9.  She will be sharing this loan with a fellow group member. Mgeni, the other group member, has her own small business selling juice, charcoal and firewood in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood, to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Irma Haydee

texts.es: Irma Haydee R. L. de 29 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Turín en Ahuachapán. Ella posee una venta de tortillas y una venta de productos para el cabello y cuidado personal, la cual se la heredó su madre hace cuatro años. Actualmente ella está trabajando en San Salvador pero ha contratado a una persona la cual se encarga de realizar el trabajo en el negocio. Irma solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el dinero para comprar más maíz para sus tortillas y leña para cocinarlas, ella desea mejorar sus ganancias en el negocio, ya que este es un trabajo el cual le brinda una ayuda extra para poder solventar todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Irma Haydee R. L. is 29 years old and lives in the city of Turín in Ahuachapán, El Salvador. She owns a tortilla shop. She also sells hair care and personal care products, a business that she inherited from her mother four years ago. Currently she is working in San Salvador, but she has contracted someone who helps her with the other business. Irma is asking for a loan in order to purchase more corn for her tortillas and wood for cooking them. She hopes to increase her earnings from the business, since this is a job that gives her a little extra help to be able to manage her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is 20 years old and lives with his father and mother. He has been a farmer since he was young. Because he comes from a family of farmers, they taught him everything about the business. He mostly plants potatoes and onions. Throughout all these years of work, Abdurahmon has been able to succeed in his business. In the future Abdurahmon is planning to have a bigger stable. He will extend the fields he cultivates. Now he has asked for a loan of 2,000 TJS that he will spend on seeds and fertilizer. He promises to work responsibly and he sincerely thanks all lenders who have decided to support him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 37-year-old married man with 2 children. He has owned a car repair shop since 1992. After this long experience in the field, Fadi is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase merchandise for his shop to be able to satisfy the demand of the market and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere sells table water (a mixture of tap water and other ingredients such as saltwater or mineral water) and sachet water (bottled water). She has been in the business for past 6 years. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. Chinyere is hoping for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more table water and sachet water to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more table water and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Faapopo

texts.en:
Faapopo S., age 49, lives in the town of Matautu Lefaga Tai. She is married and has two grown children. To make a living, Faapopo raises cattle for sale. Faapopo has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 650 WST per month.

In 2008, Faapopo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Faapopo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals.

Faapopo is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 1,500 WST, which will be used to build shelter for her livestock. The loan will be the second loan she has taken out from SPBD. Faapopo plans to use the additional revenue she expects the loan to generate to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco H. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción de la escuela, comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares de su hija. Ya que para el es muy importante que su niña tenga los estudios necesario para salir a delante en la vida.
Don Francisco es una persona pensionada esté es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual, una parte será para pagar este préstamo.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son su esposa la señora María Antonia González y su hija.
texts.en:
Francisco H. has had a loan with FVP, which he paid back punctually. He is asking for a new loan to be able to pay for school enrollment fees, school uniforms, and school supplies for his daughter. It is very important to him that his daughter has the education that is necessary for his daughter to get ahead in life. Francisco receives a pension. This is the income he has for his family, and he will use part of it to pay for the loan. The people in the photo are his wife, María Antonio González, and their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for school enrollment fees, school uniforms, and school supplies

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan, es artesano, trabaja elaborando calzados en una pequeña microempresa, es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para poder solventar los gastos familiares.
Vive en la zona Alto Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada
El crédito será destinado para salud (tratamiento medico y análisis general, pues no se siente bien).
Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito podremos ayudarle para que pueda mejorarse de su salud ya que tiene problemas de hígado y con un  tratamiento estará mejor para poder trabajar, y apoyar en los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernan is an artisan. He works crafting footwear at a small microenterprise. This is the only source of income he has for defraying his family expenses. He lives in the Alto Llojeta area of the city of La Paz, where he rents a house. The loan is intended for healthcare (medical treatment, and a general evaluation, for he does not feel well).

This is the first time he requests a loan at Impro. With this loan we will be able to help him improve his health. He has liver problems and with a treatment he will get better and be able to work and take care of his family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of personal medical analysis and treatment.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia C. is a 61-year-old married woman from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She lives with her husband and their 3 children. Aside from rice farming, she also grows pigs for a living. Currently, she owns a 2-hectare rice field and 4 pigs. She has been a member of CEV for more than 2 years already. According to her, CEV has really helped her family especially her business. She said that apart from the low-interest financial service, she feels secured because of its insurance program. Ofelia is requesting for a loan of Php15, 000 to increase her working capital. This loan will truly be helpful in her business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Rogelio Ángeles vive con su esposa la señora Georgina y son padres de un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar. El labora para una empresa de transportes y la señora Georgina es promotora de créditos de una institución. Ellos como toda una familia unida y que buscan el buen futuro de su hijo están tramitando este crédito para realizar unos gastos educativos por motivo de la graduación. (El señor Rogelio se encontraba fuera de la ciudad por tal motivo se le tomo la fotografia a su esposa e hijo).
texts.en:
Rogelio Ángeles lives with his wife, Georgina, and their school aged son. He works for a transportation company. Georgina is a loan representative for an institution. They, like all united families, look for a good future for their son. They are asking for this loan for educational expenses for graduation. (Rogelio was outside of the city. That is why his wife and son are in the photograph.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education expenses for his son's graduation

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is a tailor, and he also sells tailoring material. He has been in this business for the past twelve years. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring material in order to increase his sales and to meet the demand of his customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring material

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn A. is from the village of Sto Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Jackielyn is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Jackielyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jackielyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jackielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jackielyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jackielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos. Estudio en el pedagógico (Instituto).
Nancy  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años; tiene una tienda de abarrotes, también se dedica a la crianza de vacas.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc.
Ella requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con los cuales comprará azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.
 Su visión hacia el futuro es, ejercer su profesión (profesora) y dejarle a su mamá su negocio.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que se realiza al interior del Banoc comunal, de esta manera sirve de reserva.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (The Breezes of Río Blanco), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province. She is 26 years old, married, and does not have children. Nancy earned a teaching degree at a local institute.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. Nancy manages a grocery store and also raises cows. She says her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy sugar, noodles, rice, etc.

Nancy is requesting a new loan in the amount of 500 soles to buy sugar, rice, noodles, etc. Her vision for the future is to allow her mother to manage her business so that she can pursue teaching. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the group savings account which enables her to set aside money as a reserve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anna Sugey

texts.es: Anna Sugey  vive en la zona  # 6 de Nueva Guinea, no se ha casado ni tiene hijos pero vive con sus padres a quienes ayuda con los gastos familiares, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccion de una habitacion ), trabaja como  conserje en la Financiera FAMA  desde hace 5 años,  esta joven se caracteriza por ser una joven honesta y muy trabajadora, y desde muy pequeña se ha esforzado para ayudar a su familia ya que son personas humildes de escasos recursos economicos, actualmente está estudiando  su tercer año en la Universidad URACCAN,  su sueño terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, terminar de estudiar  y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Anna Sugey lives in zone # 6 in New Guinea. She is not married, and she has no children. She lives with her parents, and she helps them with the family expenses. She is asking for her second loan to improve her house (build a room). She has worked as a counselor for the financial company FAMA for five years. This young woman is characterized as being honest and very hard-working. Since she was very small she has worked to help her family, humble people with scant economic resources. She is currently in her third year at the URACCAN University. Her dream is to finish building her house. That way she will enjoy better conditions, finish her studies, and have work stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is a 49-year-old is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has three children, the eldest of whom is only seven years old.  She started her business when she married her husband. Until now, she has been tilling her farm, hoping that she will be able to have an abundant harvest. When she started farming, she said that it was really difficult, especially because the farm needed capital to grow rice. She was happy that she joined CEVI and was able to get access to small loans.

Now she would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her crops.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Lucero” esta representado por la señora Cecilia y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales son  alegres y muy trabajadores como lo demuestran en sus puestos de venta de comida, cosméticos, ropa, empanadas, pan, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y asaditos en sus barrios. Pese al gran nivel competitivo ellas siempre tratan de salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y el bien estar de sus hijos. El destino del crédito es la ampliación de sus negocios con la adquisición de más mercadería para su venta  e insumos para los socios dedicados a la venta de comida, algunos de los miembros utilizaran el préstamo para la refacción de sus viviendas y tiendas. En cuanto a la experiencia los socios ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad de créditos individuales, por lo que no cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pero han demostrado ser gente muy activa y entusiasta en las reuniones preliminares por lo que la Fundación Agrocapital les da la oportunidad de un apoyo económico para que puedan mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank "Lucero" (Bright Star) is represented by Cecilia, and made up of 12 members who are happy and hard-working, as they show in their stands selling food, cosmetics, clothing, empanadas, bread; groceries in their neighborhood stores; and barbecue in their neighborhoods. In spite of the high level of competition, they always try to succeed since they are responsible for the support and well-being of their children.

The purpose of this loan is the expansion of their businesses with the purchase of more merchandise to sell and raw ingredients for the members who sell food. Some of the members will use the loan to repair their businesses or homes.

In regards to their experience with microloans, they have already worked with individual loans, but don't have experience with group loans. However, they have proven to be active and enthusiastic in their preliminary meetings, which is why Fundación Agrocapital is giving them the opportunity of this economic help so they can improve their incomes and the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Raykan's Group

texts.en:
T. Raykan is one of the women who can be a model for everyone. She lives in Balykchi, which is located at the seaside of our beautiful lake, Issyk–Kyl. In general, Balykchi is a town where you can find nothing. There is no satisfactory job or any chance to survive. The desire of every citizen is just to come to the capital of Kyrgyzstan and look for any job. As it was mentioned above, T. Raykan is self–confident because about 10 years ago, she decided that she could not waste her time loafing. She opened up a little business. Nowadays she has a small grocery shop. So her hardworking husband leased a minibus to take passengers, but a few years later he got a loan , bought a minibus and continues today.  Her profit from selling is about 3,000 soms ($65) and her husband’s is 15,000 ($340) soms. Their total revenue is 18,000 ($405) soms. So a few days later, they decided to get a loan to buy two small sheep to breed and then sell in the future. Their plan for future is to increase their livestock.

O. Nerkul is a 57-year-old woman who is divorced. She has a mother who is on a pension; she receives 3,000 ($65) soms from the government. Nerkul is a staff member in the company “IPAR”, which is a multilevel marketing company and earns money from selling probiotics. She had to run this business to improve her health and distribute information about this company. Now she has a leadership level position and opened an informational center in Balykchi. Her profit is about 10,000 or 15,000 soms. She wants to get a loan to increase turnover and to extend her own staff. Her aim is to achieve another fourth degree and to go away to international business.

Davletova G. is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a citizen of Balykchi. Her husband works as a chief administrator of social security in Balykchi. They have a daughter who is a student. G. works in the multilevel marketing company "IPAR”. Once she improved her health by taking the probiotics and having good results, she started to work for the company. She started with 5,500 soms. With the help of the probiotics, she has cured her grandsons’ burn, she was cured from high blood pressure and now she is on the way to getting her second degree. Her aim is to achieve high degrees and to extend her trade turnover and staff.

Suyundukova T. is 45 years old. She is married. Her husband works as an electrician in telecasting. His salary is 15,000. She works in the multilevel marketing company “IPAR”. Her profit is about 1,500 soms per month. Her health was improved by probiotics and after getting good results, she started her business in “IPAR”. She started with 2,000 soms. By getting a loan, she wants to increase her trade turnover. Their plan for future is to buy livestock.  

Tazabekova R. is a 57-year-old woman. She improved her health by using the probiotics and after getting good results, she started to work for the company. She has a leadership level position. Her profit is 10,000 soms per month. However, she began her business with 5,500 soms. By getting a loan, she wants to increase her trade turnover and her staff. Her main aim is to buy a flat in Bishkek.

Akmatova A. works in the multilevel marketing company “IPAR”. She is 55 years old. She is a widow who has a daughter who is 20 years old. She improved her health by using the probiotics and after getting good results, she started to work distributing information about this company. She earns each month about 2,000 soms; she started her business with 5,500 soms. By getting a loan, she wants to increase her trade turnover and her staff. Her main aim is to buy a flat in Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two small sheep for breeding and selling

loans.name: Monisola

texts.en: Monisola is 51 years old and married with three children. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. Her husband is a teacher and he also supports the home. She sells books at retail prices to her customers. She hopes that her bookstore will grower bigger in the future. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more books to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Mrs. Loh K. is a village woman who lives with other family members. She lives in the west of Cambodia, about 12 km from Phnom Penh, the capital. To earn a living, she sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier or from fishermen. She is married, and blessed with six children. One is married and living away from home, and the other five are single. Both of her daughters work as employees in the garment industry. 

Also, Loh K. relies on extra cash that is earned by her husband, who drives a motorcycle taxi. Loh K. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to improve her fish sales; any remaining money from the loan will decorate her old house.

loans.use: To improve her fish sales

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S. is a villager in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. She was born in 1975. She and her husband, Mr. Nhor Ruos, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Through this activity, they try to work hard and earn a little money to support their four children. One of the children does farming with the parents and the others are attending the local public school. For this reason, they want to open a new business. Mrs. Touch S. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy a store and fruit for selling fruit. She hopes that she is going to earn a big income.

loans.use: To buy a store and fruit

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie S. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Nelsie is married and has four school-aged children. Nelsie owns and operates a business making & selling specialty food products in the local community. Nelsie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Nelsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Nelsie is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: raw ingredients for making food products

loans.name: Leema Group

texts.en:
Mahtab Gul is a member of Leema group. She lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. 

She is married with four children. They are students at school. She is a tailor and has been involved in this business for more than eight years. She is quite experienced in her business and has lots of clients as well.

She needs the loan to buy a new machine because her old one was damaged and it doesn’t work well after the repairs.

She would like to thank Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for her business

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: D. Joséphine est née en 1968 et vit depuis quinze ans environs au quartier Enagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Joséphine est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Joséphine vit avec sa famille à Enagnon. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Joséphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Joséphine prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot, etc.) dans son quartier. Joséphine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Joséphine a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Joséphine sollicite un quatrième prêt, afin de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le volume de sa production journalière.
texts.en:
D. Joséphine was born in 1968 and has been living for fifteen years in the Enagnon district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, who have all attended school. She lives with her family in Enagnon. The couple share in covering their various family expenses. Joséphine never attended school. To provide for herself and her children, she makes food and sells it (rice, beans, etc.) in her district. Joséphine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already benefited from three loans with ALIDé that have all been repaid. Facing the more and more numerous demands of her customers, Joséphine is requesting a fourth loan in order to bolster her business and to increase her daily production volume.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, beans, and condiments for sauce

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaquelin, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa de su madre. Años atrás se inició en la venta de útiles escolares, pero no tuvo mucha acogida, de ahí recurrió en otro negocio, que es la venta de ropas usadas, pero su mayor inclinación fue la venta de muñecos de peluches, ya que son muy pocos los que vende este producto. Ahora los vende con mucha facilidad, ya que sus compradores fijos son aquellos que quieren obtener algún articulo para regalo, de esa manera logra obtener buenas rentas. Su esposo, en un inicio no tenia mucha fe de su trabajo, pero ahora, al verla contenta a Jaquelin, le apoya en sus compras. Lleva  5 años en este negocio y lo más difícil ha sido ganarse un espacio en el mercado, siendo informal hasta hoy en día. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y sabe que le será muy útil, ya que así aumentará su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete así mismo y a sus compañeros en pagar las cuotas pendientes. Con este crédito, piensa invertirlo en la compra de más muñecos de peluches, por otro lado, desea ayudar a su esposo en comprarle una llanta para su motocarro.
texts.en:
Jaquelin is a hard-working mother who lives with her husband and three children in her mother's home. Years ago she began to sell school supplies, but did not have much success, so she turned to another business: the sale of used clothes. However, her greatest inclination was to sell stuffed animals, since very few people sell this product. She now makes a good income, successfully selling them to customers who buy them as gifts. Her husband did not initially have much faith in her work, but now that he sees how happy she is, he supports her purchases. She has been in this business for 5 years, and the most difficult aspect has been gaining a space in the market, as it has been informal up until now. This is her twelfth loan with MFP and she knows it will be very useful. It will increase her working capital. She promises that she will repay the instalments on time. She intends to invest this loan in the purchase of more stuffed animals, and on the other hand she wants to help her husband buy a tire for his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on stuffed animals

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara, de 30 años vive con su esposo Juan y sus 4 hijos, en la vivienda de sus suegros, ubicado en la ciudad de Tarma, ya que sus hijos tienen mayores oportunidades académicas. Su habilidad hace que cada cosecha, se comercialice de manera rápida y a buen precio, pues Clara, es una de las mejores productoras de papa, por eso los mayoristas ya la conocen y le compran los tubérculos en el mercado de su ciudad. La  calidad de sus frutos es incomparable y esto gracias a los 13 años de experiencia, tiempo que le ha dedicado a la agricultura. Su esposo, quien la ayuda en el trabajo, procuran sembrar papa y de la variedad yungay, única y de diferentes colores, pues cada color tiene otro sabor. Lo que más le gusta es ofrecer su producto al mercado central de Tarma  y a la ciudad de La Merced. Clara se considera una mujer de negocios, es por eso que planea tener una tienda de comestibles en su casa propia, que pronto construirá y de esa manera logrará obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y reafirma que le gusta laborar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, porque son personas unidas y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fertilizantes, que le ayudará a obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Clara is 30 years old and lives with her husband Juan and their four children in the home of her in-laws located in the city of Tarma, which allows her children to have more academic opportunities. Clara’s job is to produce her crops as quickly and cheaply as possible. She is considered to be one of the best potato producers since she is already known among the wholesalers who buy her tubers at the city market. The quality of her produce is incomparable thanks to her 13 years of experience in agriculture. Her husband, who helps with the work, grows the Yungay variety of potato which is unique because it comes in different colors and each color has a different flavor. What she enjoys most about her job is selling her products at the central market in Tarma and in the city of La Merced. Clara considers herself to be a businesswoman, so she plans to build and open a grocery store in her home so that she can achieve a better quality of life.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She reaffirms her joy of working with the other members of her Communal Bank because they are close-knit and responsible people. With the loan she requested, Clara will buy fertilizers to help her achieve good production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Kei

texts.en: Mrs. Kei U. is 28 years old, married, and lives in Daeum Rumdael village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Met Morn, are farmers who own 1.30 hectares of land and a plowing machine to support their farming. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Kei U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. gasoline, pesticide and to pay for rental of a water machine. Aside from farming, Mr. Met Morn is also a plowing machine driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has two children who are too young to study or work. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: purchasing gasoline and pesticide; renting an irrigation machine

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en:
Fazilat has applied for a loan to financially help her son who has a business selling spare parts. 

She lives in a three-room brick house in Riwind, which is a small city near Lahore. She works part time as a seamstress and stitches clothes for her neighborhood clients.

Her husband is a wagon driver and her other two sons are also drivers. Their sons couldn’t study further after their matriculation due to financial reasons and had to work to support their family.

This is the fourth time that Fazilat has applied for a loan from Asasah. She has maintained good credit behavior with Asasah and didn't delay with repayments. Earlier she received a loan for starting of her son’s business and now she wants to help him expand his business.

She is fifty-four years of age and a housewife and at this older age she wants to see her son married in her lifetime. She will save money for her son from the profit.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for reselling

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario E. is from the town of Banga. He is 55 years old and married with 4 grown children. To make a living, Macario grows rice for sale. Macario has been engaged in his business for over 30 years.  Macario joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Macario has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and now requests his fourth loan, for 12000 PHP, to purchase additional seed and fertlizer.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seed and fertlizer.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramón reside en cantón santa clara san Rafael oriente departamento de san miguel, es casado vive con su esposa y tres hijos entre las edades de 22 26 28 años todos trabajan en la agricultura y ganadería de la cual dependen económicamente.
Se dedica al negocio desde su niñez ya que su padre trabaja en el campo no tiene un horario de trabajo especifico ya que es variado.
El crédito lo invertirá en compra de concentrado y insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento del ganado y de esta forma el ganado de mas leche y sea más la producción que obtengan.
Esto le ayudara a contar con los recursos necesarios para la alimentación del ganado y que la productividad sea buena para obtener buenos ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones es convertirse en un ganadero de mayoreo y así tener una mejor condición de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Ramón lives in the Santa Clara canton, San Rafael Oriente municipality, San Miguel department. He is married, and he lives with his wife and their three children. The children are 22, 26, and 28 years old. All of them work in farming and with livestock, which they are economically dependent upon. He has been devoted to this business since his childhood. His father worked in the fields. He does not have a specific work schedule because it varies. He will use the loan to buy concentrated feed and farming supplies in order to provide the livestock with proper care. That way they will give more milk and their production will increase. This will help him have the necessary resources to feed the livestock. The production will be good, and he will get good income. His aspiration is to convert into being a wholesale livestock farmer. That way he will have better living conditions for himself and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy concentrated feed and farming supplies

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carmen Elizene

texts.es:
01-002626-118089 Carmen Elizene T. G. $ 300.00
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen;  La socia tiene 30 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia  trabaja vendiendo leche, ella  necesita el préstamo para comprar leche al por mayor y poder venderla, ella va muy temprano por la mañana a vender de casa en casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de leche al por mayor. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen Elizene T. G. belongs to Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian Community Bank. This bank is locaqted in the district of Huanchac in the department of Cusco. She is 30 years old; she lives with a partner and has a son. She works selling milk; she needs the loan to purchase milk wholesale and to sell it. She leaves the house very early in the morning and sells door-to-door. Our partner is applying for this loan to buy wholesale milk. She is very thankful and greatly values the loan offered through this medium, and she pledges to fulfill her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale millk

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie D. is from the village of Burgos. She is 43 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Rosemarie owns and operates a business running a food stall, tending a canteen in the school. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
