Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Teresita is married and has 7 children. Her eldest is 29 years old and the youngest is 12. To make a living, Teresita raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Teresita also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She helps keep it free of weeds and pests.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase livestock feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & farm supplies.

loans.name: Afi Holali

texts.fr: Afi  est une femme de 30 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de sachets en plastique, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2004. Ce commerce marche bien pour elle et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Actuellement  son stock a considérablement baissé et elle a besoin de s’approvisionner pour satisfaire à bien sa clientèle. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 40 balles  de sachets. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
Afi  is 30 years old, and earns income by selling plastic bags.  She began this work in 2004 and it is going well for her.  Her clientèle is made up of all different types of people. 

At the moment her stock has gone down and she needs to get more supplies in order to meet her customers' needs. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 40 bales of bags.

She is married and the mother of one child.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra lives in Gujranwala which is famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeats. Gujranwala is a big city with a high cost of living. So it is very difficult for Bushra and her husband to afford the living expenses for themselves and their six daughters. That’s why they couldn’t educate their daughters and they have remained illiterate. 

Bushra operates a clothes-sewing  business at her home. She mainly works for her neighborhood clients in order to supplement the income of her family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and he also has a business selling fruit. They work very hard to put three meals a day on the table for the family. They all live in a 2-room brick house in the area called Naseem colony where they moved 10 years ago. 
 
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit-selling business. He will invest the loan in purchasing seasonal fruit from the fruit markets in bulk. The bulk purchasing will allow him to meet the demand of his customers and increase his sales. Bushra is very confident that her husband’s seven years of experience will give him the right direction and the loan investment will help him for financial growth. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client who paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit in bulk

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Daphine has been selling soft drinks since two years now.         

To help expand her business, Daphine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more soft drinks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Daphine hopes to generate more profits and buy food.  In the future, Daphine hopes to own a retail shop. Daphine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her future prospects by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo D. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. He is 56 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Rodrigo owns & operates a general store where he sells a variety of products. He has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rodrigo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product range. This will be his 1st loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product range

loans.name: El Sueño Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama El Sueño se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. Está conformado por 6 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son:
1.	Araceli E. C. va a comprar con su préstamo faldas y blusas para surtir su negocio
2.	Lulú Rodríguez Gutiérrez va a comprar todo tipo de ropa de mujer pantalones, blusas para surtir su negocio
3.	Mitzi Yuridia B. Rodríguez va a comprar perfumes americanos para vender
4.	Virginia C. B. va a comprar  de mayoreo zapatos para dama y caballero para surtir su negocio
5.	Yeimi García V. va a comprar aceite, azúcar, huevo, leche, frijol, arroz, etc., también va a comprar diademas, donas, espejos, bolitas, ligas para surtir su tienda
6.	Martha Lilibeth C. E. va a comprar artículos de topperware para surtir sus primeros pedidos. 
La señora Lulú Rodríguez Gutiérrez tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de preparatoria obtuvo su certificado, ella es casada, tiene 3 hijos: Lenis de 15 años de edad estudia el bachillerato, Jordy tiene 17 años y trabaja, Mitzy tiene 18 años de edad está estudiando la universidad para maestra de educación física.
La señora Lulú tiene su negocio de venta de ropa para dama y solicito su préstamo para comprar ropa para dama va a comprar blusas, pantalones y con las ganancias quiere invertirlas en su casa quiere hacer otro cuarto, porque tiene pocas habitaciones.
Los productos que ofrece a sus clientas son blusas y pantalones para dama, ella inicio con el negocio hace 4 años su mamá le enseño lo de las ventas, pues su mamá siempre ha vendido, su mamá vendía Fuller, ToperWare, ropa, accesorios para regalo y Lulú le ayudaba en el negocio y así aprendió el negocio de las ventas.
Su esposo le dio dinero y fue comprando mercancía de poquito en poquito, su negocio es ambulante va ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa sale a vender a Jaloxtoc, a Tlayecac, ella utiliza el transporte colectivo para ir a vender sus productos, sus clientas son las muchachas, este negocio es importante y especial por que saca ganancias y obtiene ingresos para mejorar económicamente, la parte favorita de trabajar en este negocio es cuando sale a vender y anda fueras conoce a más personas y le da gran orgullo vender su mercancía, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el tiempo, pues no tiene mucho tiempo únicamente sale a vender en las tardes y los fines de semana, su negocio tiene mucha competencia hay mucha gente que veden en las casas tienen sus negocios ambulantes, las ganancias las va guardando para volver a invertir y para pagar el préstamo, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio va a comprar más ropa pantalones de mezclilla para tener mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientas y está muy contenta con este préstamo que le proporcionan por que le dan la oportunidad de prestarles el dinero y surtir su negocio; además de que quiere mejorar su casa como ya lo mencionamos.
En Tlayecac celebran el 25 de Abril el día de San Marcos Tlayecac, hay misas, feria, baile, brinco de chínelos, también hay un cerro que está muy bonito se ve muy cerquita, siembran sorgo. Este negocio le ha ayudado para los pasajes de sus hijos y para ayudar en la casa saliendo adelante con los gastos, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda quiere hacer un cuarto porque le hace falta, sus planes son seguir vendiendo, las mejoras que desea lograr para el futuro de sus hijos son seguir trabajando para que ellos puedan seguir adelante con sus estudios y este préstamo le va a ayudan invirtiendo en ropa. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por pensar en nosotros por facilitarnos los créditos a personas que lo necesitamos”.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Sueño” (the Dream) and is located in the community of Tlayecac, Ciudad Ayala in Morelos state, México.  It has six female members who know each other and are neighbors.  They are:

1. Araceli E. C. who will use the loan to buy skirts and blouses to stock her business

2. Lulú Rodríguez Gutiérrez who is going to buy all kinds of women’s cloths, pants and blouses, to stock her business

3. Mitzi Yuridia B. Rodríguez who is going to buy American perfumes to sell

4. Virginia C. B. who is going to buy ladies’ and men’s shoes at wholesale to stock her business

5. Yeimi García V. who is going to buy oil, sugar, eggs, milk, beans, rice, etc.  She will also buy diadems, hair rings, mirrors, little balls and rubber bands to stock her store

6. Martha Lilibeth C. E. who is going to buy Tupperware items to fill her first orders 

Mrs. Lulú Rodríguez Gutiérrez, 37, finished high school and got her diploma.  She’s married and has three children: Lenis, 15, who is in high school, Jordy, 17, who is working, Mitzy, 18, who is in the university studying to become a P.E. Teacher.

Lulú’s business is selling women’s clothing.  She requested her loan to buy women’s clothing.  She is going to buy blouses and pants and wants to use her profits to build an additional bedroom on her house because she does not have enough bedrooms.

The products she sells to her customers are ladies' pants and blouses.  She started the business four years ago.  Her mother taught her sales because her mother has always been a saleswoman.  She used to sell Fuller, Tupperware, clothes, and gift items.  Lulú would help her in the business and that’s how she learned the business of sales.

Her husband gave her money and she started to buy merchandise bit by bit.  Her business operates door to door in Jaloxtoc and Tlayecac.  She uses collective public transport to go sell her wares.  Her customers are young women.  The business is important and special because she makes profits and earns income to improve economically.

Her favorite part of working in this business is that when she goes out to sell and is outdoors she meets many people and she feels very proud to sell her merchandise.  The challenge she faces in her business is lack of time because she doesn’t have a lot of time to sell.  She can only go out to sell in the afternoons and on weekends.  Her business has a lot of competition.  There are a lot of door to door salespeople and street vendors.

She saves her profits to reinvest and to repay the loan.  She is planning to enlarge her business buying more denim pants to have merchandise available for her customers.  She is very happy with the loan she will get because she’s given the opportunity to borrow money to stock her business.  Besides, as we mentioned before, she wants to make some home improvements.

In Tlayecac, April 25 is San Marcos Tlayecac Day.  Masses are celebrated, there’s a fair, dancing, Brinco de Chinelos (traditional indigenous dance from the state of Morelos).  There’s also a very pretty hill that seems close by.  They grow sorghum.

This business has helped her cover the children’s transportation costs and to help with household expenses.  It will also help to make the home improvements; she wants to add a bedroom she needs.

Her plan is to continue selling, to make the improvements she wants for her children’s future, to continue working so that they can continue with their studies and this loan will help her invest in clothes.

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “We thank you for thinking of us and facilitating the loans to people like us who need them.”

loans.use: To buy women's pants and blouses.

loans.name: Ángel Ramiro

texts.es:
Ángel Ramiro P. P. tiene 59 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con el hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 9 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del Patrono San Miguel celebrar con amigos y familiares de la comunidad y legusta jugar fútbol y tocar la guitarra.
texts.en: Ángel Ramiro P. P. is 59. He lives with his wife and children in the San Miguel canton in the Bolivar province. He has 9 children. The members of the V.R.C. SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel Office in the canton of San Miguel. The people of this area work in agriculture for their main source of familial income, sowing corn and small quantities of potatoes and beans. Angel works in agriculture, sowing corn and potatoes. He purchases his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in the San Miguel fair on Thursdays. He is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural items and to pay the day labourers. This loan will help him to supply his necessities. They have to deal with challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to purchase lands. He likes to celebrate the festival of the Patron San Miguel with his friends and acquaintances in the community. He enjoys playing soccer and playing the guitar.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural items and pay the day workers

loans.name: Kulpari's Group

texts.en:
Kulpari S., 53, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near to Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). Unfortunately, she is a widow.  She has raised four daughters and two sons. Most of the children are married and employed, and the youngest son studies at school. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms,  Kulpari started to provide sewing services. She sews Kyrgyz national cloth, pillows and blankets. In this way, she earns 12000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase cattle for breeding. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a calf in order to increase her cattle stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated his restaurant business for the past five years. His potential customers are his neighbors and passersby. Victor faces a major challenge of the high cost of municipal council fees. He hopes to expand and have a big hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase furniture for his restaurant to accomondate his customers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for his restaurant to accomondate his customers.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Donald  ,de 31 años de edad,soltero, nacido en la ciudad de Esteli.Con 4 años de experiencia en venta de accesorios de celulares , inicio con 300 dolares por cuenta propia sin el apoyo de nadie.En busca de una vida mejor fue a trabajar a una zona franca en la capital Managua,pero no tuvo suerte y no logro progresar economicamente como el esperaba, tomo la decision de trabajar en un negocio propio e inicio con la venta de celulares antes de iniciar  este negocio se dedicaba a la venta de discos , pero vio que era mejor la venta de accesorios celulares ya que ademas conocia muy bien a los proveedores en el mercado oriental en la ciudad de Managua.
Solicita el prestamo para invertirlo para capital de trabajo ya que por medio de ello podra comprar mas accesorios y lentes , variar su mercaderia asi ofrecer mejores productos e incrementar sus ganancia.
Dentro de sus planes fututos esta instalar un local en la calle central donde puede tenerlo lleno de sus productos y asi atraer mas clientes y poderse mantenerse asi mismo con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Donald J. is 31 years old, single, and was born in the city of Esteli.  He has four years of experience selling mobile phone accessories.  Donald started with 300 dollars of his own money and without the support of anyone else.  In search of a better life, he began working in the free trade zone in the capital of Managua.  He did not have any luck and was not able to achieve the financial progress that he had hoped.  Donald then made the decision to work in his own business.  Prior to selling mobile phones, he started his business by selling records.  However, he discovered that selling mobile phone accessories would be better since he already had good relationships with the distributors at the eastern market in the city of Managua.  

Donald is requesting a loan to be used as operating capital so that he can buy more accessories and lenses.  By varying his merchandise, he will be able to offer better products and increase his earnings.  His future plans include establishing a shop along the central street and stocking it with his products so that he can attract more customers, support himself, and obtain better living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase mobile phone accessories & lenses

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok N., 45, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She sells roast beef and dessert in the local market and is able to make a profit of about US $5 every day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. On average, he is able to earn US $4 per day. This couple has seven children; four are in school and two are employed. Sok N. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to finish her construction.

loans.use: to finish construction

loans.name: María Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La Señora. María A. es socia del banco comunal Tres de Noviembre, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre que pertenece a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Doña María tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijo de 28, 25, 24, 22, 15, 13, 11 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, sus tres hijos siguientes trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, sus hijos de 15 y 13 años  estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuela de la parroquia. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país a migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a hornear chanchos actividad que la realiza hace 28 años, 4 veces a la semana. También cría vacas, gallinas y cuyes lo que vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 8 años tiempo en el que ha hecho muy buenas amistades y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.  Su meta es ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
María A. is a member of the 'Tres de Noviembre' community bank.  She lives in the community of the same name which is located in Cumbe parish.  This parish has a cold climate, beautiful landscapes, and its people work in commerce, farming, and livestock raising.  Many have migrated in search of better jobs.

María is 48 years old, married, and has 7 children aged 28, 25, 24, 22, 15, 13 and 11.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Her next three children work and help with the household expenses.  Her 15 and 13 year-old children are studying in high school and her youngest daughter studies at a local elementary school.  Her husband does not live in the country.  He migrated in search of better opportunities.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

María's business is roasting pigs which she does four times a week.  She has been in this business for 28 years.  She also raises cows, hens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community.

María has been a member of her community bank for 8 years.  Over the years she has made some very good friendships and the loans she has received have helped her in her business.  She will invest her new loan in buying livestock.  Her goal is to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rielma Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Rielma se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por las amas de casa por la venta variada de productos de primera necesidad, su puesto este bastante surtido.  La cliente es soltera y solo tiene una hija con la cual vive, ella vive en casa familiar donde se encuentra viviendo por 15 años.  Es una mujer que quiere superarse para poderle así dar a su hija una mejor condición de vida.  La cliente se encuentra trabajando con emprender desde el año 2004 donde comenzó con banca comunal desde entonces ha mostrado buen comportamiento de pago, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Rielma's business is selling vegetables in a market that is very popular with housewives.  She sells a variety of essential products and her stall is quite well stocked.  Rielma is single and only has one daughter with whom she lives .  Rielma lives in her family home where she has lived for 15 years.  She is a woman who would like to improve her situation so that she can provide her daughter with better living conditions.  Rielma has been working with Emprender since 2004 when she joined her community bank.  Since then, she has always shown good repayment behavior.  She is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to pay for the extension of an "anticretico" rental contract

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 55 años de edad y es casada con 3 hijos adultos. Vive en casa  propia en la entrada al distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan en este caserío son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña. La zona cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua. Tiene un alcantarillado en proyecto.

Desde hace más de 8 años, Mercedes cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su negocio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Su bodega cuenta con clientela ya establecida siendo una de las pocas de la zona. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la  confección y venta de artesanía en variedad, por lo que es bastante conocida en el sector. Desea invertir su crédito en su bodega con la compra de útiles escolares, lo que la permitirá responder a la demanda para estos productos ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Mercedes es muy trabajadora. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 55, is married and has three adult children.  She lives in her own house at the entrance to Monsefú District, an area known for its tourist and religious festivities.  The main activities that take place in this settlement are:  flower growing, crafts and cattle raising.  The area is rich in vegetation and the community is very small.  The area has basic utilities like electricity and running water and has a drainage system in the planning stages.

For over 8 years Mercedes has had a small grocery store.  She sells her customers and neighbors various daily use products of first need and groceries.  The business is well received due to the good quality of the products she stocks and the good customer service she provides.  Her store has a well established customer base since it’s one of the few in the area.  In addition, she also makes various crafts to sell so she is quite well known in the area.

She wants to use the loan to buy school supplies to stock in her store which will allow her to respond to demand because the new school term has begun in Peru. 

Mercedes is very hard working.  She has good personal and work-related references.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Reinaldo Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinaldo C. tiene 41 años de edad, está casado hace varios años, tiene hijos y todos están en edad escolar aún.
Actualmente posee una gomería y anexo un taller de motocicletas y todo tipo de biciclos, este negocio cuenta con 5 años de antigüedad. 
Se inició con un pequeño capital propio, y con la ayuda de su cónyuge de a poco fue ampliando su gomería y ya más tarde, gracias al esfuerzo pasó a brindar un servicio de asistencia a motociclistas y todo tipo de biciclos, la experiencia lo adquirió trabajando varios años como chofer de grúa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos, cubiertas y herramientas manuales.
texts.en:
Reinaldo C. is 41 years old, married, and has children that are all still in school.  Currently, he has a tire shop and an annex with a motorcycle and bicycle repair shop.  He’s had the business for 5 years.

He started with a small amount of his own capital and, with his wife’s help, he expanded his tire shop little by little.  Later, thanks to his efforts, he was able to start a service helping motorcycle and bike riders with repairs.  He got the experience by working several years as a crane operator.

He requests this loan to buy replacement parts, covers, and tools.

loans.use: buy replacement parts, covers, and tools.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. cooks and sells red-red, a popular Ghanaian dish made from cowpeas cooked in red palm oil and red pepper, in Besease Village, which is near Elmina. 

Having been in this business for three years, Efua wants to expand it further by preparing larger quantities of red-red for sale. 

With her loan from Kiva, she plans to purchase more beans and other ingredients. She plans to reinvest any additional profits she earns back into her business for further growth.
 
Efua is married and has three children. Her income helps pay for their school fees and the household utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending. 

Rosalie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari(variety) store.  She has successfully repaid 1 previous loan from NWTF before this loan.   Rosalie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: stock groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Saint Christophe Group

texts.fr:
ce groupement  a été créé le 14 mai 2010.il est composé de 23 membres issus de la même commune. Leur activité principale est le commerce de l’arachide.

La femme qui est en position debout avec le bras élevé est responsable du groupement, elle est âgée de 38 ans et n'a aucun enfant en charge.

Sa principale activité est la transformation de l'arachide en pâte.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des arachides pour les transformer en pâte en vue de les revendre.

Son objectif est de disposer d'une bonne épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 14, 2010. It is composed of 23 members who all come from the same township. Their primary activity is buying and selling peanuts. 

The woman standing and raising her hand is the leader of the group. She is 38 and is not raising any children. Her main business is making peanuts into peanut butter. Her loan will allow her to buy peanuts to make into peanut butter and then sell. 

Her goal is to put aside a lot in savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts to use to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Cheril

texts.es: Cheril, de 28 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Luis de 11 y Cesar de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de comida de Cheril es uno de los más concurridos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos paltillos que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que visitan su puesto de comida, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola y no se da abasto.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de comida y así tener más clientes. Es será su quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas sillas y mesas, para adecuar mejor su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Cheril, age 28, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her two beloved children, ll year old Luis and 2 year old Cesar.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

Cheril’s food stand is one of the busiest in the city of Pucallpa.  Every day her customers come together at her stand to enjoy the delicious dishes she prepares.  She is a very good cook because her love for cooking was born when she was very young.  Now, she is very happy doing this work.  What she likes the most about her work is cooking, which she does with great care.  She has been doing this for two years.

The most difficult part is taking care of all of the people who go to her stand.  Many times she has to work alone, and she cannot keep up with the demand.  As the months pass by she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her food stand and get more customers.  

This will be her fifth loan with MFP.  Thus, she hopes to have the support of each one of you in order to expand her business.  She is a very participatory member of her communal bank.

She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy chairs and tables to better adapt her food stand.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Rocio De Jesus

texts.es:
Roció de 47 años vive ene le municipio de Soledad con su esposo y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 29 años. Desde las Gaviotas, el barrio donde habita se dedica a la venta de refrescos y bebidas, negocio con el cual logra apoyar el sustento de su hogar. 
Roció trabajaba anteriormente como jefe en una lavandería y por enfermedad debió abandonar su empleo por insistencia de su esposo y de sus hijos. Posteriormente cuando estuvo recuperada decidió emprender su propia aventura vendiendo cervezas, inicialmente una sola canasta, y gradualmente  agregó algo de música y aumentó el volumen de ventas. Así mismo decidió vender productos de belleza, vitaminas, accesorios, mediante  guías especializadas, a varias empresas empezando con los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo, amigas, vecinos referidos y poco a poco ha ido   creciendo en ambos negocios pues aprovecha toda oportunidad de venta de manera simultánea.  En la actualidad requiere aumentar su capital de trabajo para compra cajas de cervezas en mayor volumen, productos de nutrición y reparaciones al piso del exterior de su negocio; todo esto preparándose para la segunda temporada del año, época en la cual repuntan sus ventas desde Junio con las nivelación en los ingresos y gastos, por efecto causados por las primas y bonificaciones que reciben los empleados durante este mes. Su meta más adelante,  es tener un punto de encuentro sano y divertido estilo campestre, donde las familias se reúnan para integrarse y pasarla rico comiendo, bebiendo y bailando.
texts.en:
Rocio is 47 years old and he lives in the municipality of Soledad with her husband. They have two children, aged 22 and 29. In her community of Gaviotas she sells soft drinks and alcoholic drinks. It is a business through which she is able to support her household.

Rocio worked previously as the manager of a laundry shop but for health reasons she left her employment. Her husband and children insisted. Later, when she had recovered, she decided to start out her own adventure, selling beer. She started out with only one case but later she added some music and her sales volume increased. She also started to sell beauty products, vitamins, accessories through specialized catalogues. She sold to various companies, her husband's work colleagues, friends, neighbors, and to references. Gradually she has increased both businesses, taking advantage of every opportunity for simultaneous sales. She wants to increase her working capital to purchase cases of beer in greater quantities, nutrition products, and to carry out repairs to the flooring outside of her business. All of this is done in preparation for the second season of the year. This time of year sales rebound, starting in June when earnings and expenses are leveled. This occurs because during this month employees receive their bonuses and benefits. Her goal for the future is to have a healthy and fun country life where all the families come together and spend comfortable times eating, drinking, and dancing.

loans.use: to purchase beer in greater quantities, nutritional supplements, and to repair the flooring in her business.

loans.name: Kwimage Group

texts.en: Mwanaisha, who is in her early 20s, is single. She has been running a food sales business for one year now. She works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy 25 kilos of wheat flour, 25 kilos of baking flour, 25 kilos of rice, a small bucket of cooking oil and charcoal. Her dream is to be able to buy furniture for the room she is about to rent. She will share this loan with her loan group Kwimage which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy 25 kilos of wheat flour, 25 kilos of baking flour, 25 kilos of rice, a small bucket of cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Mrs. Si and her husband support their family of five through their crop planting business.  They plant rice and some vegetables together. Together, they earn about $6 per day. They would like a loan to expand their farming business.

loans.use: to expand their crop planting business

loans.name: María Roberta

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles y arquitectura, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 65 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 14 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, 12 de sus hijos son casados e independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo es comerciante y la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María es comerciante de frutas actividad que la desempeña hace muchos años, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hija, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para su negocio. 

Su meta es conservar y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “San Pablo”. She lives in the central part of the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful streets and architecture. The city offers a wide variety of cuisines and its people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Sra. María is 65 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 14 grown children. Twelve of them are married and independent. The other two are single, working, and helping her financially. Her husband is a merchant and they own the home in which they reside.

Doña María is a fruit merchant and has been in this line of work for many years. She works all day Monday through Friday.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank. She was invited to join by her daughter. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of fruits for her business. María’s goal is to preserve and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Belisario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Belisario tiene 56 años de edad,  el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja como taxista, el socio tiene su unidad vehicular, el socio presta servicio de taxi  en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de repuestos y mantenimiento de su automóvil.

 El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Belisario is a member of the communal bank "Siempre Unidos" located in the Huanchac district in the Virgen Asunta market and the province and department of Cusco.  

He is 56 years old, married and has two children.  He works as a taxi driver in the city of Cusco and has his own vehicle.  He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts and maintain his automobile.   

He is grateful for the support given and is committed to making his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: purchase spare parts and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Herminia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Herminia tiene 44 años es casada y tiene 6 hijos los cuales tienen 25, 23, 22, 18, 17, 16 años de edad; vive con su familia en Pelileo que está cerca de Ambato. Herminia se considera una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.

Trabaja con un vecino en la confección de pantalones jeans en máquinas industriales. Trabaja con FODEMI ya por 2 años consecutivos, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de una máquina de coser de doble aguja, lo que ayudaría al incremento de su producción y al armado de los pantalones.

Su sueño es ver crecer a su negocio economicamente para poder dar a sus hijos el estudio.
texts.en:
Herminia is 44 years old. She is married and has six children who are 25, 23, 22, 18, 17 and 16 years old. She lives with her family in Pelileo, which is near Ambato. Herminia considers herself to be a responsible and very hardworking person.
She works with a neighbor sewing denim trousers on industrial sewing machines. She has worked with FODEMI for two consecutive years. The loan she requests is to purchase a double needle lockstitch sewing machine, which would help her increase her production and tailor the trousers.
Her dream is to see her business grow so she can give her children an education.

loans.use: to purchase a double needle lockstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita, de 39 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, es madre soltera de un hijo que ya es mayor y vive solo, ella tiene su casa propia donde vive sola e intenta realizar la mayor cantidad de actividades posibles para que pueda estar ocupada. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida en la vereda de su casa, ella se levanta desde muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar todos los productos necesarios y empezar a preparar los deliciosos potajes que muchos de sus clientes le solicitan. Tiene 8 años trabajando y considera que le gusta relacionarse con la gente, y más si eso le conlleva ganancias. Por ahora le esta yendo bien en su trabajo, ya que sus ingresos diarios no bajan del 50 % de ganancia de acuerdo a su inversión, además tiene clientes todo el tiempo, por ello espera mantenerse en ese mismo ritmo de trabajo.Este será el quinto crédito con MFP, y por tanto desea que ustedes la apoyen para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingredientes y materiales para la elaboración de sus deliciosos platos.
texts.en:
39-year-old Lita is a cheerful and entrepreneurial woman.  She is a single mother and has one son who is grown up and lives alone.  Lita owns her own home.  She lives alone and tries to carry out as many activities as possible in order to keep busy. 

Lita sells meals on the sidewalk outside her home.  She gets up very early in the morning to go to the market and buy all the products she needs to start preparing the delicious stews that many of her customers ask for.  She has been working for 8 years and she says that she enjoys interacting with people, even more so if it makes her profits.  For now, she is doing well in her work as her daily income doesn't fall below 50% profits in relation to her investment.  In addition, she always has customers.  She hopes to keep going at this same work rate.

This will be Lita's fifth loan from MFP and she would like you to support her so that she can continue investing in her business.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy ingredients and supplies for making her delicious dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and cooking supplies

loans.name: Serikbai

texts.en:
Serikbai is 41-years-old and lives with her five children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Two of her children are college students and three children are high school students. 

She started her business to sell meat to the local market many years ago and has a lot of business and work experience. Starting this year, she increased her business activity and is now selling meat at two different places. She is a hard working woman who says "I have a plan to expand my business and earn more profits. With the profits that I earned, I want to provide a good education to my children." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy livestock from the countryside.

loans.use: to buy livestock from the countryside

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 36-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband, Jonathan Baya, is a carpenter who contributes in providing for the family's basic needs. Constance has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Constance has operated a business selling potatoes for the past five years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of owning a café in the future. Constance plans on using the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en: Salwa is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She has owned a small mini-market since 1998. Despite her older age, Salwa works hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs, especially with her husband’s absence as he is on travel. Today, she is requesting to borrow $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more merchandise for her grocery store in order to increase her sales and thus her income. In the future, she is looking to further expand her business and increase its capital.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luzmabel

texts.en:
Luzmabel is a 58-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. Luzmabel is from Cebedo St. Ozamis City. 

Luzmabel operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. Luzmabel has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. 

In 2010, Luzmabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Luzmabel is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost paid in maintenance and repair of her motorcycle. This loan would be her third loan taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the cost paid in maintenance and repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a  35-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 18-4 year. She's had a business of selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Lucia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a plot in future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Mohamed C

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo in the Eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children aged of 2 and 7 years. His older child is currently attending school, and he also has 5 additional dependents living with him at home. 

Mohamed runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo, where he sells cement, bags of rice, sugar and fillets. He has been running this business for 5 years. He works at the business from 8 am until 6 pm 6 days per week. He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenges to his business are transportation and slow sales in the rainy season.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy more general merchandise such as cement, bags of rice, and sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his child and increase his savings. In the future, he plans to build more houses and purchase a car. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more cement, bags of rice, and sugar.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Esfuerzo, está conformado por los señores Avelardo, Israel, Leoba van a comprar con su préstamo abono, bolsa, planta de aguacate y fertilizante, la señora Erika va a comprar 5 lechones cerditos para engordarlos, la joven Wendy va a comprar zapatos y catálogos. El joven Avelardo tiene 20 años de edad, el es soltero, el cultiva planta de aguacate para vender, el solicito su préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizante, bolsas y planta de aguacate, el inicio su negocio hace 2 años  trabajaba en un vivero donde aprendio a cultivar las plantas de aguacate con su sueldo el fue ahorrando para comprar las plantas y los materiales para trabajar, su negocio es importante por los beneficios que obtiene y porque le gusta cultivar las plantas ver que están creciendo, el se siente orgulloso de tener su propio negocio de darles a sus cliente los campesino que tienen sus huertas un buen precio y buena calidad de las plantas, las ganancias las utiliza para volver a invertir en bolsa y abono, el está planeando ampliar su negocio tener más plantas de diferentes frutas, el está contento con el préstamo que va a recibir lo va a utilizar para comprar los insumos para cultivar las plantas de aguacate. Sus sueños y esperanza son crecer la producción de plantas de aguacate. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos y que sigan ayudando a más personas que lo necesitan”.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Esfuerzo” (The Effort) and includes Avelardo, Israel, and Leoba.  They will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer, bags, and avocado plants.  Erika will buy five piglets to fatten up.  Wendy will buy shoes and catalogs.

Avelardo is 20 years old, single, and raises and sells avocados.  He requested this loan so he can buy fertilizer, bags, and avocado plants.  He started this business two years ago, after working at a nursery where he learned to raise avocados.  He saved his salary to buy plants and other materials to work with.

His business is important because of the benefits it gives him and because he likes to raise plants and watch them grow.  He’s proud to have his own business and offer his customers the bounty that his orchard offers at a good price and quality.  He uses the profits to reinvest in bags and fertilizer and plans to expand his business, and add different types of fruit plants.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies for harvesting his avocados.   His hopes and dreams are to increase his avocado production.

The members of the group want to thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad, and say “Thank you for the loans and your continued help for those who truly need it.”

loans.use: to buy avocado plants and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy horticultural products for the shop.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: El socio Rufino; continua con su negocio de venta de medicina natural, el socio es curandero y ejerce esta labor desde hace 40 años atrás motivo por el cual continua y continuara haciendo esto hasta que las fuerzas le acompañen manifiesta el socio; el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de sus ingredientes como son hierbas naturales y  raíces, cebos de animales y hierbas al por mayor. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de estos productos naturales para la elaboracion de sus medicinas.
texts.en:
The member Rufino continues in the business of selling natural medicine. He is a healer and has been doing this activity for forty years. The motive behind going on and on doing this is the strength that comes with manifestation.

The member at this time wants to use the money from the loan to buy ingredients such as natural herbs and roots, animal baits and wholesale herbs.

The member is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of these natural products for the making of his medicine.

loans.use: to buy natural products for the preparation of his medicine

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 19 years old. She is not married and lives in Bagamoyo district with her parents. Currently Pili is a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches students life skills. 

Pili has a plan of selling women's clothes in her community. She requests a Kiva loan to start a business of selling women's clothes. She already has a frame. Pili will use the loan to buy products. The profit obtained will help her to study a computer course.

loans.use: to start a business of selling women's clothes

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco C. Puente has dedicated the past 7 years to the production of construction blocks. At the beginning, he made the block manually. He used to mix and compress Portland cement and sand, this process demanded extreme physical effort. At the present time he has machinery, but the electrical motor is currently broken and he needs to fix it. Until he is able to fix it, Mr. C. is now making the block by hand again. This problem has diminished the production. Mr. C. is asking for a loan of $900. He would like to pay it back in 6 months. This amount will be used to repair the motor and buy raw material. This will allow him to work faster and increase his block production business.

ESPANOL

El Sr. Francisco Puente C. se ha dedicado durante 7 años al producción y venta de block para la construcción. En un principio él mismo lo hacia manualmente que consiste en el prensado de dos materiales básicos: arena y cemento. El proceso era manual, lo que exigía un desgaste físico extremo. Actualmente cuenta con equipo mecanizado para la hechura del block, pero el motor eléctrico que hace funcionar el equipo de elaboración se averió y están haciendo nuevamente el proceso manualmente, lo que ha disminuido su producción. El Sr. Francisco Puente solicita un prestamo por $900.00 USD para reparar el motor y para comprar materia prima que le permita tener mas inventario y surtir los pedidos, el piensa pagar en 6 meses.

loans.use: motor repair and raw materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Mrs. R. started her snack business last year and she has a large number of customers. This year she wants to sell more and have more clients, and she wants to sell new snacks. She is applying for a $1200.00 loan, which she wants to pay off in 12 months.

la señora R. comenzo su negocio de snacks el año pasado y tiene un gran numero de clientes pero este año ella quiere vender mas por lo que piensa vender diferentes productos, ella esta solicitando un prestamo de $1200.00 Dllrs y lo piensa pagar en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jesús Vicente

texts.en:
Jesús is retired, and the money he gets from his pension isn't enough to cover his family's expenses. He is married and has a son. As a way to stay active and be able to provide his family necessities, he started his own blacksmith business five years ago. He has always been dedicated to this line of work and has a lot of experience, so he offers a superior service and the demand for his work has increased a lot.

Currently, Jesús has a lot of orders from customers and needs to take out a loan of $250 to buy materials needed to fulfill them. He plans to repay the loan within three to six months. You can help Jesús continue working. He needs your support and is sincerely grateful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Jesús es jubilado, y con el ingreso de su pensión no era posible cubrir los gastos de su familia, él es casado y tiene un hijo, como una manera de no estar inactivo y completar los recursos que necesitaba para su hogar, hace cinco años inició su propio negocio de herrería, él siempre ha dedicado a esta labor y tiene mucha experiencia, por lo que sus trabajos son muy buenos y la demanda por ellos se ha incrementado mucho.

Actualmente, Jesús tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes pero para poder sacar su trabajo necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de material que requiere para la elaboración de sus productos, él ofrece devolver este cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Ayuda a Jesús a que continúe trabajando, él necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad.

loans.use: Buy hardward supplies

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is a married father of three, two sons, ages 19 and 15, and a 6-year-old daughter. His spouse is a housewife. His two boys are in school and also help him in his business, making wooden furniture. He learned the trade from his father and he decided to do the same. David worked before at another place and also he made worked by himself on the side but did not enough tools. Little by little, he was able to obtain these tools and open his own business.

David is requesting for a loan of $550 to purchase wood and some tools for his business and he plans to repay this loan within 6 months. He and his family thank you so much for your support in growing with the business and helping give David's children an education.

Translated from the original Spanish text

David es un hombre casado y tiene tres hijos dos hijos de 19 y 15 años de edad respectivamente, y una hija de 6 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al hogar. Sus dos hijos hombres están estudiando y también le ayudan en el negocio, el cuál es fabricar muebles de madera, oficio que lo aprendió de su padre y decidió dedicarse al mismo. David antes trabajaba en otro taller y por su cuenta poco a poco por que no tenía las herramientas necesarias, ya con el tiempo fue adquiriendo las mismas y pudo abrir su propio negocio.

David está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar madera y algunas herramientas para el negocio y ofrece pagar este préstamo en 6 meses, el y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das y así poder continuar con su negocio y darles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase wood and tools

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Mr. Edoh N. is 42 years old. He gave up his high school studies due to lack of financial means and launched himself into agriculture. Having become a farmer of renown by adding a poultry farm to his vegetable-growing business, he well-managed his initial loan which was repaid without difficulty. Versatile in his business, he solicits a new loan of $950 which will enlarge the area of his cultivated land and improve his chicken farm. With the current loan he means to benefit more areas of his business after raising his turnover, to best contribute to improving the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. Edoh est âgé de 42 ans. Il a arrêté ses études au cours secondaire par manque de moyens financiers et s’est lancé dans l’agriculture. Devenu un grand exploitant agricole de renommé par son bonne association d’élevage à la culture végétale, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident. Dynamique dans ses activités, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $950 qui servira à l’agrandissement de sa surface cultivée et améliorer son élevage de volailles. Par le présent crédit, il pense rentabiliser plus ses activités afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Expand his cultivated surface and improve his poultry farm

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
This woman has, since a little bit more than 23 years, a small but well stocked stand of general goods where she sells random merchandise such as basic grains, detergent, tomato sauce, shoe-shining pasta, etc..

According to her, she has had to fight very hard to make her business grow, she has worked on retail since a very young age. Before having he business, she sold traditional dishes such as 'Pork with yucca.' She would sell this outside in the market's sidewalk, the same place where she's located now but in worst conditions (she had a wood and plastic bag stand). After 2 years she decided to change activities and she started selling grains with a very modest capital of $250. Thanks to her sacrifice, perseverance and good management of her resources she has improved her working place and she puts a lot of effort in increasing the variety and quantity of her products.

Mrs. M. is in a relationship, her partner is a driver and he helps her with the house expenditures, although not in 100%, because of his low salary, which is hardly $100 a month. Mrs. M. has three children, all in school age and they are both raising the children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora posee, desde hace poco más de 23 años, un pequeño, pero bien surtido puesto de ventas de mercadería en general en donde vende de todo un poco: granos básicos, detergente, salsa de tomate, pasta de lustrar, etc.

Según manifiesta ella misma, ha tenido que luchar duramente para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio. Antes de tener este local, se dedicaba a la venta de Cerdo con yuca (plato tradicional), las ventas las realizaba en las aceras del mercado, más tarde con su venta de cerdo con yuca logra ingresar al mercado en el mismo lugar donde está ubicada actualmente pero en condiciones menos adecuadas (tramo de madera y plástico negro); luego de 2 años decide cambiar de actividad y empieza a vender granos básicos con un modesto capital inicial de US$ 250 dólares. Gracias a su sacrificio y perseverancia ha logrado hacer uso adecuado de sus propios recursos y de los recursos provenientes de los créditos que ha recibido, realizando mejoras en el puesto que posee y a su vez esforzándose por aumentar el surtido de su negocio, es decir, tiene de todo un poco, aunque en menores cantidades.

La señora M. es acompañada, su pareja labora como conductor particular y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, aunque no en un 100%, debido a su bajo salario que apenas llega a los US$ 100 dólares al mes, tiene tres hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar los cuales está formando junto a su pareja.

loans.use: Compra de productos (arroz, frijoles, maiz, etc).

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is a young person who knows that, to get ahead, one must fight since opportunities do not present themselves to those who rest. Some time ago, school became too great a financial burden for her parents and they could no longer afford to spend so much on the materials she needed. For this reason, Maria del Carmen began to purchase small home electronics (such as those shown behind her in the photograph) at wholesale, and offering them for sale to her fellow students. She uses the funds she earns toward her educational expenses.

She needs to buy more products given that, during this season, her type of merchandise is in great demand. She requests a loan of $750USD, to be repaid over a period of six months. With the earnings from her sales, Maria del Carmen hopes to save enough to buy a small holiday gift for her parents to show them her appreciation. The rest of her earnings would go toward finishing her education, and meeting her goal of one day becoming a person who does well. With your help, Maria del Carmen will be able to finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ma. Del Carmen Es una joven que sabe que para poder salir adelante hay que luchar con todas las fuerzas, puesto que las oportunidades no esperan a los que se quedan dormidos. Hace tiempo que la escuela comenzó a representar muchos gastos para los padres de Ma. Del Carmen y ellos ya no podían gastar tanto en materiales. Por eso María del Carmen comenzó a comprar electrodomésticos (como el que se muestra tras de ella en la fotografía) por mayoreo y a ofrecerlos a sus compañeros de la escuela y utilizar este dinero para poder terminar su escuela.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue y actualmente necesita comprar más productos puesto que en esta temporada muchos compran electrodomésticos con sus aguinaldos. Por eso está solicitando un crédito de US $750 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así María del Carmen con lo que gane en sus ventas podrá ahorrar dinero suficiente para poder darles un pequeño obsequio de agradecimiento por darle lo mejor a sus padres en esta navidad y también dejar dinero para poder continuar con los estudios de su carrera y un día llegar a ser una persona de bien. Con tu ayuda María del Carmen podrá terminar de estudiar.

loans.use: Purchase novelty items/small home electronics merchandise.

loans.name: Naawati

texts.en: Naawati is a 45-year-old woman. She has a small shop where she sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She can earn about US$ 5.50 per day. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She is requesting a US$ 100 loan to buy more goods for her shop. Naawati hopes that she can increase her income to be able to pay for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her little grocery shop

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
"I am Parween A. from the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I have been married for six months. I need a loan for my husband’s tea stall. He has been in this business since his teens. We want to expand our business so that we can improve our living standard before our child comes into this world. I stitch clothes at my house.

I would like to borrow in a group with three other members who are: Shamim B. and Khursheed B. who both need loans for their husbands who are butchers, and Salma Y. who wants to expand their jewelry store."

loans.use: Expand our tea stall

loans.name: Saida De La Concepci

texts.es:
Since 28 years, Mrs Saida sells vegetables at the “La Terminal” market in the city of Leon. She decided to ask for a loan in order to have her own market stand and buy more products.

Her dream is to improve the standard of living of her family (including her 4 children).

Saida believes that the financial support she has received from CEPRODEL has been a key factor for the development of her business. Nowadays, she has improved her sales and would like to receive another loan to buy even more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Saida se dedica a esta actividad de venta de verduras desde hace 28 años ubicándose en el mercado la Terminal en la ciudad de León.

Con la esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos decide solicitar prestamos para tener un local propio, incrementar su inventario en fin el de realizar sus sueños mejorar en todos los aspectos de su vida.

Considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente ha mejorado sus ventas y hoy en día una vez mas acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que son invertidos directamente en la compra de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and get her own market-stand

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Ice cream production has always been a family tradition in the family of Mauricia, a young,hard-worker 28 year old. She learnt and inherited this business from her loving and humble parents, whom years ago initially established the ice cream shop that now Mauricia administers with plenty of diligence. Her wish is to increase production, and that is why she is coming to you to request a loan. With your good heart you will help realize the dreams of this young enterpreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La producción de helados siempre fue el negocio familiar de Mauricia, joven empeñosa y hacendosa de 28 años de edad.Ésta emprendedora joven aprendió y heredó esta labor de sus queridos y humildes padres, quienes durante muchos años lograron implementar y sacar adelante su heladería y de la que con mucho empeño y diligencia administra Mauricio para continuar con la labor de sus padres. El deseo de esta emprendedora mujer es aumentar la cantidad de su producción, con ese anhelo recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo. “Con tu buen corazón permitirás concretar los anhelos de esta joven emprendedora”

loans.use: To increase production in her ice cream business.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.en:
Osvaldo Dario Z. (33) owns a blacksmith's shop in a neighborhood called Monte Alto in San Stanislao (SANTANI) city. He decided to open “Marangatu” blacksmith's shop eight years ago. Since then Osvaldo's clients have been very satisfied with his work. What makes his products different from others is their originality and creativity. Moreover, he sells them at a very low price, and their quality is outstanding.

Osvaldo’s reputation is excellent, everybody in town knows him as a creative and artistic person who makes beautiful things. What makes Osvaldo work very hard is the desire to give his family a better quality of life. He lives with his parents, has no children, and is married. The loan provided will be used to build a roof for his blacksmith's workshop that will protect his workshop from the rain and the sun.

loans.use: construction of a  roof over his workshop

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Upendo M.. She is married, and has two children aged 7 and 14. In 2004, Upendo established her crop wholesaling business. Upendo requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and maize. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This serves as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of maize and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Talbi

texts.ru:
Talbi N. lives in Vahdat. She is married and has 7 children. Despite the large family size they live together very happily. Talbi raises her children and runs her household. She own a dairy cow and would like to purchase another one in order to produce more milk and to sell the extra milk. This will help her to earn an additional income and to help her husband in supporting the family. Talbi would like to take out an 8 month loan to purchase the cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Назарова Талби жительница города Вахдат . Замужем имеет семерых детей. Занимается воспитанием детей и разводит домашнее хозяйство. То есть она имеет корову и хочет купить еще одну , чтобы получать молоко и продавать лишнее. Это поможет получать дополнительный доход и помогать мужу в обеспечении семьи. Для этого она планирует получить кредит со сроком в 8 месяцев.Не смотря на то , что у них очень большая семья они живут очень дружно и весело.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama owns and operates a retail business whereby she sells goods in Zanzibar. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children (ages 7, 17, 20, 23, and 25). On a daily basis, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business. Consequently, she can generate a monthly profit of approximately $180.

Salama is currently requesting a loan to buy more materials for her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr: thioro  N. est membre de la mutuelle depuis quelques mois .elle est mariée et est mère de trois enfants .elle est une vendeuse de charbon de bois devant chez elle au quartier randoulène de thies .avec l'hivernage elle  veut renforcer ses stocks c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Thioro N. has been a member of the Mutual for several months. She is married and the mother of three children. She sells charcoal in front of her home in the Randoulène neighborhood of Thiès. With winter coming, she wants to increase her stock, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Charcoal sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of animals to keep operating her butcher shop.

loans.name: Fatoumata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Sidi M. est âgée de 38 ans et vit avec son mari, ses 5 enfants et autres parents dans la famille paternelle (traditionnelle élargie) dans le quartier Hamdallaye A de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle abandonna l’école en classe de 7èmeannée de l’enseignement fondamental pour s’adonner aux activités génératrices de revenus afin de subvenir à ses besoins. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de sa belle mère, elle s’installe dans le secteur de la nourriture en vendant des poissons séchés depuis 6 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience et d’une notoriété sans égale à Ségou d’où son sobriquet de Jege jalan Faty (Faty la vendeuse de poisson séché). Après l’achat d’une certaine quantité de poissons frais , elle procède au lavage et au séchage au soleil à l’abri de la poussière et des mouches. Ensuite les poissons sont découpés en morceaux avant de les revendre.
 Elle est à son premier prêt individuel. Avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 5 paniers de poissons frais sur place à Ségou auprès de grossistes venant de Mopti.
Madame Fatoumata Sidi M. vend au marché Château à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Ses ventes se réalisent toujours au comptant.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA,  lequel lui permettra de payer les trousseaux de mariage de sa fille et d’augmenter le volume de son activité.
Son ambition est de construire une maison d’habitation et acheter une certaine quantité d’or .
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Sidi M. is 38 years old and lives with her husband, her five children, and parents in a paternal family (traditional and extended) in the Hamdallaye A district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She abandoned school in the seventh grade to dedicate herself to earning an income in order to support herself. After several years apprenticing with her mother-in-law, she got settled six years ago in the food sector selling dried fish. She enjoys much experience and unparalleled fame in Ségou, where she earned the nickname “Jege jalan Faty” (Faty the Dried Fish Seller). After buying a certain quantity of fresh fish, she washes them and then dries them in the sun. She protects them from dust and flies. Next, the fish are cut into pieces before being sold. She is on her first individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso and intends to use the loan to buy 5 baskets of fresh fish locally in Ségou from wholesalers coming from Mopti. Ms. Fatoumata Sidi M. makes her sales at the Château marketplace to customers composed essentially of women. Sales are always made in cash. She hopes to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to pay for a marital hope chest for her daughter and to increase the volume of her business. Her ambition is to construct a house in which to live and to buy a certain quantity of gold.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret I. lives in Prey Khduoch Village in Takeo Province. She is farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to earn living. 

Her husband, Mr. Nhem Chea, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to support the family. Although they have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well.  

Thus, Mrs. Ret I. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding, and she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow.

Mrs. Ret I. is 57 years old and the mother of three children: One is a cassette player repairer, another is an ice-cream seller and the remaining one is a farmer. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chhut's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that is composed of four borrowers that all reside in the Battambang Province. Mrs. Chhut T., 43, is a local tailor. She owns and runs a small shop in her home to sew both traditional clothes and modern clothes for her neighbors. She is able to earn an income of approximately of $4 per day. Chhut is married with two children, both of whom are still young and attend school. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine to help her business. Chhut is a leader of the other three borrowers:

Mrs. Ma T., 42, a widow. She is a tailor who is requesting a loan to build a restroom.

Mrs. Sun P., 55, is a local tailor. She seeks a loan to pay for repairing her sewing machine.

Mrs. Rin S., 31, makes a living by catching fish with her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy fishing tools such as nets and traps.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: German Luis

texts.es:
El Señor de Nombre German Luís E. V. tiene la edad de 52 años su estad civil es casado, Don German tiene 3 hijos Fabio Antonio tiene la edad 22 años y estudia la carrera de periodismo su otro hijo Reynaldo Manuel Martínez Mayorga tiene la edad de 20 años y cursa el 2 año de la carrera química y Juan Carlos Martínez tiene la edad 18 años y cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su esposa labora como la elaboración de tortillas, sus propósitos son de tener su negocio activo por lo que su actividad económica es mas complicada ya que tiene que engordar a los cerdos ya que el alimento para darle de comer a los cerdos es muy caro pero quiere mantenerlo sus deseos son de darle mejoras a su vivienda para que su esposa y sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente y sus hijos puedan tener un buen lugar para el futuro sus sueños son de comprar una casa en León para ir de vacaciones con su familia ya que su casa de habitación es en la comarca  chácaraseca
