La actividad económica a la que se dedica es engorde de cerdos, reproducción y desarrollo de pollos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación en la comarca de chacarasecas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, el inicio con otro negocio antes de comenzar la actividad  a la que se dedica actualmente era chofer de un camión que transportaba concentrado a las avícolas del TIP- TOP y comenzó con 10 pollos ya que el es una persona luchadora además de la crianza de los pollos también inicio con 2 cerdos donde quería invertir mas en los cerdos por lo que esto fue invirtiendo hasta lograr tener 30 cerdos en total y así fue que poco a poco fu7e aumentado su producción hasta lograr lo que tiene en la actualidad, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de mas pollo y para la compra de concentrado para que el desarrollo de los cerdos y los pollos sea de mejor calidad para el engorde de los animales por lo que los productos que mas comercializa es son los pollos que los vende por libra y los pollos que los vende en pie y espera seguir contando con la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Mr. Germán Luís E. V. is 52 years old, married, and has three sons. Fabio Antonio is 22 years old and is studying journalism. Reynaldo Manuel Martínez Mayorga is 20 years old and is in his second year studying chemistry at the university. Juan Carlos Martínez is 18 years old and is in 10th grade. Germán’s wife works making tortillas. His purpose is to have an active business because his business is more complicated now than it was before. He has to fatten pigs and the food that he gives them to eat is very expensive but he would like to keep fattening pigs. His wishes are that he can improve his home so his wife and sons can live comfortably and his sons can have a good place for the future. He dreams of buying a house in León where he could take his family on vacation, as his current home is in the Chácaraseca region. Germán works fattening pigs and raising chickens. His business is located in his home in the Chácaraseca region, and he has had the business for 10 years. He began with another business before starting his current business. In his previous business, he was a truck driver who transported TIP-TOP poultry. He began with 10 chickens, and because he is a hard-working person, he also began with two pigs and wanted to invest in more pigs. He continued buying pigs until he had 30 in total, and this was how, little by little, he increased his production until he had what he has now. This loan is for working capital that will be used to buy more chickens and animal feed so the development of his pigs and chickens can be of better quality for fattening his animals. He sells more chickens than any other animal, and they are sold alive and by the pound. He hopes to continue receiving the help of Kiva partner Fundación León 2000 and their sister organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Sam-Ang

texts.en:
Miss. Sam-ang N. (shown in the photo with her mother), 24, is single and lives with her widowed mother. She has three siblings. All of them have full-time employment. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capita of Cambodia.

Sam-ang has been a full-time employee in a company in Phnom Penh for six years. She earns about $80 a month. The family's income is from her and her brothers and sisters. The kitchen in their home is very old and needs to be rebuilt. Therefore, Sam-ang is requesting a loan of $800 to rebuild it. This is her second loan.

loans.use: To build a new kitchen

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia has her own a minishop (kiosk) and has sold clothing in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for the past 3 years. She belongs to the Safi nia loan group (Group code 2007).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothing and other items for her business. She ihopes that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.   

Fauzia is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 10 and 6.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and other items for her business.

loans.name: Godspower

texts.en: Godspower is 38 years old and married without a child. He cracks palm kernels and sells them. He needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase a machine that cracks more palm kernels, so he can expand his business. He thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase one machine for cracking palm kernels

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros F. is 34 years old and lives in Culasi, a beautiful coastal town in northern Antique Province on the island of Panay.  She has an 11 year old daughter and is married to Gregorio, a laborer.  Milagros has run a sari-sari store for about seven years.
"Sari-sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds" and the shops sell just that: an assortment of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities. The shops retail items in small units -- selling single cigarettes, for example. Sari-sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in poor or rural areas; they often have chairs or a bench out front, and act as neighborhood gathering places.
Milagros will use most of the money from this loan to buy inventory for her store such as candy, shampoo, and noodles.  With the remainder of the loan she will buy a hog to nourish and intends to reinvest the profit she makes from the pig back into her sari-sari store.  If she earns enough, Milagros wants to be able to continue supporting her daughter's education and would like to make improvements to her house in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages as inventory for a small variety store and to buy one hog to nourish

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. is a twenty-eight year old married man and the father of one child, a son. He says his son is currently in the nursery school. His wife works to make some income to support him financially. She trades in eggs. Emmanuel lives with the wife and son in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a farming and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Emmanuel deals in mobile phones and accessories. He owns a shop in front of the house in which he stays. He has in stock all kinds of cell phones and their accessories. He procures the goods from big stores and wholesalers in Accra.

Emmanuel has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more phones and accessories to increase his stock. He is hopeful to give his child the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure more mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Đỗ's Group

texts.en: Hà Đỗ Thị (20203050025) is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Hà is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 05 (5). Hà is married and has two infant children. Hà raises chickens for sale and has been engaged in this business for over four years, earning approximately 3,000,000 IDR a month. Hà joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her first loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050026) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 IDR loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Trương Thị V. (20203050027) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her furniture-making business. 3. Trương Thị Tỵ (20203050028) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20203050029) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. Nguyễn Thị M. (20203050030) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business raising livestock. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Hà Đỗ Thị (20203050025) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 05 (5). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 IDR. Hà đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050026) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Trương Thị V. (20203050027) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất. 3. Trương Thị Tỵ (20203050028) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20203050029) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Nguyễn Thị M. (20203050030) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về DINARI: Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Daysi Verónica

texts.es: Daysi Verónica R. A. de 31 años de edad, reside en La Libertad junto a su madre y un hermano. Ella posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en la cual junto a su madre trabajan mucho para obtener las ganancias necesarias para solventar los gastos del hogar, esta tienda está ubicada en un lugar muy estratégico, ya que está en calle principal. Daysi solicita un préstamo para poder surtir más su tienda, debido a que ella considera necesario poder mejorar los productos que se venden para obtener mayores clientelas.
texts.en:
Daysi Verónica R. A. is 31 and lives in La Libertad with her mother and one of her brothers. She has a store where she sells basic goods. She works there with her mother to earn enough income to pay for their home's expenses. This store is in a very strategic location on the main street. Daysi is requesting a loan to be able to supply her store. She thinks it is necessary to be able to improve the products she sells to obtain a bigger clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing a very succulent ground nut

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 22 year old man who lives with his wife in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Mostafa has owned a mini-market for four years. He requested a loan of 2,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his market like cheese, yogurt, bread, water, cans and lots more. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.

Mostafa is special in his work because he has a big variety of products and opens till late in the evening. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition because there are other markets in his region. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to increase his income, as well as he likes trading. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by becoming a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his mini-market

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs. Veronica is 45 years old and married with seven children. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Tuamasaga

texts.en: Tuamasaga M. (0) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau Fou 4. She is married and has six school-aged children. Tuamasaga owns and operates a tailoring business, providing men's tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. Tuamasaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Tuamasaga is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will again be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is forty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband who is a famer to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Joyce is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Joyce procures bales of second hand textiles from Accra. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Amadith

texts.es:
La señora Amadith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y todos sus hijos ya son independientes.

Amadith, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y se dedica a la Venta de Repuestos asociados en un negocio familiar juntamente con su esposo e hijo mayor. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco a poco fue implementando y ampliando mejor su negocio,  vio que le iba muy bien.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes de su barrio y de otros lugares, sus principales clientes son motocarristas y choferes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará más repuestos como focos y faros de luz y tubos de escape para diversos tipos de movilidad, barras telescópicas para motos, llantas.
 
Amadith, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Amadith belongs to the Picota Communal Bank in the Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 48 and in a common law marriage. All of her children are now independent. Amadith is a woman who likes to work. She sells replacement parts in a family business with her husband and oldest son. She started with 300 PEN. Little by little she was setting up and expanding her business. She saw that it was going very well. She currently continues with the same business. She is well known by her customers in the neighborhood and from other places. Her main customers are drivers. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy replacement parts like headlights and exhaust pipes for a variety of vehicles, telescopic rods for motorcycles, and tires. Amadith has many goals in front of her. She is motivated to make them become a reality. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments, and she plans on continuing in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to increase her stock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna T., a 36-year-old widow, is raising four children on her own. She invested in hogs to earn a living. Her income from raising hogs supplies the family’s needs. Lorna strives to maintain her business so she can also sustain her children’s education. She requests a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to finance her business.

loans.use: Financing her hog raising business

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es:
Magnolia tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo (Marcel), de 63 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Robert de 35, Liz de 28, Jhon de 24 y Carmen de 21, en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural, los cuales son una manera de obtener ingresos a para su familia y además de sentirse ocupada, ya que sus hijos ya son mayores y se dedican a sus propias cosas. Por ello, Magnolia se entrega de entero a su trabajo, ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinas, amigas y familiares, con las cuales siempre se entretiene conversando sobre los beneficios de adquirir sus productos. Ella se dedica a este negocio según las horas que vea por conveniente, es por eso que le agrada mucho su trabajo y espera en un futuro hacerlo crecer y así aumentar sus ventas. 

Magnolia cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, pues ellos también constantemente le compran sus productos, la parte difícil radica en cobrar a los clientes a quienes les deja al crédito, pues debe caminar largos trechos, pero ella sabe que es necesario hacer algunos sacrificios para poder llegar al éxito. 

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras, es por ello que piensa seguir trabajando en grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de productos, ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Magnolia is 59 years old and lives with her 63 year-old husband (Marcel) and with her four children--35 year-old Robert, 28 year-old Liz, 24 year-old Jhon, and 21 year-old Carmen- in a house of their own.

She makes a living selling natural medicines, which provide her with a way to earn income for her family and keep her busy since her adult children have their own lives. Magnolia devotes herself to her work, offering her products to her neighbors, friends, and family with whom she's always glad to talk to about the benefits her products offer. She works on her business at the hours she deems convenient. This is why she enjoys her work so much and hopes to make it grow in the future and thus increase her sales.

Magnolia has the support of her children as they always buy her products. The difficult part of her business lies in collecting money from customers who buy on credit as she needs to walk long distances to do so. However, she knows that it is necessary to make certain sacrifices to achieve success.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Magnolia has always made her payments on time just like her colleagues which is why she plans to keep working with the group. She will use the loan to purchase greater quantity of products since she has several outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy is a diligent 56-year-old farmer. He is married. Out of his 5 children, the eldest is 19 years old. He cultivates his land for rice crops. He wants to increase his income from farming so he exerts extra effort to ensure his farm is in a good condition. He also sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines and also a KIVA partner. He joined the MFI a year ago and is grateful for the financial assistance he availed of. Now, Rudy is applying for a loan of PHP 12,000. He will use this loan to finance his farm. This loan could also help him improve his living condition.

loans.use: To invest in his farm

loans.name: Jose Roque

texts.es:
Don Jose  Vive el la localidad de la Guardia, poblacion que se encuentra a las afueras de Santa Cruz,  su actividad economica principal es el servicio de alojamiento, rentan piezas a personas que estan de pasada por el pueblo; su esposa la señora Magnolia le colabora en el negocio, tienen un hijo pequeño.
Los cliente están agradecido con la institución por  el apoyo brindado, el crédito lo destinaran para aumento de su capital de trabajo, compra de frazadas, sabanas y catres.
texts.en:
Don Jose lives in the community of La Guardia, which is located on the outskirts of Santa Cruz. He provides lodging services, renting out rooms to people who pass through the village. He manages the business with his wife, Sra. Magnolia. They have one small child.

Don Jose is grateful for the support provided by the Institution. His loan will be used as operating capital to purchase blankets, sheets, and cots.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets, sheets, and cots

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta A. G. es una señora de 49 años de edad la cual vive con su hijo en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Doña Marta se dedica a la avicultura específicamente a la cría de pollos para engorde y quiere ampliar su proyecto incluyendo gallinas ponedoras - para la producción de carne y huevos respectivamente -. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad. Su esposo le ayuda ocasionalmente con el transporte. 

Actualmente doña Marta está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones) para la compra de más pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras, así como compra de concentrado para su alimentación y productos para la prevención y  tratamiento de enfermedades.  Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa se fortalezca y crezca más, para poder atraer a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos.

Doña Marta es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Marta A. G. is 49. She lives with her son in the Hernández community located in Los Chiles in the Aljuela province. This community stands out for its mountainous regions with great scenery. It is very humid, and it is very close to the northern border of the country. Its primary economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains, tubers, and oranges. Marta raises and fattens chickens. She wants to expand her project by including laying hens. This is for the production of meat and eggs. She sells her products to the neighbors in her community, and they are very satisfied with the quality. He husband helps occasionally with the transport. Marta is currently asking for a small loan for ¢670,000 (six hundred seventy thousand colones) to buy more chickens to fatten and to buy laying hens. She will also buy concentrated food for them and products to prevent and treat illnesses. With this investment she expects that her small business will become strong and grow more. Then she will be able to attract more customers and offer them better products. Marta is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan and she hopes to grow personally and financially. She would like to offer her thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable her to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hens and chickens

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 47 años, es madre de 8 hijos (5 de ellos son mayores) y cuenta con el  apoyo de su esposo quien es constructor civil.
Ana Marìa se dedica a la venta de pollos y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò bebidas como gaseosas y refrescos para luego vender en su casa.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles los que utilizarà en la compra de pollos  que posteriormente serán vendidos en fiestas navideñas. 
La meta de Ana María es tener un galpón (criadero grande) de pollos y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana María is a dynamic and perseverant woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 47 years old, the mother of 8 children (5 of whom are adults), and has financial support from her husband, who works in construction.

Ana Marìa sells chicken and has been a part of the “Madres Corajes” (“Courageous Mothers”) Communal Bank for four years. The first loan that she received was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she used to purchase soft drinks and other refreshments to sell from her home. She is currently requesting a loan for 600 nuevos soles to purchase chickens to sell during the Christmas season.

Ana María's goal is to have a shed to raise chickens and thereby advance her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia P. 54 years old and is a rice farmer.  She owns a small rice field which she hopes will provide her family an adequate supply of food, clothing, and other basic needs. Her rice farm is doing well now.  She wishes that it will continue to yield an abundant harvest so that she will be able to continually support the needs of her family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The purpose of availing a loan is to buy farm supplies to grow her rice crop well.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lira

texts.es: Lira, es una mujer muy responsable, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, esta actividad la realiza en la vereda de su casa los días particulares y los fines de semana se va a eventos bailables, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al oficio de estibador.  Lira forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de gaseosas, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1800 soles, que será invertido en la compra de golosinas por caja para vender en forma ambulatoria.	La meta de Lira es tener una tienda de abarrotes en general quer le permita obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lira is a very responsible woman, living in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 41 years old and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom are adults. She is dedicated to selling snack packs from the veranda of her house. On special days and weekends she sells where there are dances. She can count on the help of her husband who is a stevedore. Lira has belonged to the “Manos Maravillosas” Communal Bank for 5 years. The first loan she received was for 300 Sols, and was invested in soft drinks to sell. Now, she needs a loan of 1,800 Sols, which she will invest in buying snacks by the box to sell on the streets. Lira's goal is to have a general grocery store which would permit her to obtain a larger income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SNACKS BY THE BOX TO SELL

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mohamad has owned a bakery since 2000. He makes all types of Lebanese pastries, including the following: “Fatayers” - spiced triangular spinach pies stuffed with meat and onions; “Manakich” - pastry baked with thyme, olive oil, spices and sesame seeds; “Sfiha” - pies made from fresh dough topped with spicy ground lamb meat, onions and tomatoes; “Sambousik” - pastries with meat and pine nuts; and “Rakaek Jibne” - thin flour dough, stuffed with combination cheese, then fried to golden perfection.

Mohamad has requested his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his bakery. He is talented at his work because he offers good quality and very tasty pastries. His clients are people from his region, but mainly his friends and neighbors. Mohamad decided on going into this business because he is a very good cook and has experience. He plans to keep on improving his business as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and merchandise for his bakery

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is 48 years old and lives with his mother and two children, ages 12 and 9, who are in school.  Cesar has four cows, and produces and sells milk. For the last 17 years, he has started work every day at 4 a.m. milking the cows and then traveling throughout the city selling milk door-to-door.  Previously, he worked in Argentina in construction, but since 1992 he has been in Paraguay working in his current profession.  He is seeking the loan to enable him to purchase a milking cow as demand for his milk is high due to its excellent quality and his good service.

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy P., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sy Hoem , 43 (pictured together), have been married since 1990 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home and other three are in school. The family lives in a small village located seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.
	
Chanthy has been selling fish for ten years. She buys fish from fisherman in her village and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a construction worker for seven years. She hopes to expand her business so she will able to get additional income. So she is asking for her first loan in the amount of US$ 600 to buy more fish for resale.

Chanthy also will use a part of her loan to purchase a trailer for her son-in-law to use as a motor 'remorque' taxi. A 'remorque' is a motorbike attached to a trailer at the back.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale and a trailer to attach to a motorbike

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon Y. (pictured with her daughter) is a widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is a garment-factory worker. She also has her elderly mother living with her. They live along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Thon has been selling porridge for seven years. She wants to buy a cow to raise. She will earn additional income from selling the cow when it grows big enough. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $400 to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Cruz del Médano, perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia Lambayeque, ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, adicionalmente vende chicha de jora (bebida típica de la zona hecha a base de maíz) y comida en su vivienda. Estas actividades le proveen de ingresos económicos que utiliza en el mantenimiento de su familia, ya que sus padres son de edad avanzada y ella vela por ellos.

Carmen cría sus aves en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las vende a los negociantes que frecuentan eventualmente la zona en la que vive. Algunas veces los sacrifica para vender comida y chicha a los trabajadores que llegan a la zona a trabajar en los campos de cultivo.

Carmen desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales para captar mas ingresos y seguir apoyando a sus padres, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de aves de corral y su respectivo alimento para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre busca la manera de agenciarse de ingresos para salir adelante. En la zona en donde vive ella es muy estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos, que la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen is 46 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the small town of Cruz del Médano, of the Mórrope district, in the province of Lambayeque, located forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For three years she has been raising and selling poultry. She also sells chicha de jora (a traditional drink from the area made from corn) and food from her home. These activities provide her with income that she uses to support her family. Her parents are elderly and she takes care of them. Carmen raises her birds in the back of her house and she sells them to merchants who frequent the area where she lives. Sometimes she sacrifices them to sell food and chicha to the workers who come to the area to work in the fields. Carmen wants to grow her business of raising and selling animals to have more income and continue supporting her parents. That it why she has found it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that she plans on investing in purchasing poultry and their respective food to meet her goals. She is a hardworking woman who is always looking for the way to get more income to get ahead. In the area where she lives she is very esteemed by her neighbors and acquaintances. They consider her a trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase poultry and feed to grow her business and rasing and selling birds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married to a farmer and lives with her six dependants. She has received a junior high education.  Mary sells second hand clothes at Abura. Mary uses the income she generates from her sales to help her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.  Mary will use the loan to purchase additional second hand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, Mary plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. Anta provincia D. Anta departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. ERNESTINA,  La socia es casada y vive con su conyugue y aún no tienen hijos y es uno D. sus grandes sueños el poder tenerlos, mientras Nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales menores, Nuestra socia tiene terrenos D. cultivos en Anta, ella solicita el préstamo para hacer D. esto un capital D. trabajo y aumentar animales menores tales como algunos cuyes y aves D. corral, para la venta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ernestina belongs to the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” ("Virgin of the Immaculate Conception") communal bank. She lives in the district of Anta, in Anta province, in the department of Cusco. Ernestina is married and lives with her husband. They do not yet have children, and one of their great dreams is to be able to have some. In the meantime, Ernestina works in agriculture and raises small livestock. She has fields in Anta where she grows her crops. She is requesting the loan in order to use the funds as working capital and increase the number of small animals she is raising to sell, such as guinea pigs and poultry. She values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to paying off the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital; buying more small livestock, such as guinea pigs and poultry

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teófila tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de La  Victoria, un distrito próximo a la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocido por ser uno de los mas poblados de la región.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta de flores en el mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de viaje del lugar en donde vive. Ella va al mencionado centro de abasto todos los dias para ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de flores que suelen utilizarse para diversas ocasiones. Para mantener su negocio ella siempre suele ofrecer flores frescas y un buen trato a sus clientes, las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza para apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Teófila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas flores de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias con las cuales su familia pueda seguir progresando, para lograr su objetivo ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Teófila es una mujer amable y que gusta mucho de su trabajo, ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas, por lo que es cobsiderada como una exelente cliente.
texts.en:
Teofila is 47 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and their children in the district of La Victoria, near the city of Chiclayo and known to be one of the most populated districts of the region. She has worked for more than two years selling flowers in the market of the city of Cayaltí, located about an hour's journey from where she lives. She goes to this wholesale market every day to offer to her clients a wide variety of flowers that they frequently use for various occasions. To maintain her business she always makes sure to offer fresh flowers and good service to her clients. The earnings she receives from this work are used to help her husband in maintaining their household. Teofila wants to expand her business with the purchase of more flowers so that she can increase her sales and receive increased earnings with which her family can continue progressing. To achieve this goal she has requested a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Teofila is a friendly woman who likes her work a lot. She has worked before with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in her payments, for which she is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy in season flowers to expand her business of selling flowers.

loans.name: Ines Magdalena

texts.es:
Inés de 42 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene cuatro hijos y su esposo es albañil, ella tiene una tienda pero por la inseguridad que hay en el sector por donde vive a tenido con enrejar casi todo el local y dejar solo un espacio para atender a los clientes. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella hace tubo que invertir sus ahorros y empezar a vender los productos en su casa. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha agrandado su tienda. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas oportunidades de incrementar su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz y bebidas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su negocio y así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Inés is 42 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. She has four children and her husband is a mason. She owns a store but because of the lack of security in the area where she lives, she had to put metal grating up around almost the whole store, leaving only a small window to serve her customers through. Because of the lack of opportunities available to her, Inés decided to invest her savings and start to sell products from her house. Little by little, with much effort and dedication, she has expanded her store. Now she works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. In order to have more opportunities to grow her business, she would like to use this loan to buy rice and drinks for her store. In the future, she wants to expand her business so that she can secure her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Mrs. Phoem C., 63, lives in Roluos village, Takeo Province, where she and her husband, Mr. Muth Poan, are farmers who cultivate rice on a small plot of land they own to earn a small income to support their family living.  Phoem is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and a cow for breeding. This couple has two children, both staff workers in a casino club. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and a cow

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: T. akou est une femme célibataire et dynamique, elle vit dans le quuartier de Agou qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. pour se prendre en charge et satisfaire ses propres besoins, elle a  entamé le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 3 ans déjà. son stock actuel est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 2 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d'huile, 3 cartons de tomates et 2 sacs de sucre. avec ce stock elle compte accroître ses recettes.
texts.en:
T. Akou is an energetic woman who is unmarried and living in Agou, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. To support herself, she started working in the commerce of groceries. She has been in this business for three years already. Akou's inventory is currently low. She would like to stock up again. This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 2 sacks of rice, 2 containers of oil, 3 boxes of tomatoes, and 2 sacks of sugar. With this inventory, she expects to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina C. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Tugas, Madredijos, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and a pig fattening business. Her 40 year old husband, Ledeganio C., works as a carpenter to earn his living and he also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children, 13 to 18 years old. 

Ma. Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000. She intends to use the funds as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the family's future, to be able to afford a good education for their children and to fight the daily battle of their lives. Ma. Gina C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Gladis; ella tiene 37 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos la socia es natural de Pintacha, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, La socia compra al por mayor dulces y todo tipo de golosinas y los vende afuera del colegio en Urubamba, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; she lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Gladis is 37-years-old. She lives with her partner and has two children. She's originally from Pintacha and she works in retail. She buys candy wholesale and sells it outside the Urubamba secondary school. She's requesting this loan to buy merchandise. She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jaspher

texts.en:
Jaspher, who has a mixed farm in Nyamira town in western Kenya, has been farming for the last nine years and has employed one farmhand.  His mixed farm produces milk, bananas, maize and beans which he sells at a local market. He also earns income from his hotel business in the same area.

Jaspher is 30 years old and is married with three school-aged children.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for his children and to improve the livelihood of the family. In the future, he hopes to acquire more agricultural land and plans to buy five more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S., 55, is married with two children living at home in the Takeo province. He and his wife make and sell piggy banks, typically making US $2 each day. This family is also supported by one child who works as a garment factory worker and makes US $2.50 per day. Sorn S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike to transport piggy banks to sell at the market. 

Sorn S. was not available for the picture; that is why his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Thiaba Khoye

texts.fr: Madame Thiaba Khoye S. est une dame de 44 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 18 et 25 ans. Suite  aux conseils d’un parent elle a adopté l’activité de commerce par passion. Par conséquent elle exerce  la vente de produits cosmétiques depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mars 2000. Elle a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de s’approvisionner en produits cosmétiques. Ces produits seront placés auprès de sa clientèle. Elle souhaite augmenter ses bénéfices, conquérir d’autres parts de marchés et améliorer sa situation  familiale sur le plan social.
texts.en:
Ms. Thiaba Khoye S. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the town of Yoff.  She is married and the mother of two children, who are 18 and 25 years old.  Following the advice of one her parents, she took on work in commerce and with a passion.  As a result, she has been excelling at selling cosmetics for over five years.  She has been a member of the Yoff branch since March 2000.  

She has already repaid three previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs with the goal of stocking up on cosmetics.  These goods will be delivered to her customers.  She would like to increase her profits, capture other markets, and improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: Increasing her funds

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Mrs. Saturnina L. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old, married, and has two adult and two school-aged children. To make a living, Saturnina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Saturnina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,995 PHP from PMPC.

Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd. She sells terry cloth robes and women’s lingerie in the central marketplace of her hometown. She has been in this business for 10 years. Lidiya’s husband is actively helping her with the sales. 

Lidiya is seeking a loan of 10,000 grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for retail sale in her vending pavilion. She has the rich experience and practical skills to present her merchandise in a way that will attract more clients. Lidiya is planning to invest the profit in further expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 28 years of age. She is married to A. M. who is a government employee with meager income. She belongs to Sahiwal which is famous for its cow species. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Essa nagri. She shifted here after her marriage few years ago. She supports her family by doing sewing work. She works very hard all day to fulfill orders on time and to earn income for her family. She has five children; four daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

Samina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine. She will also hire a worker who will assist her in finishing orders on time. EID season is on and she has received a large order to fill. She hopes that with this loan investment she will be able to get the better financial results from her business. This is her second loan application. She has built a good credit reputation and has never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Samina.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Pilipog Cordova, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business, a fishing and fish-selling business and a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband Danny B., who is 39 years old, is an overseas contract worker. They have two children who are 15 and 16 years old. 

Anacleta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anacleta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18000, to buy fishing materials so that she can continue to save for the future and expand her business. Anacleta B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Andrea Mercedes

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija en Puerto Malabrigo, una zona pesquera que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de artículos de uso personal como prendas de vestir, perfumes y calzado para damas y caballeros, ella cuenta con un stock fijo el cual comercializa entre sus clientes por pedidos. Ella trabaja tanto al contado como al crédito, esta actividad le permite sentirse activa y ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Andrea desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alterntiva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Andrea is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and daughter in Puerto Malabrigo, a fishing district which is located in Ascope province, in La Libertad region.  It is more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Andrea has been selling personal items such as clothes, perfume and men's and women's footwear for one year.  She has a fixed stock which she sells to her customers through an order system.  She provides her goods for cash or on credit.  This activity helps her to feel active and allows her to help her husband with their family finances.

Andrea would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to fill her customer demand.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Janeth Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Janeth A. F. tiene una tienda en el municipio de Puerto Colombia. Esta es una pequeña ciudad costera en la que a principio del siglo veinte funcionó el más importante puerto marítimo del país. La microempresaria es peluquera de profesión y durante muchos años trabajó en varios salones de estética. Hace cinco años su esposo, que era vendedor en un almacén de electrodomésticos, perdió su empleo y fue ahí cuando nació la idea de crear su propio negocio. En un principio el surtido de víveres era pequeño, pero con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando, al igual que la adquisición de vitrinas, estantes y refrigeradores. Hoy en día la señora Janeth alterna su oficio de tendera con el servicio a domicilio de peluquera. Este es el tercer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva que planea invertirlo en la compra de víveres en general, siempre se ha distinguido por su excelente puntualidad. El negocio tiene un volumen mensual de ventas de $ 5.000.000 COP y el margen promedio de utilidad es del 20%. La señora Janeth planea para el próximo año alquilar un local más grande para trasladar la tienda y adecuar el sistema de autoservicio. Ella manifiesta que disfruta mucho su actividad de tendera porque le permite estar en permanente contacto con los vecinos de su comunidad, por lo cual, su mayor satisfacción no es la utilidad económica que le genera su microempresa, sino el aprecio que le dispensan todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Janeth A. F. has a store in the town of Puerto Colombia.  This is a small coastal town which, at the beginning of the twentieth century, was home to the most important shipping port in the country.  This small businesswoman is a hairdresser by profession and, over many years, she worked in several beauty salons.  Five years ago her husband, who was a salesman in an electrical appliance store, lost his job and this was when the idea to create her own business was born.

At first, the store was not very well stocked with foodstuffs but, over time, it improved.  Janeth also acquired display cases, shelves and refrigerators.  Now she divides her time between her trade as a shopkeeper and her hairdressing services which she offers in people's homes.

This is Janeth's third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She plans to invest the money in buying general foodstuffs.  She has always been noted for her excellent punctuality.  Her business has a monthly sales volume of 5,000,000 Colombian pesos and her average profit margin is 20%.  Janeth plans, next year, to rent larger premises so that she can transfer her store and adapt the self-service system.  She says that she enjoys her business as a shopkeeper a lot because it allows her to be in permanent contact with the neighbors in her community.  Her greatest satisfaction is not the money that her small business makes but rather the appreciation that her customers all show her.

loans.use: To buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Genalin

texts.en:
Genalin G. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 31 years old, married, and has 4 school aged children. Genalin operates a family member's business, making and selling peanut butter in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Genalin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase raw materials for her business. Genalin is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase peanuts, containers and other ingredients for her peanut butter business. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Genalin from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, containers and other ingredients

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
la sra. Veronica L. E. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad capital y se dedica a la elabracion de vestidos, pantalones, blusas, sacos, trajes, etc. pero su fuerte es la fabricacion de vestidos para 15 años y vestidos para bodas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
tiene muchas clientes fijas que les elabora Trajes formales para trabajar, Veronica es muy conocida en su colonia y muchas clientes por el buen acabado de sus prendas la recomiendan.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las prendas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica L. E. is 38 years old and lives in the Sagastume subdivision of the capital city. She makes dresses, trousers, blouses, jackets, suits, and other garments. Her specialty is making dresses, which she has done for 15 years, including wedding dresses. Veronica’s business is located in her home. She has several established customers for whom she makes formal suits for work. Veronica is well-known in her subdivision and has many customers who recommend the good design of her garments.

This loan will be used to buy materials for making garments. She needs the income to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, lace, trimming, veils, decorations, buttons, sponges, and cardboard

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia, D. 65 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Julio D. 30 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad D. vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Zenovia trata D. cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su hijo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y gladiolos, los cuales venden en el mercado central D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras D. la plaga D. insectos, lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donD. los venD., ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará sacos D. semillas D. arveja, en lo cual invertirá todo el dinero.
texts.en:
Zenovia, age 65, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. She lives in her own home with her beloved son Julio, age 30, for whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life. Zenovia works hard every day on her crops so that she can change her current standard of living. Together with her son she grows beans, corn, and gladiolas each season and sells them at the central market in Tarma, where she is able to obtain the best prices. What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from insects. Zenovia has been farming for 45 years and considers the most difficult part to be hauling her crops to the markets where she sells since the sacks are very heavy. Going forward, she hopes to improve her products so that she can obtain better prices.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels this loan will be a benefit to her growth as a farmer. In her Communal Bank, Zenovia is a very active and supportive member. With a loan of 800 PEN, she will buy sacks of seeds for planting peas.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Mrs. Paen Noeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty people who live in Trapeang Roka village in TaK. province. Mrs. Paen N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members in the group.   The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their famiL. living. 

Mrs. Paen N. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her famiL..  She has free time outside farming and  wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money. To achieve this purpose, Mrs. Paen N. is seeking a loan to buy five piglets and pig food to start a new pig breeding business.  Her husband, Mr. Sarun Bach, is a motorcycle taxi driver. This couple supports two children, who are both employed in garment factories.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 34 años, nacida en el distrito de Quimbiri; convive con Nerio de 33 años de edad y tienen 05 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa ubicada en la localidad de Nueva Esperanza caserío del distrito de Quimbiri. Hilda y su pareja Nerio son el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, Hilda es campesina y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café, achiote y hojas de coca; plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 17 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad es no poder contar con la maquina despulpadora de café que es de utilidad para descascarar los granos del café; es por ello que acude a MFP para concederle el crédito. En adelante, desea incrementar sus sembrios con plantas de café ya que cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno no cultivado. Este su Primer crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad. Con los tres nuevos soles solicitados, comprará maquina despulpadora  para descarar los granos del café.
texts.en: Hilda, 34, is a native of the Peruvian district of Quimbiri.  She lives with Nerio, 33, and their 5 children in a house that they own in Nueva Esperanza, a town in Quimbiri.  Hilda and Nerio support the family.  Hilda has been a farmer--work that she learned from her parents--since she was a girl.  She owns 4 hectares of land where she grows coffee, achiote and coca, all plants native to the Rio Apurimac valley in the Peruvian Amazon.  She started working the land for herself 17 years ago.  At harvest time, she can count on the help of both her children and temporary day laborers who she needs to get her crop in quickly.  Hilda likes harvesting her crops because the harvest is her reward for many months of working hard to grow the very best crop she can.  The most difficult thing about the business, she says, is getting the crop from her fields to the market in the town of San Francisco where she can get the best price for her crop.  Her immediate problem is that she doesn't have the equipment she needs to process her coffee beans.  She is applying to MFP for a loan to buy the equipment she needs.  She has 2 hectares of uncultivated land and, in the future, she wants to plant more coffee there.  This is Hilda's first MFP loan.  She knows that she has to repay this loan on time to secure future loans.  She will use the loan to buy equipment for her coffee planting business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for processing coffee beans

loans.name: Diamante Verde Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Diamante Verde, está integrado por 7 personas:
*Caritina Rayón F. va a comprar con su préstamo artículos de papelería cuadernos, lápices, colores, pegamento, gomas, tijeras, reglas, etc. 
*Alicia H. A. va a comprar abono por carro para fertilizar su nopal y pueda producir más y así vender.
*Carolina A. Rayón va a comprar insecticida, abono para darle mantenimiento al nopal
*Candelaria T. Martínez va a comprar penca de nopal para comenzar a sembrar nopal y compra de abono por bulto
*Faustino H. T. va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su producto y abonarlo para producir más nopal
*Román A. R. va a comprar abono orgánico por carro para fertilizar su producto de nopal
*Verónica Bautista González va a comprar mercancía azúcar por bulto, huevo por kilo, aceite por litro, sal, papel higiénico, arroz para surtir su tienda. 
El señor Román A. R. tiene 41 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos Brandon de 14 años de edad y Saira de 18 años de edad los dos no estudian terminaron la secundaria y ya no quisieron estudiar, el señor Román tiene su parcela de nopal y se dedica a vender nopal, el solicitó su préstamo para comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su producto y tenga mucha producción de nopal. Él inicio su negocio hace 15 años porque vieron que si da ganancias y se vende mucho, de su negocio pudo comprar herramienta y su camioneta, la parcela que tiene fue herencia de su papá además él le enseño a trabajar en el campo todo lo relacionado con el nopal.
Las ganancias las utiliza para ir ampliando su negocio, sembrar mas nopales y si se puede comprar otro terreno, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son las heladas.
Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por confiar en nosotros”.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Diamante Verde' (Green Diamond) and has 7 members:
*Caritina Rayón F., who will use her loan to buy stationery products such as exercise books, pencils, colored pencils, glue, erasers, scissors, rulers, etc.
*Alicia H. A., who will use her loan to buy manure by the cartload to fertilize her prickly pear cactus crop so that she can produce more and sell it.
*Carolina A. Rayón, who will buy insecticides and manure for her prickly pear crop.
*Candelaria T. Martínez, who will buy prickly pear stalks so that she can start growing prickly pear cacti.  She will also buy manure.
*Faustino H. T., who will buy organic manure to fertilize her crops so that she produces more prickly pear.
*Román A. R., who will buy organic manure by the cartload to fertilize her prickly pear crop.
*Verónica Bautista González, who will buy sugar in bulk, eggs by the kilo, oil by the liter, salt, toilet paper and rice to stock her store. 

Román A. R. is 41 years old and has 2 children: 14 year-old Brandon and 18 year-old Saira.  Neither of them are studying.  They finished their secondary education and didn't want to study any more.  Román has a plot of land where he grows prickly pear cacti.  His business is selling prickly pear.  He requested his loan to buy organic manure to fertilize his crop so can increase his prickly pear production.  Román started his business 15 years ago because he saw that the crop was profitable and sold well.  Through his business, he has been able to buy tools and a truck.  His plot of land was inherited from his dad who taught him everything he needed to know about growing prickly pear cacti.  Román uses his profits to expand his business, grow more prickly pear cacti and, if possible, he will buy another plot of land.  The challenge that he faces in his business is frost.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for trusting us".

loans.use: to buy organic manure by the cartload to fertilize their prickly pear cacti

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
Elver tiene 29 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 menores hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores como ovejas chivos, chanchos y aves de corral. Realiza esta actividad en el terreno cerca de su casa. Compra los animales en los alrededores de su comunidad para luego engordarlos y venderlos en la ciudad de Olmos o enviarlos a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cuenta con una experiencia de 4 años en este rubro. Su esposa lo apoya en esta actividad. Desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ventas e ingresos para seguir cuidando a su familia y brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elver, 29, lives in his own house with his wife and two minor children in Olmos District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over and hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  He lives in the rural part of the district and does not have running water or electricity.

He raises small farm animals, like sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl, to sell.  He does this on a piece of property near his house.  He buys the animals in communities adjacent to his community to fatten them up and later sell them in the city of Olmos or send them to the city of Chiclayo.  He’s been in this line of work for 4 years.  His wife helps him.

He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.  With this investment he will be able to increase sales and income to continue caring for his family and providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Gumercinda tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijas, ambas mayores de edad, vive cerca del centro de la ciudad de Itá donde posee una despensa desde hace más de 6 años, allí surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar, como por ejemplo azúcar, yerba, carbón, lácteos, bebidas en general, fideo, embutidos y otras mercaderías.
Su hija la ayuda a atender la despensa cuando ella va al mercado y realiza la compra de mercaderías, en el centro de Itá, para reponer sus productos vendidos.
Posee mucha clientela, y sus ventas las realiza al contado.
Ella opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2006, demostrando puntualidad en el pago de todas sus cuotas. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para su despensa.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 45 years old, married, and has two grown-up daughters.  She lives near Itá city center where she has owned a grocery store for more than six years.  There she serves her neighbors and other customers with basic household products such as sugar, yerba, charcoal, dairy products, drinks, noodles, cold cuts and other merchandise.  Her daughter helps her by serving in the store when she goes to the market in the center of Itá to buy merchandise to replace the products she has sold.

Gumercinda has a lot of customers and she sells her products for cash.  She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2006 and has shown punctuality in making all of her repayments.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, yerba, charcoal, dairy products, drinks, cold cuts and other merchandise

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Isaias; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de servicio de taxi, el tiene un carro que hace servicio urbano de la ciudad de Cusco al distrito de Chinchero y también trabaja como chofer trabajando en otros carros haciendo servicio de taxi, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de servicio de taxi.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Mateo Pumacahua". It is located in the district of Chinchero, belonging to the province of Urubamba and to the department of Cusco.

His name is Isaias. He is 28 years old, married common-law, and he has 1 child. He alternates his daily activities with his taxi services business. He has a car with which he provides urban transport from the city of Cusco to the district of Chinchero. He also works as a driver using other cars to provide taxi services. He wants to expand and improve his taxi services business. He requests a loan to carry out maintenance repairs to his car.

He is happy for the loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to his car.
