loans.name: Cesario

texts.en:
Cesario is 49 years old and is a married man with 4 children. The oldest child is 19 years old. 

Cesario is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice to sell. He earns about 4,000 PHP per month from doing this farming.

This loan will be used by Cesario to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. In the future, he hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Alamouta Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même quartier. leur activité tourne au tour de la vente de l'huile de palme, de jus de citron, de petit déjeuner et de patte d'arachide.

Madame Aissatou debout la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en charge quatre autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par ses proches.

Elle s'active dans le commerce de poissons frais depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital afin de mieux développer son activité.

Les bénéfices lui permettront à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on October 19, 2001. It is composed of women who live in the same neighborhood. Their businesses involve selling palm oil, lemon juice, breakfasts, and peanut butter.  

Madame Aissatou, standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 52, married and the mother of five children. She is also raising four other children who were confided to her by those around her. 

She has been selling fresh fish for several years. This loan will allow her to increase her capital so that she can expand her business. The profit will permit her to help her husband pay for food for the family.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Rosa Enriqueta

texts.es: Rosa Enriqueta tiene su actividad es una pulpería. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda que es en la comunidad bethel, ella Comenzó con muy poco capital, vendiendo Golosinas, dulces, entre otros ya que su principales clientes eran los alumnos de un colegio que esta frente a su casa, con el tiempo las personas comenzaron a pedirles otros productos y así fue comprando y aumentando su capital  de trabajo y activos fijos del negocio, con los financiamiento que ha obtenido ha mejorado su negocio, sus clientelas son mayores  y tiene un mayor inventario. El crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas y detergentes.
texts.en: Rosa Enriqueta has a grocery store located in her home which is in the community of Bethel.  She started the business with very little capital selling snacks and candy, among others, since her main customers were students at a school across from her house.  In time, people started asking for other products and this is how she eventually started buying and increasing her working capital and the fixed assets of the business.  With the loans she has gotten she’s improved the business, she has more customers and her inventory is larger.  The loan will be used to buy basic grains, soft drinks, snacks and detergents.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es: Salvadora tiene 60 años, su actividad es la venta refrescos y gaseosas. Tiene más de 27 años, de tener este negocio. es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de ofrecer este servicio a sus diferentes clientes, además de enfrentar desafío como es que algunas veces tiene que levantarse enferma para ir a trabajar en su local, pero esto no la desanima para salir adelante. el crédito que solicita es para la compra de jugos, frutas, bolsas, pajillas, gaseosas, pan, galletas entre otros.
texts.en: Salvadora is 60 years old. She sells soft drinks and sodas. She has been in this line of business for over 27 years. She is a very enterprising person and enjoys providing this service to her customers. She faces some challenges, such as sometimes having to get out of bed to go to work in spite of feeling ill, but she is not discouraged and wants to get ahead. The loan requested is for the purchase  of juices, fruits, bags, straws, soda, bread, cookies and more.

loans.use: to buy  juices, fruits, bags, straws, soda, bread, cookies and more.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre trabajador de 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres quienes son agricultores. La casa está ubicada en una pequeña comunidad rural, del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, que no cuenta con los servicios básicos de saneamiento y electricidad.

Wilmer se dedica a  la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, que luego comercializa a los pobladores de la zona y en el mercado de la localidad. Wilmer cuenta con clientela establecida y tiene mucha esperanza en su negocio, es por ello que ha decidido invertir en él.

Wilmer solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar  más ovejas, pues cuenta con suficiente espacio para criarlas. Wilmer goza de buenas referencias personales debido al empreño  que realiza en su labor.  Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues le será de gran ayuda.

Wilmer tiene muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a hard-working 28-year-old man, who is single, and lives in the house of his parents who are farmers. Their house is located in a small rural community in the Tambogrande-Piura district that has basic sanitary sewer and electricity services.

Wilmer raises sheep and farm fowl, then sells them in the local market to the residents of the zone. Wilmer counts on an established clientèle and has much hope for his business. It is for that reason that he decided to invest in it.

Wilmer approached Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,000 new sols to buy more sheep, since he has sufficient space to raise them.  Wilmer has good personal references, owing to the effort he puts into his work. He would be very grateful if we conceded the credit, since it will be of great help to him.

Wilmer has much desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Adelia has been in this business for 12 years. Adelia earns more income from her variety store.

Adelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 44 years old and lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with four children.
To earn a living, Elvira has a junk business. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she  earns approximately PHP 7,000.00. Elvira has requested a loan if PHP 20,000 to purchase junk items. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.
In the future, Elvira hopes to have enough savings to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase junk items

loans.name: Noelia Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. Noelia requiere su crédito para dar a su vivienda acabados exteriores ya que con el paso de los años la pintura de su casa se ha ido cayendo, nos comenta que la constructora utilizo material de construcción de muy baja calidad por lo que con el tiempo las paredes se han ido deteriorando, para ella es importante conservar su casa en buen estado ya que dice que es el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Noelia is requesting a loan so that she can have the exterior finishes completed around her home. As the years have passed, the paint job on her house has changed color. She says that the builder used construction materials that of very low quality so the walls of her house have deteriorated over time.

Noelia says that it is important to her that her house remains in good condition because she plans to leave it as an inheritance for her children.

loans.use: to complete the exterior finishes around her home.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Juana;  tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia es distribuidora de la empresa de salud Herba life desde hace 2 años, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y a puesto mucho empeño y trabaja para promocionar la empresa y los productos naturales de salud, la socia actualmente se encuentra promocionando una nuevo producto el cual ha tenido muy buena acogida en la sociedad así que esta vez ella requiere el préstamo para cubrir la demanda y comprar los productos al por mayor para luego de ello distribuirlos entre sus clientes y amistades. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de salud para la distribución.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SAN RAFAEL" communal bank, which is located in the District of Huanchac, in the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.

The member is Juana; she is 37 years old.  The member is married with two children.  The member has been a distributor for the health business Herba Life for the last two years.  She is a very hard-working woman, and puts in much determination and hard work to promote the business and the natural health products.

Currently the member is promoting a new product which has been very well-received by society.  And so on this occasion, she is requesting the loan to cover demand and to buy products at wholesale to resell later to her customers and friends.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of health products for resale.

The member is grateful for the help that is being offered to her, and similarly she agrees to comply with her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of health products for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old and a married woman having three children. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for 18 years. According to her, she is in charge of caring for their children because her husband is away due to his work. She would like to improve her hog-raising business to be able to provide for the needs of her children and send them to higher levels of education. 

Sonia would like to make her dreams come true by asking for additional working capital amounting to P6,000. This amount would really help her to attain her dream in life. She will be using her requested loan in buying feed for her piglets. She hopes that her raised piglets will sell for a higher price so that she can cover their daily needs and pay their monthly electric bills.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly (in the photo) and her husband, Khan, have been married since 1997 and have one daughter who is a garment worker. They are living in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Ly now stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her daughter’s salary and her husband’s business. Her husband is a mason. Ly is applying for her second loan, for $300, to purchase a cow to raise. She hopes she will be able to earn extra income from selling calves when the cow delivers a baby.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. tortas y galletas, ella prepara tortas y bocaditos para diferentes eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños entre otros compromisos, ella es propietaria D. un local que atienD. desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. tortas y bocaditos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como mantequilla, azúcar, harina y utensilios.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Hatun Rumiyoc communal bank, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Victoria is 57 years old, married, and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling cakes and cookies.  She makes cakes and snacks for different events like weddings and birthdays, among other events.  She is the owner of a place that she attends to from 9:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

She wants to expand and improve her business of selling cakes and snacks.  She is requesting the loan to buy supplies like butter, sugar, flour, and utensils.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy butter, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and a father for three children.

Ayed has owned a gallery for rental tables, chairs and canvas since 2004. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he has sufficient experience in this field. His gallery is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $2,000 in order to purchase a large generator and to add more rental items. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large generator and to add more rental items.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Having been in the cattle business for such a long time, Richard decided to diversify his income by venturing into timber trading. He has been in this new business for two years and the business is promising. Richard needs the loan facility to purchase timber for resale.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Gemma has a shop that sells breads, snacks and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy breads, snacks and a sack of rice.
Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, snacks and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, 24, is married woman with two children, aged two and six, one of whom is in school. She has had a pub business in Kator, South Sudan for three years.

Flora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer for her pub. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house and pay her child's school fees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer and local alcohol for resale.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta, necesita mejorar el negocio, invirtiendo en los materiales mas necesarios como maiz, tomates, papas, chile, carnes, condimentos, gas propano,esto le ayudara para incrementar su produccion de alimentos, mejorando la atencion y el servicio hacia los clientes.
Ella ha incrementado sus ganancias en el negocio y sus clientes estan satisfechos con el servicio, tambien su familia ha sido beneficiada con este progreso de Marta.
texts.en:
Marta needs to improve her business by investing in necessary supplies such as corn, tomatoes, potatoes, chili peppers, meat, condiments, and propane gas. This will help increase her production of food and improve the service she provides to her customers.

Marta will increase her earnings from her business and her customers will be satisfied with the service. As a result of this progress, her family will also benefit.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomatoes, potatoes, chili peppers, meat, condiments, and propane gas.

loans.name: Elizabeth Cristina

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth a sus 28 años de edad es madre de un hijo de un año de nacido, actualmente no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de su bebe, por lo cual debe trabajar día a día para conseguir el sustento para su familia, es así como desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de mercancía tal como ropa para dama y caballero, lociones y relojes, este negocio surgió como idea de la experiencia previa de siete años atrás que la señora Elizabeth trabajó como vendedora en un almacén. Para la temporada de fin de año, necesita de la compra de surtido con la esperanza de poder así mejorar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y padres. El sueño de la señora Elizabeth es tener su propio almacén y generar empleos a sus familiares en éste.
texts.en: Señora Elizabeth is 28 years and is the mother of a one-year-old son. Now she does not have the support of the father of her baby, so she needs to work day by day to obtain sustenance for her family. Thus for the last year she has been selling merchandise such as clothing for women and men, lotions, and watches. The idea for this business came from her previous experience of seven years ago when she worked as a salesperson in a store. For the end-of-year season, she needs to buy stock with the hope of being able to thus improve her sales and improve the quality of life of her son and her parents. The dream of Señora Elizabeth is to have her own store and create jobs for her family members there.

loans.use: to buy stock such as clothing for men and women, lotions, and watches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman who has three children. Melanie is 27 years old and resides in Tabid, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Melanie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 1,500 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional products to sell. 

Recently, Melanie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Melanie wants to make improvements to her house and to her business too.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: La socia  Edelmira; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de bebidas y de comidas, la socia elabora las diferentes comidas y las sigue llevando a vender a la feria. La socia desea poder invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos e ingredientes como arroz, azucar, fideos, aceite y continuara elaborando sus potajes para la venta y comprar gaseosas para increentar sus ventas. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de gaseosas y de ingredientes para elaborar sus diversos potajes.
texts.en: Edelmira continues with her business  buying and selling beverages and food.  She makes a variety of dishes that she continues to take to the street markets to sell.  She wants to use the loan to buy supplies and ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles and oil to continue making her dishes to sell and to buy soft-drinks to increase her sales.  She’s asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of soft-drinks and ingredients to make her various dishes.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 20 years. She describes herself as an honest, God-fearing, and obedient woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits such as peas and avocados. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is at a strategic location. She is facing a business challenge of a shortage of fruits for resale.

Hellen will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fruit from farmers. Her business goal is to be a fruit supplier within 5 years. In the future, she hopes to build her own house, buy herself a new car, and create job opportunities in her business using the ancticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy fruit from farmers.

loans.name: Edikpo Marie Salomé's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Edikpo Marie Salomé (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 64 ans et est mariée à un certain Célestin. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Les différentes charges de la maison sont supportées par Edikpo Marie Salomé et son mari. Pour cette raison, Edikpo Marie Salomé vend des produits vivriers et du charbon de bois à son domicile depuis vingt ans. Edikpo Marie Salomé s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Edikpo Marie Salomé ensemble avec le second membre de son groupe, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers.

loans.name: Gbedayi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDAYI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Maximilia Bernadette, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 33 ans est mariée à un certain Mohamed. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Maximilia Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Maximilia Bernadette et son mari. Maximilia Bernadette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour ce faire, Maximilia Bernadette vend des divers produits(sucre, lait, biscuits) depuis six ans. Maximilia Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Maximilia Bernadette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDAYI un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 18 years old and lives with her parents in Pangani District, Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in her nearby secondary school to help students with life skills. Maria requests a Kiva loan to start a business selling detergent (soap) near her village. Maria plans to use the profits obtained from the loan to expand her business and one day become a detergent wholesaler.

loans.use: to start a business of selling detergent (soap) near her village.

loans.name: Nadjegueton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe NADJEGUETON 2 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
 lles sont à leur 7éme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Monsieur Siriki en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 700 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et payer les frais de labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to buy animal feeds to increase productivity.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has three children who all attend school. Eunice dropped out of school in level 8 due to lack of school fees. She cares for the five children of her brother and sister who passed away.

She seeks a loan to expand her business and diversify it which will enable her to attract more customers. She also wants to expand her business to reach out to other markets.

She intends to use the profit to help her family with medical care, clothing, and savings for future use.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Mrs. Chey R. P. is a 35 year old widow living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.  Her business is in renting out small rooms to garment factory workers.  This gives her about $5/day of income, which is just enough to support her 1 child in school, and also her mother that lives with her.  She would like to have this loan so that she can build more rooms for renting.  This will increase her income, and she has enough free time to manage the building of the rooms, as well as managing basic landlord responsibilities.  In the future, she hopes to open a grocery shop with a large variety of products.

loans.use: To build more rooms for rental

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José Daniel is married and has two small children who are 6 and 7 years old. Previously, he used to work for a gas company, but four years ago on his son's birthday, José wanted to rent a children's show for his party but could not find any that he liked. He bought some costumes of different characters and a sound device and put on the show himself. Afterwards, he started to offer his services with the help of his nephews and his wife, who made the costumes. Little by little, he accumulated and bought everything he needed for making spectacular shows.

These days, José is seeking a loan of $375, which will be used to buy more material to make more costumes and thus, create new personae that children like. He promises to repay this loan in 4 months. Be an important part of developing this unique business. Make the decision to support José. He and his family sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

José Daniel es casado y tiene dos pequeños de 6 y 7 años de edad. Anteriormente él trabajaba en una compañía de gas, pero hace cuatro años en el cumpleaños de su hijo, José quería rentar un show infantil para su fiesta pero no encontró alguno de su agrado, fue así como adquirió disfraces de algunos personajes, un aparato de sonido, y él mismo hizo el show. Después empezó a ofrecer sus servicios con ayuda de sus sobrinos y de su esposa que elabora los disfraces, poco a poco fue adquiriendo todo lo necesario para hacer más atractivos sus espectáculos.

En estos momentos José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de material que necesita para elaborar más disfraces y tener los personajes nuevos que son del agrado de los niños, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio especial, decídete a apoyar a José, él y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy material to make costumes and disguises

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en: Emeline is a young woman of twenty-nine years of age and she has three children. Two of them are in school and the youngest is eight months old. It is a big challenge for Emeline and her husband to struggle for their family's survival. Emeline has a banana plantation and her husband really works hard in getting the job done. Her part to play is selling their products at the market on Fridays and Saturdays, which they believe are the best selling days of the week. Emeline earns more than four hundred tala a week from her sales and she uses it for her loan payment and to meet her family's needs. She is thankful to the S.P.B.D. office for lending her the money to help out with her business and she is looking forward to more loans in order to develop her plantation and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, ladders, boots, knives, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: I am Bashiran B. from a small city Arifwala, Paksitan. I am 44, married and a mother of four children. My husband is a rickshaw driver. He bought this rickshaw with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution, last year. He managed to repay all the installments on time. Rickshaw is our major source of income and it is need of repairs now. Please lend us $300 for this purpose.

loans.use: Repair Rickshaw

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Born in 1981, Mr. Komi A. is married and the father of three children. A barber by trade, he is asking for a Kiva loan of US$ 1000 which he plans to use to renovate his barbershop and acquire some up-to-date tools of his trade. This should permit him to expand his clientele and make his business more profitable so that he can do better by his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1981, Monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Coiffeur de formation, il sollicite à travers ce projet un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir à rénover son salon et acquérir d’autres matériels de travail plus performant. Ceci lui permettra d’attirer plus de clientèles et mieux rentabiliser son activité afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use:
Renovation of his workshop and purchase of some tools of his trade

Rénovation de son atelier de coiffure et achat de matériel de travail

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeun S. H., age 22, works as a laborer making around $2 each day. Her husband works as a broker purchasing fruits, mostly bananas, from the growers to resell for a profit. This couple can make collectively around $10 each day of income. They have one child who is too young to attend school. Mrs H. would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fruit to meet their growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Kaksija Ii Group

texts.en:
Dressed in traditional Mayan clothing with babies wrapped in blankets on their back, the women of the community bank Kaksija enter one by one into the home of one of the members, where they gather for their monthly meeting.

They speak rapidly in their native language of K´iche´, and when necessary, the younger members translate from Spanish for the older members of the group. These fourteen women know each other well, having been together for almost eight years.

They dedicate themselves to traditional artisan crafts, primarily to the intricate art of weaving ‘huipiles’, beautiful hand-woven blouses than can take up to a month to produce. They also sew skirts and scarves, such as the ones in the picture.

As members of their community bank, these women have not only become friends and confidants, but they also support each other in business and give advice on loans. If a new member enters the group, the other women make sure that she understands what it means to receive a loan, and the importance of paying back on time. They help each other, sharing business tips and loan advice, ensuring that each member is successful.

Six women of the community bank are asking for a group loan of 16,000 quetzales ($2100), ranging from $150 to $400 per person. They will invest this money in colorful thread for their weaving and one woman is hoping to purchase a sewing machine that will enable her to rapidly increase her productivity, as well as the quality of her product.

All the women have children and they dream of being able to provide them an education so they can have better lives with more opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and a sewing machine

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
Livia, despite having no support from her partner who left her a few years ago when their second son was born, has never felt limited, in fact her situation has helped her to mature and to let herself go by working. Now she has a shop whose business is helping her to cover the household costs and to look after her two kids. Although they are young they have needs and she hopes to fulfill these through her work. She hopes to see her business grow and to improve her products, and she would like a loan as it would help her to make her business sustainable.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

LIVIA, a pesar de no contar con el apoyo de su pareja, quien la abandonó a pocos años del nacimiento de su segundo hijo, no se sintió limitada en ningún aspecto por el contrario este hecho la ayudo a madurar y a desenvolverse de manera eficiente dentro de un entorno laboral. Más ahora posee una tienda cuyo negocio le está ayudando a solventar los gastos de sus dos hijos quienes son aún pequeños y requieren de cuidados y ciertas necesidades que espera satisfacer a través de su trabajo. Ella espera incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus productos y solicita un préstamo que sería de gran ayuda para hacer de su bodega un negocio sostenible.

loans.use: To increase capital to offer better quality products/Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila has always worked in various activities with the aim of creating a stable source of income. For six months she has worked for a local business located in a cafeteria which offers meals to many people. As a result of the dedicated attention that she provides they have increased their sales and have many plans to continue building her small working space. To accomplish this she asks for a loan since she is demonstrating her commitment and strength now.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Dalila siempre ha trabajado en diversas actividades con el propósito de crear una fuente de ingresos estable e instaló hace 6 meses en un local comercial ubicado en un una cafetería en la cual ofrece menús a muchas personas y por la atención dedicada que brinda han aumentado sus ventas y tiene muchos planes de seguir implementando su pequeño espacio de trabajo, para lograrlo solicita un préstamo ya que su compromiso y esfuerzo están manifestados desde ahora.

loans.use: Build a small workplace

loans.name: Tarsisia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Tarsisia M.. She is single, and has no children. In 2008, Tarsisia established her takeaway kiosk business. Tarsisia requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, candy, snacks, and phone credit vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soda, candy, ingredients for snacks, as well as phone credit vouchers, for her takeaway kiosk.

loans.name: Djénèba

texts.fr:
Ms. Djénèba B. is 20 years old and lives in her father's home in Mancourani, one of the suburbs the city of Sikasso. After secondary studies punctuated by a diploma, "Brevet de Technicien en Sécretariat de Direction" (office and clerical trades), she decided to work to generate some income, notably from commerce in women's clothing that she has been practicing now for four years.

Because of limited financial means, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program through her mom, who is also one of this institution's loyal clients. She is on her first loan. With this this loan of 150,000 francs CFA, she intends to buy 10 lengths of Wax-brand pagne (colorful print cloth) and 20 suits of men's fabric. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso (a city in the Republic of Burkina Faso in West Africa), then she sells them in bulk to shopkeepers who sell beauty products in the city of Sikasso. This business is run year-round without major difficulty. The turnover is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, Ms. Djénèba B. will ensure that she will cover certain expenses and help her mom.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle Djénèba B. a 20 ans et vit chez son père à Mancourani I un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. Après des études secondaires ponctuées par un diplome de Brevet de Technicien en Sécretariat de Direction, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce d’habits feminins qu’elle exerce depuis maintenant quatre (4) ans.

En raison de la faiblesse de ses moyens financiers, elle intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa maman également une des fidèles clientes de cette Institution. Elle est à son premier pret . Avec ce pret de 150.000 FCFA, elle compte acheter 10 Pièces de pagne Wax et 20 complets de tissus d’homme. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (une ville de la République de Burkina Faso en Afriquede l’ouest), ensuite elle les vend en gros aux detenteurs de boutique de produits de beauté de la ville de Sikasso. Cette activité est menée durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures. La rotation est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA. Grâce à ce bénéfice Mademoiselle Djénèba B. assurera certaines de ses dépenses et aider sa maman.

loans.use: To buy lengths of Wax-brand pagnes

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is the wife of T. H. and has been living in this city Borewala, Pakistan for the last 15 years. She owns a six-room brick house. She is the mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. Her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Najma baji and her husband weave carpets and sell them to different shops. They have been in this profession for the last 5 years. Najma baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy cloth for her carpet business.

She is joined in her loan group by 4 other members. Anayat baji requests a loan to buy fertilizer for her land. Kanizan baji requests a loan to buy bangles to resell. Maqsoodan baji requests a loan to buy car seat covers to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr: Monsieur G. est le Directeur des Cours Privés Mamadou G.. Il contribut à la formation de plus de 500 éléves. Il solliocite ce crédit pour renforcer le parc d'ordinateur de la direction. Ce jeune entrepreneur, marié et pére de 2 enfants, a réalisé de bonnes performances aux examens du BFEM avec un taux de réussite de prés de 56%
texts.en:
Mr. G. is principal of the Mamadou G. Private School. He contributes towards the education of more than 500 students. He is requesting this loan in order to increase the number of computers used by management. This young entrepreneur, who is married with two children, achieved good results in the Certificate of Intermediate Studies examinations, with a pass rate of almost 56%.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the equipment used by management

loans.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juay necesitaba dinero para poder solventar sus gastos, ya que su familia no podía pagárselos y ella quería salir adelante, por lo que hace un año empezó con la venta de zapatos, primero vendiendo solo a sus familiares pero le ha ido muy bien y poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo mas clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Juany podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juay needed money to be able to cover her expenses as her family could not pay them. She wanted to advance in life, which is why one year ago she started selling shoes. First she sold only to her relatives, but it has gone very well for her and little by little she has acquired more clients.

She needs a loan for US $300 which will be re-paid in 6 months to buy merchandise. With your support Juany will be able to continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va S., 26, is married and lives with three young children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a dealer, purchasing rubber, beans and yams and then reselling them to the big dealer in the village to earn a living. She is able to make around US$5 per day, while her husband operates a motor-taxi, earning US$4 per day. One of their children is a student.

Va S. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase produce in bulk. This way, she can save money and also expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase rubber and beans for resale.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K. is a villager in Pong Ro Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who has a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Leang Tiey, owns a small rice mill through which he can earn income. 

Although they have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well. Thus, Mrs. Pov K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a motorbike to start a motorbike taxi business. 

Mrs. Pov K. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings in order to buy a motorbike to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Mwanne K.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Mwanne Chan’ga  from Mbarali. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 8. Mwanne buys crops from farmers and brings them at town where she can sell them at higher price. Mwanne has been running her crop business since 2002.  

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Mwanne currently earns about $45 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $425 USD to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business by adding more quantity and range of the stock . Mwanne thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Mme D. Akouélé est une veuve avec quatre (04) enfants et sept (07) autres personnes à charge. Très brave et courageuse, elle arrive à bien gérer son  commerce de pain. En effet, elle achète du pain en gros chez les boulangers et les revend en détails sur place ou dans les marchés. Mais compte tenu de la mévente et de la cherté de la vie, elle n’arrive plus à bien vendre par manque de fonds propre. Pour relancer son activité d’achat et vente de pain, elle sollicite un financement. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Akouélé D., age 46, is a widow with four children plus seven others to support. A very kind and courageous woman, she manages to do a good job managing her commerce in bread. Basically, she buys bread in bulk from bakers and resells them locally retail or in the marketplaces. But given a drop in sales and the high cost of living, she is no longer able to do well because of a lack of working capital. To reinvigorate her trade in bread, she is requesting financing. This will enable her to support her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell bread

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Каромат 45 летняя женщина, мать четверых детей ,муж работает частным мастером по ремонту домов.Сама Каромат продаёт на рынке Дусти В Сомгаре продукты питания.Этот базар работает всего один раз в неделю.
В остальные дни она занимается уходом за скотом.У неё сейчас 7 баранов и 10 коз.Целыми днями скот у неё посётся на пастбище.А вечером возвращается.Для увеличения скота Каромат решила взять кредит.На закуп скота Каромат ездит на рынок с мужем,т.к. он хорошо разбирается в породистых баранах.
texts.en:
Karomat Y. is a 45-year-old woman and the mother of four children. Her husband has his own home repairs business. Karomat herself sells food products at the Dusti market in Somgar. This bazaar is only open one day a week; on the other days, she cares for her livestock. At present she has seven sheep and ten goats. Karomat pastures her livestock during the day, and at night they return home. In order to increase her herd, Karomat has decided to take out a loan. She goes together with her husband to purchase livestock in the market, because he is knowledgeable about purebred sheep.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Kory

texts.en: S., 36, has been running a little shop selling a small variety groceries. She sells items like cooked ingredients, sweets for kids, and some vegetables to the villagers. She is a widow who has no children and she currently lives alone in her small cottage, in rural area of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. S. needs to borrow a loan in order to purchase a larger variety of groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 33 years old and married without children. He has a store where he sells medicine. Demand for his medicine is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.

Christopher needs a loan in the amount of N50000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Louïse

texts.fr:
B. Louïse est âgée de 41 ans. Louïse est originaire d'Adjohoun, un village du département de l'OUEME dans le sud BENIN. Louïse est mariée à HOUEZEHOUDE François, un forgeron de profession. Louïse est mère d'une fille de trois (3) ans qui est à la maternelle. Louïse vit avec sa famille à Agbato, un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Louïse vendait depuis 1988 de maïs en gros et en détails. Mais Louïse a abandonné depuis sept (7) ans cette activité au profit de la vente à crédit des bols, bassines en série, chaussures et autres produits. En effet, Louïse collecte les besoins de ses clients en ces produits et va les acheter à Lomé Capitale du TOGO, pays frontalier du Bénin. A son retour de Lomé, Louïse distribue à chaque client sa commande à crédit. C'est après quelques jours selon la date fixée par l'acheteur que Louïse repasse collecter ses fonds auprès de ses clients. Louïse n'arrive plus à satisfaire bien la demande de sa clientèle parce que sa clientèle a augmenté et que ses moyens financiers ne lui permettent plus d'acheter toute la commande de ses clients. Louïse sollicite alors un quatrième crédit pour couvrir toute la demande de ses clients.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Louïse B., 41, comes from Adjohoun, a village in the province of Oueme in the south of Benin. Louise is marrïed to François Houezehoude, a professional blacksmith, and is the mother of a 3-year-old daughter who goes to pre-school.

Louïse lives with her family at Agbato, an outlying neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Starting in 1988, Louïse sold maize, wholesale and retail. 7 years ago, she left this business in favor of the sale of bowls, sets of basins, shoes and other items. As it happens, Louïse finds out what her customers need in terms of this sort of product and goes to get the orders in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Bénin.

On her return from Lomé, Louïse distributes each customer's order on credit. Then, several days later, according to what has been agreed on with the customer, Louïse comes back to collect her money. Louïse is never able to satisfy the demand of her clientele completely because it has grown and her financial means don't allow her to buy everything that has been ordered.

Louïse is requesting a fourth loan to cover all the needs of her customers. The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bowls, sets of basins, shoes, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es: El grupo Jazmin se encuentra conformado por 12 personas D. la cuales la mayoría se dedica desD. hace varios años atrás al comercio D. distintos artículos como ser: cosméticos, ropa nueva, ropa usada, ropa americana, refrescos, empanadas, pan y comida en general. En el grupo también hay socios como la presidenta por ejemplo que se dedica a realizar trabajos D. sastrería y tiene una experiencia en este rubro D. 36 años. También hay socios que se desempeñan como mototaxistas.
texts.en:
The Jazmin group is composed of 12 members. The majority of them have been involved in sales for several years. They sell various items like cosmetics, new clothes, used clothes, American clothes, soft drinks, empanadas, bread and food. Also, there are members, like the president, for example, who do tailoring work. She has 36 years experience in this field. There are also members who work as motorcycle taxi drivers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: Nguyễn Thị X. (20203050037) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Nguyễn is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 07 (7). Nguyễn is married and has two adult children. Nguyễn raises pigs for sale and has been engaged in this business for over ten years, earning approximately 2,500,000 IDR a month. Nguyễn joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her first loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050038) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business. 2. Nguyễn Thị X. (20203050039) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business. 3. Nguyễn Thị C. (20203050040) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business. 4. Vũ Thị H. (20203050041) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Nguyễn Thị X. (20203050037) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Nguyễn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 07 (7). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Nguyễn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyễn kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 IDR. Nguyễn đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050038) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị X. (20203050039) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nguyễn Thị C. (20203050040) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Vũ Thị H. (20203050041) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về DINARI: Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma O. is from the town of Santa Maria, Tangub city. She is 30 years old. Vilma is married and has 3 children, infant or school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising and selling pigs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for raising pigs. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for family needs and for her children's education.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for raising pigs

loans.name: Murodchon

texts.ru: Муродчон – мужчина средних лет (34 лет), женат и отец 3-х детей. У Муродчона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 35 овец и 15 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Муродчон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Муродчона пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Муродчон за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Муродчон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Murodchon is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. He owns a herd of small livestock, consisting of about 35 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a homemaker, but also processes wool during her free time. Every morning, Murodchon takes his herd to the mountains to graze and takes the herd back in the evenings. Murodchon only has a small quantity of large livestock and wants to use this new loan to purchase two average-size bulls. After feeding them for 3-4 months, he could sell them at a very good price. Murodchon is glad to be working with us because the financing helps him very much.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Povi Inès

texts.fr:
A. Povi Ines est mariée et mère de trois enfants.  Deux de ses enfants sont scolarisés.  Son troisième enfant ira à l’école quand il sera plus âgé.  Son mari a récemment perdu son travail mais il cherche quelque chose d'autre.  Inès habite avec sa famille à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin.  

À Cotonou, Inès vend des produits diverses y compris charbon de bois, sachets de l’eau, et cartes de recharge.  Inès possède une machine qu’emballe de l’eau dans les sachets.  Elle a déjà profité de trois crédits d’ALIDé.  Peu à peu, ces prêts l'ont aidé à augmenter son travail.  Actuellement, Inès vend chez elle.  Les gens du quartier y achètent sa marchandise.   Elle voudrait avoir un prêt d’ALIDé afin d’acheter plus des articles qu’elle vend.  Pour développer son activité dans le future, Inès aimerait vendre en gros des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
A. Povi Inès is married and the mother of three children. Two of them are in school. Her third child will go to school when he is older. Her husband recently lost his job, but he is looking for something else. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In Cotonou, Inès sells various goods, including charcoal, baggies of water, and recharge cards. She has a machine for packaging water in baggies. She has already taken advantage of three ALIDé loans. Little by little, these loans helped her to augment her work. Currently, she sells out of her house. The people in the area go there to buy her merchandise. She would like to obtain an ALIDé loan in order to buy more of the merchandise she sells. To develop her business in the future, she would like to sell recharge cards wholesale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, recharge cards, and baggies of water

loans.name: Fota

texts.fr:
Revendeuse de céréales depuis 1997, cette femme dispose d’une clientèle qui grandit de jour en jour. Présentement son stock de marchandises ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tous ses clients, elle veut agrandir son stock et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 16 sacs de maïs.
Elle est mariée, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle  contribue aux dépenses de son foyer.
texts.en:
Selling cereals since 1997, this woman has a clientele that is daily growing. Presently her stock of merchandise does not permit her to satisfy all her customers, so she would like to expand her inventory and is asking for her first loan to buy 16 sacks of maize.

She is married and she contributes to supporting her family with the income from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize

loans.name: Fofoaivaoese

texts.en:
Fofoaivaoese M. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Tiavea A.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Fofoaivaoese owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Fofoaivaoese has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fofoaivaoese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Fofoaivaoese has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Fofoaivaoese is now requesting a new loan of 1200 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Fofoaivaoese plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kalokoh Group

texts.en:
This is Alice Y. M., Musu A. K. and Asha S.. They named their group Kalokoh Group.  They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town which is about twenty-two miles to Freetown. This is their first loan with SMT/Kiva. They have come to seek a loan from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in order to help them develop their businesses. With a loan of Le 500,000 for each, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better sales and consequently improving on their standard of living.

Alice Y. M. (left and also attached top left with her business picture) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with four children. One of Alice children in now a nurse, the other has just written the West Africa Senior Secondary schools Examination, the other is in Senior Secondary School II and the other has just written the National Primary Schools Examinations. Alice sells second hand clothes especially bras, under wears and night dresses. She has been in this business for eight years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy at least one bale of night dress. A bale costs Le 400,000.00

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Adelita

texts.es: Adelita G. D. L. vive en Soyapango municipio D. San Salvador, vive con sus dos hijas Sara D. 21 años, que trabaja; ya que por motivos económicos tuvo que abandonar el sueño D. ingresar a la universidad por lo múltiples gastos que se encuentra Adelita, también vive con ella su otra hija, Claudia D. 17 años D. edad que se encuentra estudiando bachillerato. Adelita posee una tienda ubicada en su casa, el destino del crédito que solicita es para invertir en productos para su negocio, ya que por el momento su mayoría D. productos son las golosinas que su margen D. ganancia es mínimo, es por ello que Adelita quiere surtir su negocio con mercadería que le genere mayores ingresos  que serán D. gran utilidad para sus ella y sus hijas.
texts.en:
Adelita Gutierrez D. L. lives in Soyapango municipality in San Salvador. She lives with her 2 daughters. Sara, 21, is working and has had to abandon her dream of entering the university because of the many expenses that Adelita has come up against. She also lives with Claudia who is 17 years old and is studying for her high school diploma. Adelita has a store located in her house. The purpose of the loan that she is asking for is to invest in more products for her business because when the majority of the products are goodies the profit margin is minimal. For this reason she would like to supply her business with general merchandise that will generate additional revenue that will be very useful for her and her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely V. C. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Sagay, Camiguin. Emely has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Emely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emely is requesting a loan of 4,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 07  hijos, vive en el Sector Charapata, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/.  300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 400.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde, el mismo que será vendido en la feria semanal.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y los encuentros
texts.en:
Sra. Brigida is a member of the September 8th Communal Bank which is located in the District of Acora, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and has 7 children. Brigida lives in the Charapata region and has an elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela R. for one year. Her initial loan of 300 soles enabled her to buy sheep.

Brigida is currently requesting a new loan of 400 soles to acquire additional sheep for fattening. She plans to sell them at the weekly fairs. Her greatest wish is to continue working. Brigida enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Jou-Ann

texts.en: Jou-ann, 21, is the young mother of a one-year-old. She has been married to her husband, Melchor, for three years. She is a rice farmer and is happy that her rice crops are now flowering. She needs supplies for her farm to ensure her crops will be healthy and will produce a good harvest. She applied to loan 12,000 PHP form CEVI. This loan will help Jou-Ann fund her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 46 años y 06 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella.Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos y lleva 05 años en el negocio, ubicada al frente de la Plaza, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.Carmen, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women) Community Bank, located in the Bellavista district of the Bellavista province of the Department of San Martin. This single 46 year old woman is the mother of 6 children, 1 of whom she still supports. She has always been characterized by her spirit of perseverance and her desire to progress through her own efforts. This has lead her to open her own business selling kebabs - something she has done for 5 years. Her business is located in the front of the Plaza in a well placed spot with good foot traffic. Little by little she endeared herself to her customers, and now she reports a strong business. Currently she continues in the same business, and she is very pleased with her job. With this 2,000 sol loan she will purchase basic ingredients including bags of rice, eggs, Creole chickens for making “juanes” (traditional Peruvian dish of cassava, rice, and meat steamed in a banana leaf), and cooking utensils so that she can provide high quality service and replace her old ones. Carmen feels pleased and at ease with what she is doing, and she is thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement for contributing toward the completion of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients
